eoyOmoe4IoQWfz2qL_ijpQ.text: I have been here in Charlotte for 6 years. This is the 1st time I have been to this diner. The grits here are the best I ever had. All of the food has a great taste and I loved every bit of it. I recommend this place to all that will come to Charlotte, NC.

XSvkBWrpO6hsgA0KmDDDdA.text: This place is great! We had the Shrimp and Grits and the Bubba Breakfast. The biscuits are to die for and the gravy is wonderful. The shrimp and grits demand serious respect. Our server was Delorian. He couldn't have been nicer or more efficient.  We didn't have to wait at all, even though the place was crowded and he was swamped. We definitely plan to return for breakfast soon. Thank you so much for a great dinner and excellent service!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits.

AnZz0i0o23glfffOzBIvOQ.text: Loved this place , dinner was good :)  food is too much to eat though :) I liked the ambience , it's cozy n bright :) I feel bad for eating after my gym though :(

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinner :)

GPZO_XUTBJaFW27hkQcPlw.text: Went here for a late breakfast with the husband.  This place is chrome-shiny and  appears larger on the inside than on the outside.  Our server was abrupt, almost military-like, but she was on it with the service.  My man got the coconut French toast.  He liked the topping, but wished that it was made with thinner bread than the challah.  He also longed for real maple syrup (I have spoiled him).  I ordered the veggie omelet, hash browns and biscuit.  The biscuit was light and fluffy, and the omelet and hash browns were decent.  Hard to mess up eggs, but also difficult to make an omelet stand out.   I like the vintage styled memorabilia on the wall.  The booth where we sat featured "I Love Lucy" and the Rat Pack.  Motown played on the juke box, which added to the retro charm. At the end of our meal, our no nonsense server gave us a sweet, little smile.  That was nice.

NE1g82tDK3Q_xkTO2ONo6w.text: I had the coconut toast and it was excellent! Waitress was really nice as well! Will definitely come back!

HmqHIQEZNvfjiV5c4vll0w.text: Yesterday, I checked in at Midnight diner, and I am currently beginning my review as I sit at a booth in sleek, but old fashioned diner. As we entered, I was surprised at how big the place was. Everyone was extremely friendly, and we escorted directly to a booth. Despite the fact that we were we seated immediately, it took a while before someone came and took our drink orders.  When our was finally taken, it seemed as if it took a while for our food to arrive.  It can be a very frustrating feeling when you arrive at a locale before others and you see them get their food, finish their meal and pay before your own food ever arrives!  I was literally salivating in anticipation for our meal to arrive at our table.  Once it finally made it, my girlfriend and I immediately dug in.  My girlfriend ordered the chicken tenders w/fries and a side of collard greens.  She said the collard green were just okay... they were not seasoned with any kind of meat and were bland. She enjoyed the tenders, saying they were, "moist and tender".  I tasted the chicken tenders and can concur - they were excellent.  Some of the best tenders Ive had around Charlotte.  However, we both gave the fries a thumbs-down.  They weren't crisp or hot.  In fact they were the exact opposite - soft and room temperature.   I ordered the Midnight Special with my eggs being scrambled w/cheese, bacon, hash browns "covered and smothered", and I was allowed to substitute a pecan waffle for just $.50 more.  Everything was cooked to my liking.  The hash browns were PERFECT.  I thought the eggs were a little hard.  I prefer my scrambled eggs light and fluffy.   The best feature of Midnight Diner is its versatility.  You can go there early in the morning before work, for lunch, or late - after a night of carousing with friends.  In addition, they have any and everything you could possibly want to eat, and breakfast is served all day!   I felt like my experience at Midnight Diner was lessened by the service, because the food was above par.  Yes, our waitress was extremely cordial, but she was anything but prompt.  I went there looking to be in-and-out quickly and was greatly disappointed.   In closing, I've heard so much good stuff about this spot that I def want to go there again.  I'll just go when I've got a whole day to burn and I'll try to sit in a different section.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Tenders w/fries...Tenders are VERY TENDER!!!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scrambled eggs w/cheese, along with hashbrowns &#34;smothered and covered&#34;

_MtljWUqhaw78WpYrj889A.text: Ok i thought this place was ok over all. I wanted to love this joint but at least for this first visit I just liked it. As in its ok. The California burger was so so. It's described in the menu as a third pound burger. And for $9 you would expect it's gonna be a third pounder. And it was just a normal size hamburger. Like a 1.50 McDonald's sized hamburger.   Bottom line- if it's late night and other places are closed - this is a perfectly good place to eat. If it's 7pm, go to Hardys.

txMVxroaWjxiswxeEPCaOQ.text: THE Place to go in Charlotte for some good comfort food. You have to get the Fried chicken it's a must! The biscuits are delicious too and the grits and friendly service. It's a different kind of crowd after hours but I have still experience good service. Anyone visiting I will always take them to the good ole Midnight diner

3S3iUTUUD67qbeM25kx0xQ.text: I'm an African American. I just left this place after waiting more than 5mins just for someone to say hello and seat my party of 4. I waiting while 3 servers walked by me and didn't provide any customer service. After I made a scene because it was a line at the door and several African American patrons waiting with seats available, I rang the bell on my phone and finally the hostess who was standing at the register looking sat us at a table. After less than 3mins sitting down, the owner asked us to leave because two patrons were upset about whatever was said which wasn't said about us about they way they had us waiting at the door. So w proceed to get a reason and eventually left.  I don't care how legendary or great the food is, TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.  CJ

SrxBqQYR1vOFVw7howaXlA.text: This little diner has a special place in my heart. The staff is always so welcoming and friendly and the breakfast here always hits the spot. I walk past this diner every morning when I head to work and the wonderful smell of waffles make the morning walks in the cold a little less harsh.   And in case I forgot to mention, the breakfast is amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waffle sandwich. (Not on the menu, but easily made with breakfast items)

SLAzUPsDLIlXphTfuErrkQ.text: They never noticed us for a few minutes and we sat at the Bar up close and personal the guy that sat down right before us and ordered at the same time got his to go order about 20 minutes for we realize that our food and never even been ordered and then they tried giving to someone else's food after paying a $10 taxi cab there and another $10 taxi cab fare to get back

One time I was in there with friends and all the customers just broke out into a sing along to the music that was playing and it was absolutely hilarious but back to the food I enjoy the food the grits are good I love the firecracker shrimp.

The "Bubba" was an opened faced biscuit with scrambled eggs, sausage gravy, hasbrowns and sausage patties.  It was perfect!   My companion had the shrimp and grits and was very pleased with the flavor and quality.   We will definitely be back!

0_RvEYGRSHgS86DRwmvoGA.text: The service was excellent!! Very festive! The food was good except a waffle is to be severed hot enough to melt butter and the chicken was definitely reheated not freshly cooked.

gZc4E_Ct9kKCVaUCIXmpLg.text: This place was awesome. Arrived in Charlotte later than expected and several restaurants were closed. Did some research and found this place relatively close to the hotel.   Absolutely a great choice. We had chicken and waffles, shrimp and grits and the kids had chicken strips and fries.   Went back the next day for desserts. The bourbon pecan pie was great (a little annoyed that the server felt the need to let me know how much the per slice price was, I bought three slices after he quoted me)  I wanted to ding them one star for waiting so long to acknowledge our presence, but the food was so good. I won't be so forgiving next time, so please do better ;-)

EWbx9hHbjlARtDib0XIXHA.text: Standard diner eats, it served its purpose. Staff was very friendly , I got the steak and eggs with hash browns and babe got the meat lovers omelette , I didn't take pics bc it wasn't photo worthy  , not my first choice for yummy breakfast spots in Charlotte but like I said it got the job done .

SoHswA8NQWyA2Ga-h1hXMw.text: Update: Jetaun was an amazing server this go round. The food almost felt like it tasted better on this trip. I have no complaints and am so happy I found this lovely diner.

6XgLt-naWzfOlaLmYAKleg.text: Reading other reviews, both good and critical, there are some valid observations. Nothing about this place feels upscale, the crowd is a mix, it's always busy, the Shrimp & Grits is incredible. While Texas Pete is available and punches up the flavor, the creole sauce is robust enough to stand alone, the green peppers maintain a crunch of freshness, and the grits are smooth. Don't know if they can blacken the shrimp, but that would be a nice finish to this otherwise excellent plate the menu says is made to order. Five stars is based on this experience

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smells incredible! So good! And they serve giant bottles of Texas Pete for add even more kick to the creole sauce
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great diner feel. Open 24/7

_hFMVldqQzawE-dpSqzAGQ.text: Seriously amazing.  Two of us went for a late breakfast on a Saturday. Attentive, cheerful waitress who helped us order in a way that would be cheaper for us.  I've only been here once and only ordered 3 items so I can't vouch for consistency BUT I can say that everyone on the planet should try their fried chicken wings with the coconut French toast. WOWWWW. The French toast was not super sweet like you'd expect, so syrup on top of those with the wings was perfection. I'm a big roscoes chicken and waffles fan and was worried this wouldn't meet my expectations lol. It was different but just as good. Also I've never had such buttery home fries in my life. Everyone go here right now!!!

jR5Vhz9fnrKKgnzj42OrQQ.text: I highly recommend eating here. My family is visiting from Boston and we ate here for breakfast and we loved it so much that we went back for dinner. The kids had the French toast and and one plate definitely could have been ordered to split for all of them. Everything we ate was delicious. Absolutely not one complaint. Great customer service.

mNpQrbpXtdRSBoK55PenMQ.text: Good diner food and prices, average service, great hours.

KvEtypQbreR-K_mkmMxWqw.text: I refuse to eat at a places where the staff is rude. The very first person I encountered when I walked in the door had an attitude problem (the hostess). So we turned around and walked out the door. I don't care if the foods good. There's tons of great places to eat in Charlotte with friendly staff.

O-JIJeE14GNCsRQuMoUsQA.text: When I moved to Charlotte 4 years ago I was a steady customer to this place. I was extremely happy there was a 24 hour diner in the neighborhood, but unfortunately this is not the case anymore.  This place has gone completely downhill since I moved to this city.  First and foremost, this place has attracted a lot of sketchy people in the recent years and has had its share of violence on occasion.  Aside from this, the food is poorly prepared in contrast to how it used to be, and the staff is nowhere near as friendly as my earlier experiences dining here. Last but not least, management is extremely unprofessional.  On my last visit the manager begins screaming at the top of her lungs saying "this isn't uptown cabaret if you finished your food get the hell out of my restaurant!!"  I understand they need to clear the space for new customers but this honestly made me feel extremely uncomfortable.  I've never even seen this kind of unprofessionalism in a restaurant before, not even in a Waffle House. If people are loitering in your restaurant, handle this properly like professional management should by going to each table to see who's already paid their bill....comon now!!!  The owners truly need to hire better management to clean this place up.  I give this place 2 stars just because it's open 24 hours.

BSwvAZYnAvX0OCPD9RAHcA.text: Greasy and mediocre, definitely did not live up to the hype!  This place always has a wait so I figured it would be good but that was not the case. I tried their burger special and was less than impressed. This is probably only good at 2am after a night of drinking.

74cYWNMzA6IadIze2OzJqA.text: Went in to warm up and wait for crowds to clear after the ACC championship game. Diner has a unique personality, as does the wait staff. Sorry to say the food was not good: chicken soup was warm, not hot; grilled ham n cheese was cold enough that the cheese did not melt; sausage was overcooked and shriveled up; waffles were cold. On the other hand, chicken strips were good and the grits were tasty and hot. Overall, an underwhelming experience.

LKX1YC1qiWsATu9K8SEM6w.text: Great tasting food.  Very, very lively atmosphere, especially late and in the wee hours. You'd best leave your expectations of a formal, proper restaurant at home. This is a very free flowing atmosphere. And the food is good. Fried chicken and shrimp with grits are my favorites.

vePqVkOUlzIVgcfoFvV_sQ.text: Holly, our waitress, recommended the Carolina Burger...it was delicious!!! The service was fast and the food was amazing. I can't wait to come back to try the chicken & waffles and visit our girl Shelly, the hostess with the mostest! She was so friendly and welcoming! I highly recommend this to anyone visiting Charlotte.

jKVO8Bia3Qwm2sZ9uDzFTg.text: As diners go, I think that this is a very serviceable and decent place to go.  I think that might seem like damning with faint praise, but I really mean it.  Actually I'd give it a 4 stars for the breakfast (ate there a year ago and really loved the MIdnight Diner special).  Had the famed chicken and waffles, and while I'd give the chicken wings a definite 4-5 stars (so flavorful, so crispy, so moist!) I thought the waffle was "meh" and the side of broccoli I got (to be healthy) was also fine--plain steamed broccoli.  And the hash browns this time around were a bit soggy (a year go they were crisp and delicious--maybe the cook was off on this round).  My husband had the BLT and coffee and said it was good.  Cousin had the seasonal fruit--which was your basic melon/grapes/pineapple combo and the chicken soup (which she said was good but on the salty side).  I'm willing to give them another try--maybe they'll get another star next time.

D91gcW6V9vBrgzft7AXXRA.text: Food is the only reason I give this place a star...food was good....service on the other hand is the reason I will never return to this diner. It was my first time there and definitely my last. My server was the dark skinned black lady, tall with long braided hair....Jesus Christ if she wasn't the rudest server I've ever met...I work with pretty terrible servers but she was not afraid to just be blunt and rude and mean. She tried making us feel stupid and patronized us the entire time...we came in at 4am so maybe she was just aggravated with her job but Jesus you can't speak to people the way u did to us...will never come back

I1Jswuw2omrtmDsAS_A2Cw.text: We went on a week day, late afternoon. There were other folk scattered about but it wasn't halfway full. Service was pretty good.  Some things I didn't like: I ordered hot tea. My cup came without a saucer and no spoon. I wasn't asked if I wanted lemon. Also, the cup was pretty thick which made it hard to sip from.   I agree with the previous reviewer about the music. I heard cursing in at least one song and there was a family that had young children with them.  The chicken and waffles were pretty good. We'll probably go back again.

i8oCDrwzWgJV7_LomM_XNg.text: I visited this restaurant for the first time on Tuesday and it was quite an experience. While first walking in, it reminded me of Waffle House, however the environment was different and I don't believe it is a chain restaurant. My server for the morning was a woman named Dana, and she was very nice, respectful, helpful and patient (because the person I was with was ordering a large amount of food). She even helped him figure out how to get everything he wanted at the lowest price possible. He ordered some of the chicken wings they have on the menu, and they were some of the best looking chicken wings I have seen in my life. Plus they weren't baby wings, they were full large sized wings. I wanted to try them but sadly, I'm allergic to wheat. My food (hashbrowns and bacon) was good. I had already eaten prior to going to the restaurant, therefore I did not order much. My food was great though and so was service.

oW6AI0kZjmqz0vU-bN1O7Q.text: Another amazing breakfast place in Charlotte! We had to wait for a table for a long time because we went on a Sunday morning, but it was well worth it! The food was excellent!

72xk4IRyPxfjsJm-jgftQA.text: It's a diner & you never really know what the vibe is going to be until you are inside.  I will say that the service is usually good and I LOVE THEIR FRENCH TOAST!!!!  I don't know what the other reviewers said about the music, but it is pretty hard-core and too loud for the space.  It's a diner not a club, so I didn't like that aspect of it.  The diner hasn't been there too long, but I can see it going downhill fast if they don't take themselves seriously enough.

4Tzx7B4WFhcf2GgwloOehA.text: Well, it's no WaHo, but as everyone here seems to reiterate, it IS right down the street...  With some friends in town this weekend, after a night of carousing, we were looking for a basic breakfast place and decided to walk down to Midnight Diner to check out the fare.  I have to say, I'm not as impressed/delighted with old-timey-style diners as maybe I'm supposed to be... they always seem a little too affected for my taste.  The good thing is that because of the family clientele Midnight Diner seems to attract (at least on a Sunday morning), it seemed like a relatively clean place; the bad thing is that it's kind of sterile.  That said, the breakfast food was good - standard breakfast food, but they didn't eff anything up.  The portions were gigantic and left us all feeling like little round butterballs that had to be rolled home through Southend.  My biggest contention?  Price.  This may look like an old school, old-timey diner from the outside, but when you look at their breakfast prices, you realize it's just another "Uptown" Charlotte, Super Charlotte People flytrap.  $9 for a basic breakfast combo?  Well, OK.  To each her own.

K0BvsawpN0W3tyZhr0TX7A.text: Good food, good atmosphere.                                       ...I'm particularly fond of the chicken slider.

G4L6e0jdJ1r4r_0Ph26P5A.text: I will throw up in my mouth a little every time I think of the meal they tried to serve me here. This is a polished dump for late night drunks that don't know any better. If the food quality was just a little worse they could can it and put a cat on the label. I've now eaten lunch and breakfast here and to call it food that someone else has already thrown up would be too kind.

puVMl3A6TDvoLV_hiSF0UA.text: Great shrimp n grits. Nice down-home diner feel. This will bless your life. If you're in Charlotte, I suggest you stop in. Dooo iiiittt!

3TOw9KE_RE-c1UrzJYukuA.text: This is my favorite diner in all the cities in which I've lived.  Number one, they serve alcohol which is fantastic and number two, the solid diner fare is accompanied by some of the friendliest staff I've met.  There is one waitress who puts on old school funk and sings like a pro--I love it when she's there.  It can get a bit crowded and loud, but it's a crossroads of life in the Queen City.

FopQ1qy2tWMHIJ6mZDIwpQ.text: Shrimp & grits are consistent and always on point. Riding them extra spicy is always good. Midnight diner is always fast with the order and with the delivery of the food, no matter how busy they are. And the best part is they're open 24 hours!

But the menu does have a lot of things to choose from. I'm used to very authentic shrimp and grits so when I receive this soupy concoction I was extremely underwhelmed but I was very hungry so I ordered was like two meals and I had something to eat in the morning when I woke up at the hotel. So it's a cool place to go if you're hungry

d68DBMg-tbdAcDFiVJ9zLA.text: This visit was not like others, I usually love this place but today it was all under expected Whitney our server was not attentive at all we ordered burgers with cheese and did not get cheese yet we were charged for it on top of that we had to ask an other server for jalapenos as she did not come around the food was flavorless, we had to ask for an other bottle of ketchup when I asked for water with lemon I repeated to her 3 times and again she did not pay attention and I received just water(note I had a paid drink, water was additional) I was just not feeling this place today and unfortunately this time around I had brought a friend and I was bragging about how good it was, Midnight Dinner you let me down

UctbTbFX4Vp60_cYOJTYyg.text: This is an amazing place to visit if you are visiting from out of town! Very wide variety of food options! Prices are affordable and service was great! I stepped outside the box with my purchase and was not disappointed!

Z3LQdsMCeGGJAn5ZaT-Yhg.text: Shrimp n' Grits!!!  Shrimp n' Grits!!! Shrimp n' Grits!!! If you like or even if you're not usually a fan of shrimp and grits, do yourself a favor, go there, wait through the long line of people trying to get through the door and even willing to wait outside no matter the weather, and order this PERFECTLY PREPARED, HEAVEN ON A PLATE, ITLL CHANGE HOW YOU SEE SHRIMP AND GRITS EVERYWHERE ELSE! We drive 30-45 minutes just have the creamy goodness that is perfectly seasoned, and nice and fluffy and buttery biscuit. It's a diner, so don't go there expecting valet, or even clean tables. But you'll forget about everything around you, while you shovel your delicious meal down your throat. Go get you some!

fNuqAYoVPILsz3wHuW56yw.text: It was my first night in Charlotte, it was late but I was hungry. I decided to Yelp a restaurant in the area and the Midnight Dinner came up at the top of the search. So I decided to give it a try.   Even though it was late the restaurant was packed to capacity by people who were dining in and people who ordered to go. The restaurant is kind of small but it was clean and I was comfortable. This must be the spot after the club on Saturday nights. There was a sign on the door that said no weapons past this point which was different for me because I had never seen that before. They also had an armed police officer inside who was very friendly with the customers.  I ordered chicken wings and my daughter ordered shrimp and grits. I had to send my chicken back because they were not cooked hard enough for me. The waitress was extremely nice. She took my plate back without an attitude. It took a while for her to bring me another plate of wings but the second time the wings were cooked just right. I nibbled on my daughter's delicious shrimp and grits until my wings returned so I was just fine. But my daughter wasn't happy because I was eating all her food..oops.   Although everything tasted delicious and I prefer eating at the restaurant, I will be calling ahead next time to order my food to go.

5TXxLcie7ei93ZJqBeoOtA.text: Awesome food and service.  We are here for allstar weekend from Delaware. We recommend them to all

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome food and service! We are here for allstar weekend from Delaware

NXK5F4n4tYJ22VLaXmAqMA.text: One of my friends recommended this place. We stopped by, she  told me to try shrimp & grits so I did ! It was so good !!! First time ever trying shrimp and grits.  The prices were okay. I Paid about $13, the taste is indescribable. It had a taste of a world class resturant. This has to be the #1 item on the menu

u0zcotgNWyyfVCDMl_q5_Q.text: What a cool spot. The theme is great with the atmosphere and music. Walked in for lunch was expecting a wait but they sat us down really quick. Our waiter was amazing too and the food came out really quick. I ordered the chicken and waffles. Those chicken wings where so moist it was amazing. I noticed almost half the people where ordering the shrimp and grits so I've gotta try that next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles &amp; steak and eggs

JmPAVDePr98TL5PuSOwWng.text: There honestly isn't much to say that already hasn't been stated. Staff was friendly and attentive. The restaurant is on the tight side inside but it was very clean.  I got shrimp and grits and they were delicious. Definitely more than worth the $9.99 price.   I will definitely be returning to try out some of the other food options.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits- comes with biscuit

dR_NlYj_4kIBAz-NhAKF7A.text: So I've been here twice. Once I don't remember (I had a little too much to drink) and the other time was for dinner. That one I did remember ;-) and I was sober so this is a LEGIT REVIEW!! I went with a party of 4 and around 9pm. We were seated right away, but beware- on weekends/late night/ Sunday mornings you will wait for a table.   I ordered the shrimp and grits and I thought they were awesome! Very good flavors. It was sweet (from the grits), but the sauce made it a tad spicy- just up my alley. There were about 8-10 shrimp in my dish so for the $12 this dish was a steal. When I return I will definitely order the shrimp and grits again. I've heard it's the token item here and they did not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits! Creamy, spicy and delicious!

Iwn97IgPAujMXYP_jLcQoA.text: I drove up to Charlotte yesterday to take my girls to Paw Patrol on Sunday and looked up some places to eat after the show. My girls are a little picky so I needed a place that has a bit of everything and Midnight Diner was a great fit! The inside and outside was very cool. Our waitress was really nice and the food came out quick! I will definitely like to come back for another meal.

2fYt8y_upzgiGtJFNktxbw.text: This place is highly overrated, I've been twice and disappointed each time. First time I got a breakfast sandwich which was just ok and very dry. Second time I had an eggs breakfast and the bacon was half cooked (no crunch), the eggs were unscrambled (egg chunks) the toast was not really toasted and only 2 pieces of the 4 had butter (very little). My friend had chicken & waffles and the chicken was not seasoned, the waffle was good but hey my 5yr old can make a waffle. The only thing that was good is the grits, so unless you're going for shrimp & grits save your money. This place does not live up to the hype AT ALL. Try Graham Street Grill up the street, it's not a dine-in place but the food is MUCH better & HALF the price plus they have REAL home fries. Breakfast will run you less then $5 which is more then either of my meals from here were worth.

Q3y5pusswggSPmUdCp_uqw.text: My first American diner. It was as if I'd walked into Pop's milkshake shop in Riverdale(Archie comics). In short loved it. Ordered the chicken with biscuits, steak and eggs (wish I'd ordered it medium rare rather than well done) and the hot cakes platter( we were 4 people). It cost about $60 (including the tip). Once again I ordered iced tea, can't get enough of the stuff. It was the perfect breakfast. Our server, Greg was great. Actually the whole staff was. I highly recommend it, and believe me guys, I do not like every place I go to eat. I just write reviews for ones I actually would go to again. Also I got a (2nd) refill in a disposable cup for my iced tea...i mean COME ON. Yay!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Refill for the way
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 chicken with 4 cheese mac and cheese and onion rings.

jg2708QbbKjX1qQ-c9L6-g.text: It's the place to be at all hours... come in late night and enjoy the show or come during slower hours and just enjoy the diner. Great food.  Chicken n waffles always a win Shrimp n grits. Win  Banana pudding normal.  Servers ... well let's just say they should have their own menu Hahahaha .

Z-XCd5wUG3IWwAoYimXp7w.text: Stopped into Charlotte totally on a whim with an incredible appetite. Midnight Diner definitely delivered! Small joint with private parking. The menu had great options for whatever your mood. Service was friendly & pretty quic. The shrimp & grits was amazing...very flavorful. We also ordered the chicken & waffles. The chicken was crispy and the waffle tasted like cake!   I sure hope to get bake to this place

8GLyYsUqSbJC1YTr8NviJQ.text: Yeah so I needed my fat pants for breakfast after eating at Midnight diner! I couldn't resist and ordered the Bubba, which is biscuits covered with scrambled eggs and cheese, and then covered in sausage gravy...shut the front door it was good!!!  You know it's good when you need a nap after breakfast.  The staff said their slogan should be "Eat here for food comas!"  I agree.  My husband ordered the chicken and waffles with no complaints.  This uptown gem is a must for breakfast even if not staying uptown overnight.  Oh and it was packed at 9am on a Sunday (most places don't get busy until 10).

ZNu87u1MMeRoYoE6gy8dLw.text: I had but a simple cheese omelet, but, it definitely beat out all the others I have tried, except for mine!! Fries, (hand cut), were tasty with just enough spice to give them a slight kick! Overall, worth the trip and time!!

8Me1TePl2EOwdziRnAfQSA.text: My 10 year old sez "The food is delicious but you will probably eat so much of it that you will be full."  I had a bad turkey club earlier this week so I needed to wipe away that memory.    Great classic  diner vibe, good service.

2_BzINlehKVfauLJqfAdrA.text: The shrimp and grits is so good my mouth is watering typing this. My husband and I always order it like an appetizer to share. Everything here is great. We love the burgers and the fried chicken is a must. The French toast is super thick and fluffy. Afforable, filling, delicious soul food. Go! You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Death by chocolate cake and coconut cake
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

leau_iL2YNbGOD9mhgbyVg.text: This place was ok when we came in the hostess was kind of rude. We didn't get a waitress until we asked for one. When we eventually got a waitress he was cool kinda sarcastic. The food was great the hash brown just needs more salt GRITS ARE PERFECT would come again.

uCerBIML_7FEhHFSZZMOLQ.text: Waitress got our order wrong 5 times. Brought food to the table, took it back, brought the same exact plates back out several times. Finally when we told them to cancel the order, they mysteriously found our food was ready to be brought to the table. The waitress even looked at my friends and informed them I was being "a meany" because I told her we had waited for food for 45 minutes and that I couldn't believe after the first mess up she couldn't get it right. Unacceptable. Then we were required to pay for our food even after the entire fiasco. Absurd.

8bhOhL11MKGqT4PRmISulw.text: Cool decor and friendly staff. I got the Midnight Special which consisted of 2 eggs any style, choice of a meat, and 2 pancakes. I got my eggs scrambled which were nice and fluffy, sausage patties were a bit overdone, and the pancakes were perfect. It took a while to get our checks and we were only checked on once by our waitress but they were swamped. Overall, would come again.

SWEjPLwOS5aLeXmO2b5liA.text: Thank you Midnight Diner for not disappointing. This place has the best atmosphere and service and the food is amazing. I'm so glad we made it here while in Charlotte and I believe this place will become a regular stop on our go to places in Charlotte.

lmJGlO1a0xsg-0h4AfUn3Q.text: AKA the 8th wonder of the world... Midnight Diner is like Disney for drunk/hungry young professionals after a night out in Crown Town.

qRR2GWoTpw4-n4WDGn4Mwg.text: Get the livermush!! It is heaven! With the sausage biscuit, grits, and sweet tea..just what is needed after a long run!

4RhmrbtzRbZr2QW1ms20VA.text: Is a review really necessary?... check the lines out the door when you pass by the place. (normally Sundays and late weekend nights).   You may catch this joint on an off night, but that's okay because the food is still good. Not the best.... but good.

CMcfYMtOWqcCzk2NvcwCrQ.text: MUST try chicken tenders!! Arrived late after a concert - seated immediately!! Our waitress was so nice!! Chicken tenders are out of this world and we also tried the cheeseburger sliders which were fantastic. Food was piping hot and the fries were perfect!! Will definitely be returning!!

t8UWIoSegbwSyt4cIpIVAA.text: My first time here. I had the French toast and my hubby had the Midnight Special. This good was great! Most diners serve decent good, but this place surpassed my expectations. If you are in town visiting, come here for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. French Toast!

mAtTbDQE5iLV02mtxGX4aQ.text: As one of the only eateries within walking distance of my location, MD was slightly above average. Ordered the Midnight Special - two eggs, choice of grits or hash browns, 4 different meats and 2 pancakes (subbed a waffle for $1$)  Pluses - Breakfast served all day. Service was good, not too much, not too little. Coffee served in large, heavy duty mug. Food (with the exception of the bacon) was cooked properly and served hot and relatively quickly.   Minuses - bacon was undercooked and rubbery. Waffle was good but unremarkable. No idea why there's a dollar surcharge to swap out. No sugar substitute on table. 50s music (while appreciated) was waaay too loud. The single $ rating is misleading. Kinda pricey. Can get the same meal with equal quality at a Waffle House for $5 less. For a short order motif, the broad "no substitution" policy is puzzling  Bottom line - if you're in the area, a decent place to dine. Will try the non-breakfast fare another day

wFkPXSLtUFhssvM9UthbtQ.text: I've only ever had the shrimp and grits. I've had it in the restaurant and to go. It's delicious ! It has some sort of zest to it and I love it ! If it wasn't cheesy and me being lactose, I'd go at least twice a week ! Worth trying for sure !

cpp2szTj3oxoBXPui_KJfg.text: Spent 30 mins in line with my pregnant sister which is expected for a pack restaurant. Unfortunately, half the tables were empty. When I asked why no one was being sat down to eat. The employees shrugged their shoulders. I then asked to speak to the manager. She explained it was a busy day and they would sit people when they cleaned the tables. I visibly saw them clean the tables. The managers name was Angie. Would not encourage people to visit here in the future

xz-u-QNlEQfjZ87pr1xWtg.text: 3 words...chicken & french toast. Damn good, some secret batter and french toast was like cakeish.  It's not meant to be fancy, fly or edgy..it's a diner friends so adjust the expectations. It's a diner, like a greasy spoon..great for breakfast, lunch or late night after the bar is out bite and sober up food b/c its 24/7.

7VJwaOOG0oqV-0fy0QNDtA.text: You can expect a wait if you visit this small but popular diner. I'm happy to report that the Shrimp n' Grits dish was worth the wait. Creamy  grits are paired with shrimp covered in flavorful creole sauce. You'll feel satisfied and eager to explore other popular dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Say &#34;yes&#34; to the Shrimp n&#39; Grits dish! Rich creamy grits are served with a spicy and flavorful creole sauce with eight shrimp.

djS7VJRCxQ14Dhk81jOMnA.text: The breakfast is outstanding, you have to try the Bubba and the midnight special, food was very fast to come out and was kid friendly  Angela our waitress was very friendly and great interaction with our kids  Overall I would say the best tasting breakfast in Charlotte

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The bubba

v5CI6t1k-ocQ_dWNM5VRCg.text: I have only been here during breakfast hours and have no complaints. I have been about 3x and always gotten the Greek omelet. Service is pretty fast. Last time I went they messed me up by putting the wrong cheese in my Greek omelet, but they quickly replaced it so it wasn't an issue.  There is limited parking on the side of the restaurant and a bigger lot in the rear. Although I have never gotten the chicken and waffles I do know that they serve REAL chicken wings with their waffles which is a plus in comparison to some other places.   I would go here more often for breakfast if it were closer to me. I have never had a problem with any staff. It's a diner so they don't exactly schmooze, they serve and keep it moving! I recommend trying his place for a quick casual meal!

YAuj-Qq-UTpK5joJaHCQsQ.text: The Bubba!!! Hand's down my favorite place to eat breakfast in the QC. Service is great fast and it's cheap!

2spinn7iJ6Q-XyXh1uPTRQ.text: I came here on a late night/early morning 3am munchie trip. Dear lord am I glad that I did. At 3am my biscuit was soft and buttery, my food hot and fresh and my server friendly. Yes there was a group of cop cars surrounding the place because some of the crowd had gotten into a fight and had taken it outside. But that doesn't reflect on the restaurant, the customers maybe. Anyway, I had two eggs over medium, hash browns and sausage with the afore mentioned biscuit. The hashbrowns were my least favorite, a little to greasy, and not really crisp enough, the eggs were cooked well, but the sausage stole the show. Link sausage might I add. Juicy, crisp outside, perfectly seasoned little links from heaven. I'm not a big meat lover, but I devoured all 3 links and dared the hubby to try to steal a piece. All in all, even with the somewhat rowdy crowd, I will be returning. My food was served quickly, the decor was cool and funky and the food was good. In need of a late night bite? Stop by the midnight diner, you will not be disappointed.

M8BMiFiSIjpqLNZheUNZJQ.text: So on a whim I went to Midnight Diner again since a friend was in town for the Holidays and we needed a bit of catching up. It was 10pm I was starving and am also dog-sitting so I didnt want to venture too far from home- off to the diner we went.  Our service was great- both friendly and prompt.   I ordered the Shrimp Platter $11.99 - a little pricey in my opinion but it came with fries, shrimp, and slaw.  Wow the shrimp was awesome- 5 stars for those! They were much bigger than I expected (sometimes you get the tiny ones at diners) and they were cooked just right.  The coleslaw was very fresh and homemade. They did not appear to use a mix so I really enjoyed that as well.   The fries were nothing amazing- but they weren't bad. They were standard- served hot- they are not super salty which is good and they had malt vinegar to put on them : ). They didnt give you a ton but they were heavy on the shrimp portion so I couldn't complain.   Overall I was really impressed - 4 1/2.  I think the price is the only reason for a non 5 star rating being that a diner is usually a bit cheaper but overall I would absolutely get them again!   They seem to be getting their act together in terms of actual quality of food- and that it something I can certainly appreciate.

Q4x40pelLHudrd7m63DVIQ.text: I really really wanted this to be great. It was not.   The good:  - Cool place, great look, wonderful authentic feel  - The story of the diner presented in the vestibule, very cool  - The location is awesome, and it has parking  - French fries are thick steak fries and tasted great   The Bad: Everything else.  - Service started with "I just got triple sat so I'll do what I can" and went down hill from there to "this is why I hate when they run my food for me".  - mac and cheese is baked style with congealed cheese. Probably good when first made but not when served. Ate like leftovers from church picnic  - Philly Cheese steak had hard bread, very greasy, wrapped in paper then cut and served. You are forced to remove this very sloppy paper in order to eat  - "Smothered" hash browns are hash browns with 2 slices of American Cheese put on plate and stuck in melter, the meal served on same blazing hot plate. The worst hash brown I have ever experienced  - Chili on Chili Dog very chili powder tasting with no other balancing flavors  - Burger comes in same wrapped paper. Not as sloppy as cheese steak, but still not a fun way to eat a burger   I will try this again only because I love diners and really want this place to be what it can be. We need a good diner in Charlotte. As of right now, we still don't have one. Maybe tomorrow.

kUsP6knTWGdFY5i-sx6XYQ.text: I had some of the lightest, crispest, sweetest Belgian waffles I've ever had at Midnight Diner.  Don't let the lines discourage you, both times I went on the weekend they moved pretty quickly.  But it's obvious that this place is so popular because the food is delicious!!  Highly recommend for breakfast.

Fspyknsgqp1JfP_RY9VK1Q.text: Their shrimp and grits are fuckin amazing like everyone else stated. Their chicken and waffles are delicious. Would recommend!

eyme2crueeKk12nfyfoRxA.text: Great breakfast at reasonable prices and super friendly service. Worth the wait in case there a line when you get there

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

340bflkSuE2TAcmPVINQrg.text: After an early morning watching EPL at or favorite bar my girlfriend and I were looking for a late breakfast.  As we were near Uptown we though we'd give Midnight a second try, first for breakfast.  We were seated fairly quickly considering how busy things looked but it took quite a while for someone to come over to the table, perhaps 5-8 minutes.  After ordering a fairly basic breakfast it took what fellt like 15 minutes for out food to come out.  While our waitress was thoroughly apologetic for both waits she said it was because they were so busy.  I appreciate the effort but for a diner noon on a Saturday is prime time.  They might as well be short staffed at midnight on a Friday or Saturday.  Food was pretty good, but the burger I had on the previous visit brings down their average here.  Thin, dry and seemingly mostly made of filler and not hamburger.  Overall not a bad experience either time but nothing to keep me coming back either, there are better diner options in town if you're willing to make a small effort.

biJbnupMY-dcqvdg0nOybg.text: Although the food is good, I have to give them a BIG THUMBS DOWN!!  The reason for this is twofold......first of all, when you walk into the Restaurant, the first thing you see is a list of RULES!!  Really......the list includes such things as "No Substitutions" (You can't even get all white meat or all dark meat when you order Fried Chicken).  So if you want something on the Menu, you are forced to order it "as is" and then order something else, if you wanted to substitute.  The Rules also state that you can't order a "Take Out Meal", then decide that you want to eat it there, or in a case I actually saw, a lady ordered take out, but when she wanted to sit down and eat her food while she waited on her ride to pick her up, she was told she had to go outside to eat!!  By the way, did I mention it was extremely humid and in excess of 95 degrees?  This restaurant is not friendly to African-American patrons!!!  The list goes on.....there must be 8 or 10 items on the "Rules List"!  I have been in Restaurants all over the world, Five Star, Diners and Dives, and I have NEVER seen RULES posted all over the place the way this place has them!  I feel like I am in High School eating in the Cafeteria again!  I loved the food, but I don't think I will ever go back because of this.   Also, two of the Waitresses got into some sort of disagreement while I was there and it had to do with something outside and the parking lot.  But it got so bad, that someone called the police and this was late morning, so alcohol was not involved.  Also, Wi-Fi only worked on one side of the Restaurant, and according to a Waiter, its been that way for several months. What a shame.......this is just a poorly run Restaurant which happens to have a good cook/chef.

LcjX-ERO7_lk5ThVdyif9A.text: The first time coming here was during ciaa and the waitress stopped the music to say "if you got your food and ate already, get the hell out of my diner! " Never have I ever experience such poor customer service. How  can an establishment treat their PAYING customers like this?? Solely based on that poor customer service, I would not recommend this diner to my worst enemy.

OhPWZzracZ3W8wnNn_Tjuw.text: Oh blah Midnight Diner why you gotta be like this to me? At this rate I might as well go to Waffle House.  I stopped by here at 11 recently after watching a play in NoDa with my date. Since 11 was pretty early for the drunk hungry crowd we managed to get seated pretty fast and our waitress was charming if inattentive. I sadly stared at my empty water glass for half of the time I was there. So basically the same as usual. "What made you lower your rating then Jimmy?" you ask? Well my usual order is 2 eggs scrambled and tomato slices. Granted their tomato slices taste like tasteless slave tomatoes (yes that's an actual term, look it up!) but they don't exactly have many options that are friendly towards people who don't eat pork or much beef and just want a cheap quick late night munch. Well it's because when the check came and my bill was double what it usually was this time so I glanced down. Usually tomato slices are free, but apparently now they charge $2.00 for 3 all but tasteless tomato slices and this change wasn't listed anywhere on the menu? I think I might've understood like maybe 75 cents for them or something. You can go ahead and call me cheap, but I dare you to order some tomato slices when you go there and tell me they're even worth near $2.00!  Yeah so as much as it pains me to choose a chain over supporting a local business I think I'd much rather just go to WaHo, or even better Mattie's(please think about staying open 24 hours on weekends Mattie!). The prices and quality of food combined with shoddy service here don't really justify the convenience to me anymore.

FSXV6jIo48klRb8Afc0hNg.text: Good food at a reasonable price. Pleasant staff. What more can you ask for. Oh, and late night hours WoW.

wtak2nrdiiNwl9w42smeWQ.text: This is a divey diner just like my favorite places in the dirty jerz.  Great music? Check. Singing waitress who always brightens my day? Check.  Service is dependent on what time of day you are here.  At night its a zoovie, during the day after 12 it is not so bad.  Their chicken biscuit is ridiculous.  The chicken is so fluffy and tasty that I cannot resist one whenever I go.  Their other chicken will sucker punch Price's and put it in a cobra clutch.  I love the traditional breakfast menu and I am sucker for their pancakes as well.  This is definitely a great place to stop feeling hungover and start feeling fat.  Oh what a trade off!

kZx2_lG8untqmRVAywGXEA.text: Ah,....the Midnight Diner.  One of the only places open late all the time so that I can be a super fattie whenever I want.  Let's talk about the decor/environment first.        I've been here at all hours of the day and it's usually a standard mix of people (Obviously the Twenty-something Club crowd is here in the wee hours of the morning) and average "Diner-ish" decor.  What I mean by that is, your standard framed posters of music icons and bright red paint and shiny stainless steel.     Now the food,... it's delicious.  Their burgers are large, tasty and served with gigantic steak fries.  Their Breakfast may be the best selection that  they have.  I highly recommend "The Bubba" which is a huge plate of biscuits and gravy, 2 eggs and my choice of Hash browns and Bacon.  It's at kind of a steep price ringing in at 8 bucks but like I said, it's a huge plate of food.  Their bacon is great and while that seems as if it's not a great feat, trust me it is.  I'm kind of an aficionado.  Today I had a fried chicken breast with a Belgian waffle.  Their waffle had just the right amount of vanilla extract and it challenged me to order a second one.  On the other hand, the chicken was slightly underwhelming.  The breading was just breading that lacked any great amount of flavor and while the actual meat wasn't dry per se, it wasn't exceptionally juicy.  I felt that it was just as good as any fried chicken I've made at home and I'm not a fabulous cook by any means.       The Midnight Diner gets my vote for late night feasting and you can't go wrong with the breakfast!

Y1M2NUSrm6HPJDLlrBdk2g.text: We love midnight diner! Great food, better service and what tops it all off in my book? It was CLEAN!

GVpzUjqnYS6TkyXr_Gizwg.text: I fell in love with the food here...and was soooo disappointed this morning when me and my friend randomly decided on a 5am breakfast excursion, and they had no hot water.Per the waiter, they only had coffee and bottled water...meaning no waffle mix, grits, or a whole lot of stuff (I will assume including clean dishes and silverware? :/). Though the staff was fairly friendly about it...it did nothing for my 5am "grits fix". Definitely left a bad taste in my mouth... normally  nice spot though

9tcsYYUtJ2FKJaAtbAoyfA.text: This is a cool 24/7 restaurant with great food and an awesome look and atmosphere that will take you back to the "good ole days" the only thing that sucked was my waitress she was really crabby and not that friendly other than that it's a great place.

x5rOEveuwCdzVgadreBvcg.text: Why just Midnight?  It should be named Anytime Diner.  Really great spot for grub.  I love the service here and the BLT....mmm.....bacon....:)  My girlfriend and I frequent this place often and yes most of the time it's around or after midnight.  I always have a blast with the waitstaff and they are really friendly, really quick and attentive.  In my opinion this place can be likened to a cleaned up version of a Waffle House or Denny's.  Only difference is they don't yell the order.....DARN :(

vh-u7LoVSV4p7Ujmp1wT5Q.text: Less than a 1 - what a crappy place.  Went on Sat Nite around 2am and not enough help so I can't blame the waitress but seriously I was set at a dirty table and basically stacked the dirty dishes myslef and almost shoved them to the floor after 30 mins. Again not our waitress fault but horrible service and the food is not worth the wait .  You have been warned .

ejIz8SkG2KN-7xgTklkEEg.text: Food was awesome! But definitely not getting a full 5 stars because the service sucked. I asked for sweet tea, never got it. I had to use my friends spoon to eat my food because I was never brought silverware. And I would've asked for it, however we never got checked on. My water stayed empty. We asked for the checks, and waited 30 minutes before the waitress came back to even take the checks. And she had to be REMINDED to come get our cards to run them. Pretty much the worst service ever.

02cE6UTExBdRrjd9bc0fmw.text: I had the 3 wing dinner with French toast and it was delicious. My waitress suggested we get the chicken double fried and it had the perfect bite to it. Will definitely be back to eat this and other items on the menu.

TjJNAj0KMbHi_jtJpk_W0g.text: Fast service short wait and food was amazing. Would recommend if traveling to this area for 3 meals and the wings paid $60.00

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bubba Breakfast
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Club Sandwich
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings

WrdnZGJkkGFUZ0mIJGspYg.text: I love a good diner! There are quintessential elements to a good diner that evoke that sense of nostalgia including vinyl bar stools, row of booths, open kitchen where you can see and hear food sizzling on the grill, delicious & cheap food, and bottomless cups of coffee. Add a friendly waitress that calls you Hon and you've got it all!  Diner food is  everyday comfort food and if it's done well then you're reminded of home. Well, Midnight Diner does it well! The outside of this diner is beautiful! There is Chrome Chrome and more Chrome! The inside of the diner is clean and visually stimulating with plenty of places to sit. You can sit at the counter in one of the vinyl stools or at one of the many booths.   They have a pretty extensive menu with so many good options. 9 pages of options to be exact! They even have a small selection of liquors and beer.  We ordered bacon, scrambled eggs, and toast with a side of fruit and the Shrimp and Grits. The first order was good but the star was the Shrimp and Grits. At the base of this dish are the creamiest grits that I have eaten in a long, long time! Like my Granny's! It's topped off with shrimp, pan sauteed vegetables, and a creamy homemade creole sauce.  The portion was ample and I was completely full by the time I was done. I needed a nap! This dish was delicious from the first to the last bite! Karla, our waitress, was attentive and really sweet!  The other staff were friendly and had a positive attitude despite having to work on Thanksgiving. I was a happy camper and plan on returning to this diner again!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thanksgiving Feast $12.99, y&#39;all!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

wKZETJlZ5rOl2iRPNW_Nvg.text: It's always great to have food late night. After being fancy and dressed up for shows and early dinner late in the night this is what you need. The atmosphere can be weird after 12:00 am but all the drunk people in Charlotte who need food are there after parties :)) Also in the middle of the day it's good to have place which offers pancake and eggs. Very authentic diner and I love here for what it is.

cabXxzLjTTdGZzWIS8JMZA.text: Breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night, hangover cure- Midnight Diner covers it all.   The menu is huge. This is one of those places where if you can't find something you like here, well the problem is probably you. Their fried chicken is delicious (heads up: it does take a little longer, worth the wait). Marinated overnight, hand breaded- get it over a Belgium waffle or French Toast. Shrimp and grits (their most popular dish) is also really good. Burgers, BLT (huge), wings- you can't really go wrong with anything.   The place is not huge, so there's often a wait during peak times. They do have a full bar with beer (including local selections) and liquor. Music is always really great. I found myself dancing in my booth today while chowing down on a grilled cheese and green beans.  They are open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Warning: if you go here late night, just be careful. There have been a few incidents of crime, violence outside of the diner.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. BLT
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles

_eCAEBEXGI_3_Li9H8Xh4g.text: Yummy. Just yummy. I enjoyed the coconut French toast with a side of bacon. The food was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coconut French toast

dPYj-t_DSZ70PgrdO98TfA.text: Love Charlotte!  But this place is everything!!!  While I stayed here in Charlotte, we are here at least 2-3 times!Service is soooo amazing..food was fantastic, good and So on POINT!  Yes!  Love the whole decor, just a great place to eat and hang out with friends!  Lots of smiles here, and friendly people!

eade-wZIkwIZWKjx9unfpg.text: The best shrimp and grits I've ever had! The sauce is phenomenal and the grits are as creamy as can be. I love that it comes with a perfect biscuit. I wish I lived closer so I could eat this weekly. I also loved the mac and cheese and the sweet tea. My friend got the chicken and waffles and loved that too. Our waiter was a real peach. I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

CyR45k2QQyi5iYggInIiZQ.text: This is one of the places that stays open for 24 hours. Warning, there is always a line because it's a well known spot here in Charlotte. I came here around 12am with some friends and the wait was not too long. They seem to have a better process of getting people in quickly than before. Our waitress was okay, she seemed new. I order pancakes, with eggs, bacon, and grits. All Of the food is average except for the grits. However tonight the grits were just okay. Our service was slightly slow with refilling drinks and coming to check on us. It's not one of my favorite spots, but it's an okay spot if you're out late and don't care about a waiting.

j0ud13rTy1FbasBDtg9Xsw.text: Ok so I finally went to this place thinking that since the reviews were great we would try it. My son and I ordered the chicken and waffles. My son ordered 10 wings and I ordered 3. Who is in the kitchen cooking the wings? They were horrible barely seasoned or even darken. I sent my plate back. Next I ordered the Philly cheesesteak sandwich and fries. This wasn't a winner either. Everyone raves about this place but I must have come on a bad day. Metro Diners fried chicken is far better. I still paid for 3 total meals even though I wasn't satisfied with either. They need to do better. Season your chicken! I spent $70 including tip and still left hungry. It's not about the money it's about the quality. Not sure if we will be back! I usually give a place a second chance but the food needs to get better!

MAWlVa6e1g4anEtnIZGW8Q.text: We stopped in for a late night snack. A few people told us to stop here for the wings. I was not disappointed. Very good. A little pricey.

Aac1shbKhMSytM__zlOamg.text: The midnight diner hits the spot it's great for late night eats or a family dinner. There breakfast is always good I suggest ordering chicken and waffles or French toast. As a New York native I'm happy to find this diner.

1Ms_yYaJ0rCDWns6Fyly_g.text: Everything is good! Aside from their famous shrimp and grits and fried chicken, I LOVE the cool ranch wrap. Their Mac and cheese is also delicious. I was skeptical about the macaroni the last time I came and she offered to let me taste it first. (I had told her I came before and it was not good.) Their burgers, wings, and cheesesteak are also very good. If I get breakfast I usually get an omelette and it's always very pleasing. I'm always satisfied when I leave here.

CLgYsU_J5bNGYlFXi2JH9g.text: On  the morning of June 12 at 930am 2019 my wife and I went to midnight Diner for breakfast it was our 37 year anniversary we had waffles and chicken wings the food was hot and delicious they have very good food.we will be back the waitress was very polite thank you for great service.

tHMESApPoUnRAEB0yDoIMw.text: Made an excellent first impression. Any time I come back To Charlotte I'm definitely returning. Shrimp and grits so good they'll make you wanna slap yo momma and her momma ! Great customer service and the waiters were very helpful and friendly.

-Olu1jW7TmTYZvENNMLD8A.text: Came here on a Wednesday night for a celebratory dinner with a friend (but I've been here a million times). We sat at the bar and we were promptly greeted and had our order taken. I ordered the 1/2 French toast, an egg and the cheese grits. My friend ordered the same but with bacon instead of grits. Our waitress was warm and friendly and the other waitresses and waiters chatted us up too.   I don't know if it was all of the chatting and laughing but our food came out in a flash. Everything was hot and delicious. Now anyone can cook an egg but perfectly executed grits and French toast are hard to find.   The french toast was crisp on the outside and fluffy inside with the right balance of egg and milk and cinnamon. The grits were creamy at the cheese was already melting when they arrived which means they were hot and fresh.   The price wasn't bad for all of the food we ordered $13.77 for my half.  As always, Midnight didn't disappoint. Wish I made it here more often. Can't wait to come back.

qzV82mDiTon652rUlpuUrw.text: WAITER WROTE IN A TIP AND CHARGED MY BOYFRIENDS ACCOUNT.  I would say we are quite regulars at Midnight Diner. We ate here maybe once a week before we fell victim to a waiter writing in a tip.  I would say that is the only thing about our horrid experience, but it is not.  Once we got to the diner we experienced waiters coughing in their hands serving food and not to mention our waiter decided to pick food directly from our plate.  I ordered the Midnight Special(which I always got with bacon), but it hit our table with sausage.  I told the waiter I asked for bacon, and he decided to ask me to give the sausage back.  That was not the problem, but the problem was that he had me hand him the sausage off of my plate with a napkin. Now...where was the sausage going?  Was he taking the sausage back to take to someone else's plate?  We still ate because we have faith in Midnight Diner.  Now we love ordering chicken wings at the diner, but this day...they were so unappealing.  The feathers were literally still on the chicken to the point, I had thought they flew to our plate.  We never got a refill and then when my boyfriend asked for a to-go cup....it never appeared.   Oh, but that did not stop our waiter from WRITING IN A TIP! HORRIBLE SERVICE. We usualy tip 20 percent if the service just normal, but this was well below average. We are still waiting on the diner to "consult with their financial advisor".  THIS IS FRAUD. If Midnight diner does not respect their customers' hard earned money then how can we expect them to respect our bodies?? Til this day, my boyfriend has not recieved his money in return....Where is the trust?  It is most def not at the "famous" Midnight Diner.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

0zV-cayeSZ1lUWn6jkC0JQ.text: Jenn is seriously one of the best servers in ANY restaurant we've enjoyed in Charlotte. She was lovely, helpful, made recommendations we LOVED. I'm a coffee snob and she was right--it's excellent! Food was just awesome and every one in our party of five loved every bite.

GKSpZhUXSoYQwNYdQZmauQ.text: Hello.......where have all the diners gone.....well there is one left. I felt as if I were back in NY for a visit. Nice feeling, clean and had that old brooklyn vibe. Wish there were more like this. Plus they have corned beef hash which is so had to find at a diner these days once you leave the Northwest

N7yPOkxsYp9VmLJltjsHlA.text: The Midnight Diner really attracts the late night crew (post-bar) and the brunch crew looking for diner food on the weekends. Expect a wait if coming to the diner late on a weekend night or around lunchtime on a weekend day. It is not uncommon for the line to be outside and down the block.  The diner has a small parking lot, but a lot of the patrons walk to the diner. The food is typical diner food, and it's reasonably priced. If you are looking for greasy diner food and you don't mind waiting, this is your spot! If you're looking for a more upscale breakfast meal, there are awesome brunch options nearby in Charlotte - Tupelo Honey, Toast, Leroy Fox, and the list goes on.

r5V3Kk-rQASQMP7whboKrw.text: Heard this was a Charlotte staple and I wasn't disappointed! This was my first time trying Midnight Diner and everything from the service to the food was on point! My bf ordered the French toast, eggs, sausage, and grits while I had the western omelet with turkey bacon. Delicioso (Kodak Black reference)! Couldn't be more satisfied. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a basic meal, particularly breakfast food.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Excellence

uB0EhtTZrw-9YaxKWsmVUA.text: Food is good, there is always a wait.   I came here with my daughter on a Sunday morning. My three year old had to go to the bathroom, so I told my server that we were going but not done eating. When we went back to the table they had cleared all of our food. My three year old's meal was not even half way finished & my meal was about half way. When the server saw us come back she said thought we left. They politely sat us at a different table and said they would remake our meals, however I told them I didn't want them to remake mine but my daughter was still hungry so hers could be remade. Well it took an additional 30 - 40 minutes to get our new food, and when I got the check they only took off half the price of my sandwich because I had eaten half prior to them taking it. Personally, I found this to be extremely unprofessional, and not customer friendly.

2lALpevDwaO4UJtAIM_DCw.text: I don't think I have ever had a bad meal. Everything on the menu is good. But the grits, I have never tasted grits so good in my life. I usually order Shrimp and grits (best I've ever had), but this visit I decided on chicken and French Toast and again Midnight didn't disappoint. The only improvement is the sweet tea, they have to do better. My last visit the sweet tea was brewed too long and had a bitter taste, no amount of sugar could tame. I would recommend Midnight diner to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

y6Ij8ghbkc1R5oN2Xgqywg.text: Great little diner. We grabbed a quick breakfast here after we landed. The service was great and the food was very good.

cs79h59Wvvf6Egp0b1ztrQ.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast places- but definitely be ready to eat! This is the opposite of a light meal. Midnight diner has great, southern inspired dishes and classic 50s diner atmosphere. Be ready to wait a little because this place is popular!  My favorite thing to get is the Bubba: an open faced biscuit with scrambled eggs, cheese, and sausage gravy on top. It comes with your choice of meat and hash browns, grits or fruit. Wowee- definitely allow time for a nap after this meal!  The chicken and waffles are also delicious and a staple at the Midnight Diner. My take is,  if you go for the traditional breakfast staples you will not be disappointed!

16gkexRLJHV6wQgD1zrbzw.text: It took a while to get seated but hey it's tournament weekend.  My friend and I ordered entirely too much food and it was all good. Rae was our server and she was PHENOMENAL and very entertaining, friendly, knowledgeable, helpful,  and pleasant.  I'll be back to sit in her section.

3NlGfMjOlmJaBL1rx6b7jA.text: Was looking for something to eat after a hanging out downtown Charlotte late one Saturday night.  We arrived around 130am and had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated.    This diner offered more variety than your typical Waffle House.  Friend and I shared the chicken and waffles, and chicken strips which came with fries.  The waffle wasn't good, it was too airy... the chicken wasn't fresh.  The chicken tenders and fries were actually tasty and seasoned well.  The ranch was fresh made and was also tasty.  The sweet tea was good, not too sweet and wasn't watered down.  There was nice R&B music playing that night, which added a nice twist to the dining experience.  We left around 230 and there had to be 50 parties in line waiting to be seated.  There were also several police offices present to ensure things remained orderly.

NYm8DiJlvXpd4BJ6wCAYQA.text: As a first timer in Charlotte, my friend suggested this place to me... even though I was very skeptical since it reminded me of Silver Diner.  It was busy the night we visited but was seated in about 7 minutes.  Looking through the menu... I wasn't sure what I wanted but after checking Yelp and suggestions, a lot of people said Shrimp and Grit, which I asked the waiter on her suggestion and she also recommended it.  Yelp and the waitress definitely did not disappoint me, this was the BEST SHRIMP AND GRIT I have had in a LONG TIME.  Super flavorful and added some eggs on the side with my meal!  TRY IT!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grit

yk5a1ydAb4vt4gzo9XhVxA.text: I've been here before and the food is delicious. The staff  are super nice.  If you ever on Charlotte and Love GOOD COMFORT food, you MUST eat here

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Waffles

ghu9TkXBCSg1PHU1qcTyOQ.text: I had a long blonde Hair in my drink (on the lemon) & what appeared to be the leg of a roach in my sisters grits.  I've always loved the food so if you're going to overlook sanatation issues then I'd get the shrimp & grits. Chicken & waffles is a good second. If you don't want breakfast I'd go with the cheeseburger sliders.  Good luck.

gXBDL-LLwCPdIvM0llzvKg.text: Love this place mainly because they have the best chicken tenders I've ever had!! It's what I've gotten every single visit since I discovered them. They're so juicy and are served steaming hot each time! I recently discovered that if you get them off the appetizer menu, you get a generous 5 tenders and a small serving of fries for super cheap - perfect portion, perfect price. Not to mention the peach-colored sauce that comes with it (smells/tastes like a mix of mayo and hot sauce) is bomb. If you're looking for a cheap late-night meal with friends and don't mind waiting out the guaranteed line, this is the spot to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tender appetizer

g7ZTwmdq2f-mIcW3Qs8Bfw.text: Greeeeeeeeat spot.  Are here three times in one week while in Charlotte for a convention.  Friendly service.  Tammy made me feel like a BFF wanting the best for my experience.  Fried chicken was the best I had in the city!  Hated that the line was out the door on my attempt to go back on my last night...but I understand.  It's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

gVqpn3Vy7cbs1eiJ8WLqAw.text: So i'm pretty biased. I'm here a couple times a week because it's so close. My go to's are philly cheese, meat lovers omelet, and the chicken and waffles. I will say this, their firecracker shrimp grits are amazing. I hate grits and this the only place i'll eat them. It's spicy, creamy, and buttery. But beware if you come after a night out at the bar there's normally a pretty long line

RQ6od5DaDirs6wsW8HiM3A.text: First time there, was so impressed, bought the shirt.   First time there, waitress was great. The coffee was hot, fresh and delicious. The salad was crispy, fresh, and delicious. This was before our reservations elsewhere.   AFTER our New Year's Eve dining, we went BACK to the Midnight Diner for dessert. I wanted the Brownie for Two (but for one) but they were out. SO, I ordered the death by chocolate cake and IT was delicious. It was then I vowed to make a point to go back to Charlotte just to eat a regular meal at the Midnight Diner. The atmosphere is so funkified 50's and the energy is just rockin'!   PS. I could hardly believe how reasonable (to even low) their prices were. The energy was just so amazingly good vibed. I loved it.

AjW2KsqNUEsXtNVlgI2Q3A.text: I enjoy the eclectic mix of staff,patrons, and food. Excellent chicken fingers-love the burgers. Had the omelette today and my only gripe is they used Pam cooking spray. I'm allergic to the ingredients in the spray (my own fault for not asking) but aside from my own mistake the sides were good.

AqTad5L7xnDH8LCByS1u7Q.text: The Black & Bleu was really good. Burgers cooked well done by default but still turned out delicious. Burgers are smaller than average but jammed pack with flavor. Had a pineapple mimosa, which is way better than traditional orange juice. Would definitely come back next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

RpIlghjRvaGHCJAhilkPSA.text: My dad and I came here for breakfast.  I got the hot chocolate with whipped cream on top and smiled like a kid the whole time I drank it.  Hands-down, the grits were the best I've ever had in my life !  Lots of butter in them.  Don't even tell me the calories, don't want to know. I got the scrambled eggs with turkey bacon.  The bacon was excellent.  The pancakes were thick and fluffy.  There was so much food I couldn't eat it all. Dad complained about paying extra for tomatoes, but he's from a small place in Indiana and doesn't understand city life.  Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot chocolate ... beings back memories of my childhood
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast

5TQPP9dExXQ1abE7NhEgew.text: The food is so yummy~  & the service is awesome too. There is this really sweet and cute waitress there named Kriss!!! She's the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits.. On point~

-66enGoyVSzY9aKaEI5EIw.text: The shrimp and grits are FUCKING awesome!!!!! The best shrimp and grits I ever tasted. The biscuit was bussin'! The service was fast, the place was clean. Good music. The tea was bomb. I gotta a new spot!!!!!

olSRspC3abp6ClV2u8CL4g.text: What a fun place to go late night to see the staff cut-up with impromtu dance parties and witty salty come backs. The energy in this place- no matter how long you have to stand in line to get in- makes it all worth it. The food is good- I got chicken and French toast and my friend had a Carolina burger. Both meals were satisfying and delicious. We had a great time and can't wait to come back.  Ps- Vett is awesome and so is Ms. Angela!

-Cn2yrtl1ksqGCZt2tUYYQ.text: Best Shrimp and Grits EVER.  Love dining here Breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night or all night. Food is fabulous and the staff are warm and welcoming.  If you're downtown for a show the desserts are also very good. My favorite is the apple tart.

QR9KIt383BzXqBDBTVctOg.text: Update: While the food is good here, the quality of service really bothers me. On more than one occasion I've been here between 2am-6am where they've been closed. Typically someone scribbles closed on a white piece of paper and tapes it to the door. More recently there was no sign, staff just inside doing whatever, get to the register and I'm told they're closed. Since there is a lack of 24 hour eateries here in Charlotte I'd really like to see consistency when it comes to operating hours. Otherwise when I am able to get food, I'm a fan of the grits, fried chicken, and French toast.

pTRND-RQQloamOpDx-WzPw.text: Was excited to give this place a great review.  We had to wait awhile to get a table so my curiosity was building.  A very mixed crowd of college students,  senior citizens and families.  Our server was right on us as we sat down. We ordered several breakfast items and we were not disappointed.  All came quickly, correctly and hot. We love this place when traveling for business.  Great local place

t_EUwl4WS5U_Tk2uuARhjA.text: First time dining at the Midnight Diner and it was freakin awesome! Jane the waitress was amazing!   I ordered the steak and eggs with creamy grits...the grits was delicious. Although my steak had to be recooked the food was still great.   I dined in  on a Friday morning the place was pretty packed but my waitresses made it seem empty with how attentive she was.  Her food recommendations were spot on...I have found my new favorite eatery in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Liver Mush, creamy grits scramble eggs and bacon.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak medium ,creamy grits and over hard eggs.

EHfRiv9WPu8ij2KP3MIz2Q.text: Midnight Diner is a good bet morning, lunch, evening and late-night.  They have an extensive diner menu - a few of the standouts include chicken tenders, onion rings, greek salad and chicken and waffles.   The portions are generous and the service is fast - the only caveat, if you come for breakfast or lunch on the weekend, you'll likely have a 30+ minute wait.

P6yhCYb0_6KtduZRKeNcsg.text: Midnight Diner was great! We usually do not go back to the same location while on vacation, we like to go to as many places as possible, but we definitely had to come back before we headed back home!   The staff was very friendly and prompt, both times our servers never let our waters or coffee mugs empty. They joked with us and seemed genuinely nice! We got Shrimp and Grits (very good if you like things with a spicy bite) and The Bubba which put all of the best breakfast items together! Their sausage gravy was VERY good!   Definitely a place we'd go to often if we lived here!

1s-UUFyrTudoB8eOlOeQNw.text: The Food was Delicious! But the initial service was lacking. We came in around 9:30pm and place was packed. We were seated immediately but it took someone 15 minutes to even ask us for water. Once we got a server, (CC) she was pleasant and apologized for the shift change wait. Nice smile and very sweet.  Once our order was placed the food was out in 10 minutes, Hot and Fresh. I had the Fried Chicken, Biscuit, Mash Potatoes/gravy & the Famous 4 Cheese Mac&Cheese. The chicken was delicious! Seasoned and cooked just right. The potatoes were smashed and not instant and the Mac and cheese was pretty good, not the best I've ever had but still good. That Biscuit however was one of the best! Yum yum yum yum yum! I'll be back to try the Shrimp and Grits.  I did taste my Husbands Chili Cheese Fries and I'll be back for those too! That Chili was GOOD!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. One word! Delicious

slodzK_bhz1zCjJg477KJw.text: I have heard a ton about this place and it is always packed anytime I pass by it. I finally made it here and tried the Coconut Crunch French Toast with Fried Chicken. The meal was extremely good and only $11 so pretty cheap for how much food it was.   I had the deep dish pecan pie for dessert and it left a little bit to be desired. It wasn't bad but I would recommend trying one of the other pies.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coconut French Toast with fried chicken, I highly recommend trying this.
