x7NZ8aWTxnGlhZvBI4IyKQ.text: Yummmmy..... The shrimp and grits are on point.  The fried chicken does not disappoint! For french toast, this is the joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

eQGxSBeBsV14QL8fUoFMbw.text: The food was good and price was decent, would definitely come again but the service was the worst service I have ever received. Our waitress had an attitude and asked us to leave because we were eating too slow. Will not come back because of the service

ZwMNP6SoumBVsKL8nM7RBg.text: Don't know where to START OR how to STOP once I've started. You'll regret it for sure if you pass this GEM up! Small price for a lot of GREAT food, that'll definitely get my attention and $$$$$$ EVERYTIME!!!!!!!!!

FUVFxWB2iA-RjcfyweL_cQ.text: Arrived. I had the shrimp and grits . Seasoned so good . Grits was creamy. Waitress seem a little goofy but all and all I'll come back decor needs an upgrade music to loud for my taste .

AKbiRbz6NdlPzapUoGZeXQ.text: 3.5 stars... One time I had to wait 20 minutes on a Friday, and one time there was no wait on a Wednesday. When there is a line, THERE IS A FUCKING LINE!!!!!   There were so many ghetto drunk people on the Friday night it was appauling how some people behaved. I was thankful for the heavy police presence.   I had shrimp and grits both times and both times it was the tastiest thing you could find to eat at midnight. There service is good for how many people they have to deal with. The tables and booths were clean and despite all the drunkies, the bathroom was surprisingly clean. I gave 3.5 stars because nothing else open at midnight has food as good as the grits here.

wfTqHXv0mLQtk0HJWtRIfg.text: Probably the best grits in Charlotte outside of The Flying Biscuit. I almost always order breakfast here because they have NEESES LIVERMUSH! Ok. I know, I know but I'm still gonna eat it and I'm still gonna not read the package because I still don't wanna know exactly WHAT livermush is lol.   Midnight Diner is always poppin. It's open 24-hours and they have a great menu so people are literally in here 24-hours a day. I'm a huge breakfast/brunch fan so the fact I can get it anytime here is a big plus! I always had great customer service and it's always been clean. They even have a jukebox! Today the sanitation score is a 93 (idk what that's about but um...) The only reason I'm giving 4-stars instead of 5 is because subsequently since they're so popular there is almost always a wait and parking is limited.  Seriously if you haven't eaten at Midnight Diner you are missing it!

WNqZREjBEb1zOJvEoic8IA.text: Just plain AWESOME!  Service is fast and excellent!  Food is perfect and delicious.  Large portions and well prepped! I'll be back tomorrow!!

fw3IXL9Eit7OYGX4DYObrw.text: The food was great as far as the customer service not so good service was pretty quick but received the wrong food twice . With better customer service this place would easily get 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

CSkoT7XofUd5Igp0GKDEfw.text: A real diner transported to this site. Very popular so you will need to wait to be seated either at the counter or in a booth. Once you do get you spot service is fast efficient but friendly. The place is crowded, bustling and noisy but that ads to the experience. Food us typical diner fare including breakfast all day with some interesting variations. Prices are fair but not a bargain . You go for the experience and for comfirt food in decent portions. Parking can be an issue with a paid lot behind with a few free spaces but free on tge weekend. Ask or go ahead and pay at other times.  If you want a meal at a diner, this is the place.

hr3lducjcs49C2mghA6Ssg.text: The service was horrible!!! Thursday night must be one of the worst nights unless they are like this all time. We got no spoons our cups were filthy dirty and the tequila shots we ordered was not even shots they were so small. I don't care if it's a slow night or not no excuse then I asked for limes and they say they don't have any limes but another table just asked for limes and they got them?  Will never go here or bring my friends here ever!

F2OJ9EkgThYmraoqL4YCpw.text: Best Diner in Charlotte! I always get the chicken tender appetizer or French toast. Delicious!

wUtKgunataeo3LCUTHHliw.text: Will always be a fan of midnight diner . I don't get to go that much, but when I do , ordering something with grits  is absolutely necessary. Their grits are outstanding, or as one of my friends once said, " ...made by God". Super creamy grits y'all. Then there is the rest of the extensive menu. There's nothing more disappointing for me than going somewhere for brunch and the menu is so limited or too bougie . If the brunch is bougie it BETTER be GOOD. Being a diner, Midnight has something for every meal and is VERY casual. Other favorite menu items of mine here are the Challah French Toast and the shrimp and grits. Very few places do shrimp and grits the way I like ( sans any chunk or piece of pork in it) but I think Midnight Diner does a good job with theirs; it's a little on the spicy side, but still tasty.

_g7giD8k6emlRFqrATPOAg.text: Got here at 4:50 pm and was seated immediately. Got our order in by 4:57. The staff was great as usual. Very very nice and helpful. The place doesn't seat a lot so get here early. We went on a Saturday evening before it gets crazy. Saturday night can be out of control. Sometimes they need the police to help with the line that can go on forever. Food arrived at 5:08. And looked soooo good. We sat and ate for about 30-45 minutes. Food was just as good as I remember. Bill came out to be $33 for two people before tip. Good price for what you get. Because you get big portions. Notice the pics. Overall this place is wonderful. Everyone needs to experience this place. Just don't come too late.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Big pancakes
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs and bacon and grits
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grits and biscuits

6luXn6gw-w_R3ajmT1HLHg.text: I love shrimp and grits and the shrimp and grits at Midnight Dines taste like the restaurants in Charleston and Savannah.  It was creamy and full of flavor. I wish that I ordered two bowls. The service was terrible. I had to wait fifteen minutes before I got my drink and the server kept apologizing for forgetting to bring items that I requested. The price of the food makes it a good value so take the entire family.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nostalgic and trendy decor.

c4CcY4HR2DcX-Yl-X02dkg.text: My husband brought me here for a waffle but when we asked our waitress for recommendations, she said the fried chicken was delicious.  And then I saw they had hand battered onion rings, so I abandoned the waffle and went for the 1/4 Chicken White with onion rings and a salad as my side.  This also comes with a delicious home made biscuit.  Oh man... I had to stop myself from eating that biscuit after taking a couple of bites.  I'm glad I did because that fried chicken was one of the best I've ever had.  It was light and crispy and juicy and tender.  I could go on but then those onion rings were absolutely delicious too.  My fried food feast was so absolutely enjoyable.  And my waffle craving still has not been quenched so.. next time.    Service was good and friendly.  Our server never let our cups go beneath half.  She was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. House Salad
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 Fried Chicken White and the onion rings were delicious!

Vk1dUt0hNzhmKqFXEAZe0A.text: The shrimp and grits is the star of the show!!! I am on a quest to find the best shrimp and grits in the country and so far this is number 1! (Second place goes to a French creole restaurant in San Francisco). Let me start with the grits they were perfectly cooked creamy light just incredible. The sauce was flavorful and had a great kick to it. The shrimp were tender and seasoned well. The biscuit was flaky and moist. Honestly this is a 10/10 dish. I'm going back tomorrow to get the same thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

tX493PVbAB7s-qS8v0zc0Q.text: Me and my girls were not feeling the club scene but still wanted some food in some sort of social setting. We headed to Midnight Diner and were hesitant based on the line we saw, but decided to take the chance anyway. The pine moved quickly and this was a Saturday night around midnight. We were seated after 15 minutes. I ordered fried chicken tenders and fries, along with a glass of champagne because apparently fried chicken and champagne were made for each other. I enjoyed the tenders but they needed a sauce. Perfectly fried but no seasoning on the breading. The fries were mediocre. My friends both got chicken and waffles and they didn't feel like they chicken was cooked enough. It didn't look appetizing from my view. I'd def come back here and try their shrimp and grits. They also have an amazing assortment of cheesecake but $8 was just too high for my brokenness that night.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders and fries, chicken and waffle in the background.

_iFxdENvGy_A2Hy8BskwMw.text: Great food, plenty of it!  Would definitely go back.   Like the fact that diner is open all the time. Servers were friendly and helpful.

9loNEpkwSfH8qV7Joecg5Q.text: Stopped in for a late night bite while in Charlotte with friends.  There was about a 20 min wait for table but luckily the folks in line with us were loads of fun.  The restaurant is a typical diner atmosphere with booths, neon lights, a belly up counter and...wait for it A JUKEBOX !   I had the chicken and waffles which came with fried wings & warm syrup.  This is a solid dish but honestly I have had better fried chicken (see Metro Diner).    The Shrimp & Grits were a delightful surprise.  Full of flavor and the grits were super creamy. Yummy !  They do have a full bar which was dope.  Unfortunately they were out of vanilla ice cream so I could not have a Kahlua milkshake...#Goals

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

K6DSr3gg6EVJUZDsKOyL7w.text: Every time I am in Charlotte, visiting Midnight Dinner is a must. Being from Jersey, I am very big on diners - we've got the most! Midnight Diner never disappoints, the portions are large. My go to is either the shrimp and grits or the pecan waffle. The shrimp and grits is full of flavor and comes with a biscuit on the side. The pecan waffle has crushed pecans mixed into the batter with warm syrup. You can also ask for the honey butter for the top of it. This is a popular place so you should be prepared to wait. It is open 24 hours so keep that in mind for people just getting there after a night out or church is out on a Sunday. The vestibule is very small so at times you have to wait outside. During the warmer and better weather that shouldn't be much of an issue. I'm not sure what they do when there's inclement weather FYI.

aMKqK0R-x2ueb-tfBXMYmg.text: A go to spot on the late night. However if you able to go their before the hours of 11pm I highly suggest it.  The shrimp and grits and chicken and waffles are probably their most popular items.  They have a variety of items on their menu  I stick  to the breakfast menu when I go though. They also had turkey sausage which I was happy to see on the menu which I ordered with pancakes, eggs  and hash browns which were a little to crunchy for my liking but the rest of the meal was pretty decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

D_KRQgmCAexFrVVzZl3Cvg.text: This is one of my favorite diners here in Charlotte. It also operates 24/7 so it's always convenient and available. The menu is large and has options for everyone. It's also very affordable and won't break the bank. This restaurant is great for families during the day and friends having a night out later in the evening. My personal favorite dish is the shrimp and grits. I haven't had shrimp and grits this good anywhere! They also have Chicken and French Toast that's delicious and you can't find at many other places. This is the best diner in Charlotte by far.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

w1WHT9pXcXlWLUrl86uMMw.text: Been awhile since I've been here but still great.  Had to drop a sample of Mineral Sunscreen off this morning for analysys but after than, time for Breakfast.  Been a good while since we've dined at Midnight Diner and it was time for a revisit.  Dropped the sample off at 8:30 am and were here about 10 minutes later. Parking on the side was limited but did manage to score the last spot. My wife and I walked in and everyone was very helpful. I have upcoming hip replacement surgery so I'm using a cane but everyone jumped up and held doors for me while I navigated to a table. Very much appreciated.  Expansive menu with something for everyone including my wife who normally does not like breakfast.  I ordered the Western Omelet, Hash Browns and Whole Wheat Toast and all of this was made from scratch.  My wife had two eggs, over easy, Turkey Sausage, Toast and a Side of Fruit.  Everything was perfect The Omelet was very good, the Hash Browns were some of the best one's I've had lately.  Seems like most places are going to preformed Hash Browns from a Food Service provider but not here. These were the real thing.  Wife enjoyed her's as well and she confessed she occasionally enjoyed diner food.  Service was great and our Coffee Cups were never empty  Only thing I did not like and the restaurant had no control on that was that our table was next to an expanse of glass and it was 15 Degrees F outside so it was a bit on the chilly side.  Otherwise, great visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Western Omelet with Hash Browns and Whole Wheat Toast
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Looking down the length of the diner.

6FRD1izdZEQrwoCmf0UNug.text: My picture serves this establishment no justice BUT LET ME TELL YOU !!! This food was soo soo soo good ! It was about 2am after the bar my friends & I decided to stop pass here & when we first came in we were taken by. Surprise . The doors inside are blocked off by yellow crime scene tape & a sign on the second set of doors that tells you to wait there until a waiter assist you . Beside the waiters on the inside of this slam packed restaurant were about 3 police officers kind of alarming but I still wanted to try the food .   The wait wasn't too long because we beat the rest of the crowd leaving the bars & clubs . Once we were seated we let our waitress know we had one more coming to our party of 3 who was maybe 8 mins down the road . She says ok , takes our drink order n walks away .. maybe 2 mins later she comes back with the drinks and asks are we ready & we are not because they have a huge menu & also we're waiting for our friend . ( this is the reason they lost the last star ) the waitress then says "y'all need to leave the table and wait back outside in the waiting area because I could be making money off this table instead of waiting on you all " I just stare in disbelief becauSe we hadn't even been sitting at the table for 10 complete mins .  Luckily our friend showed up two mins later , she placed our order & has the nerve to say nothing personal I'm just all about my money ... ma'am that's not how you earn a tip I felt like that was beyond rude . But whatever I ordered a side of hash-browns & fries chicken wings super good ! All the seasonings were just on point I didn't have to drown my chicken in hot sauce it was great . If our waitress hadn't been as rude as she was this place would have gotten a fourth star

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

hbixMoKMPRZFZXOPE12ROg.text: Really good food that was ready when I arrived. The young lady who took my order was very friendly & knew who I was when I arrived. My one concern was when a the guy was refilling the ice for drinks added ice, he wasn't wearing gloves. His hand touched some ice when he moved it around to make space for more. That made me nervous!

-llvl-YtxaoM1s1cFVMPFw.text: The shrimp and grits is amazing. Whenever in town we come here just for that. We cane at a good time when it actually wasn't packed. Though our server was slow she was polite. I will still continue to return in the future

6ka_Ofjr2o6ijja1NlhFZg.text: This is my first time in North Carolina and the first meal I had was the shrimp and grits with a side of two jumbo wings. Everything was fresh and hot. My waiter Justin was exceptional! The diner doesn't have WiFi but he personally offered his hotspot for me to use. Everything about my first experience here was superb!!! Best shrimp and grits I've ever had.

Q2Lfb3itdjW4hykU_hu2UQ.text: This is not my favorite place.  I think the food is basic and the scene is overrated for sure.  However, my mom loves it here.  It's one of her favorite places, so I guess I will put up with it every once in awhile.    It's open late, they serve alcohol, play loud music...ok.  The service is hit or miss and honestly is usually crappy.  You will get rude service here before good service. Prices are ok, some menu items are decent.    Just not my top pick.  In fact, I wouldn't ever pick on my own anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

TmyDtkMDOVrvLXM3QB9F0A.text: Not high quality food but if you're in a pinch, it's fine. They use low quality oil but have good ranch.

d5bcSa52V0N3iaXFatpWEQ.text: Fantastic Diner!! Great food and spectacular service - is swear that there are about 20 employees working at the same time. And they are fast too! I had the friend chicken wife had omelet  5 stars!!

ve8bc8gsaL5WBg0MuqygDA.text: We wanted good no great food but late nights don't give you much to choose from however we found one. I thought with so many people going in we would have a long wait but we didn't. We sat down and our waitress Bonnie came right over to us. Sometimes they can be in a rush with so many tables but I must say Bonnie was great. She came over as soon we sat down, took our drink orders and offered her thoughts on what was good. Our food came so fast and was so good I was shocked. We did little talking once our food arrived because it was that good. If you do go here and there is a line just know it's worth the wait. YES IT WAS GREAT! Thank you also to the hostess and to whomever cooked our meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles

H6mPfWDnE4p9TBmq7B8Eew.text: Great diner with excellent breakfast and lunch food. Amazing service. Despite the long wait we were in and out in no time.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. French Toast
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Midnight Special. Cheesy Eggs, bacon, hash browns covered and smothered.

N0JEwEYW4Z_k0IUTraTz3w.text: The Bubba is delicious. Has a little bit of everything for breakfast. I will return. Seems like my review is a little short. But I think I got my message across with the first sentence.

gNWE9id8kk6ZklA1K7tH9w.text: Went here for the first time today and wasn't impressed. Based solely on what my wife and I had I have a hard time believing some of the stuff on the menu.   The challah bread in my French toast seemed homemade but, the syrup absolutely was not real maple syrup. For what were supposed to be never frozen hand breaded chicken tenders on my wife's salad they did a remarkable job of looking and tasting like something frozen from Sysco.  The A/C seemed like it was being piped in from the 7th circle of hell, the waitress didn't know the menu, didn't seem concerned that my wife only ate 3 bites of her food and instead of asking if something was wrong just offered a box, etc... The decor is cool but that's about the only positive thing I can say. We won't be going back.

JOx2QHPjVcS-dBjfcqZsdA.text: Had fun in Charlotte....great city...horrible restaurant!

MPxGVD91d49eq1otImqaeA.text: Okay, this newish diner I'm familiar with. It actually used to reside at a truck stop in  Kings Mtn where I used to live which is about 30 miles away. There are photos of the haul in the entryway. I was taken a back when I saw it nestled just outside of uptown Charlotte! What a great decision.  Apparently a great spot for post-bar hopping. As with any diner, you have the old fashioned decor and jukebox in the corner. The food is good, not great. The staff is good, not great. But it is usually a mad house when I frequent at 3am. There is usually a line at the front as any local will tell you. When you're tired and wore out from dancing your ass off at the bar, you come here for replenishment and good conversation. Then to bed you go ;)

bGKCkMhZ4dC12Q-7DsVaPQ.text: Stopped in here late night with some friends.  We all had breakfast and there were no complaints.  The food is a tad bit pricey for what you get.  We all had huge plates with a little food in the middle :).    Our waitress was very friendly and they offer alcohol.  I'm sure I'll end up here again at some point but I honestly prefer the Waffle House over the diner for breakfast food.

ARJoryJgBBZS4r4i_w9dAA.text: I haven't left a restaurant due to the service in a very long time so, it's upsetting that I had to leave this dinner because of it. I have eaten here on numerous occasions, both late night and for brunch. Though it seems the service has been put last on the list.  45+ minutes for two eggs and grits on a sunday at 2pm is inconceivable with over 10 people on wait staff, and I ended up taking my order to go which had not a single thing I ordered correct, and no utensils or napkins. I understand that this place get busy, its right off the light rail and good prices for a greasy spoon but dang, never have I waited that long

qkIKqUh1s0vnsHw7XIb2dw.text: Best grits on the WORLD! really!!! Clean, fun, bright, 50's music. On the light rail at Carson blvd stop. Also has tvs showing sports.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quick appetizers not the full menu.

yxRWY0SZaG-C0tStTJORjg.text: Five out of five stars because we had the best breakfast in Charlotte!  We had great service from Parry but, the whole staff was so happy!  Great great!

KxseLveld9KnBBAJvYCfCQ.text: Food was good but the service was terrible. Had to go out my way to get more water and to order dessert. Food was also overpriced.

AFy66LDA-TfKGWr_pZOGDQ.text: I found this place very good. I had the chicken wrap it was great!!!!. Its a dinner car setup so its alittle cramped and lound at times but service is very good. You should be happy here

QDf9FfruRveQbz0g4oV1mA.text: Wow!  It's been a while since I've written anything, and why not start back up with the diner across the street from my apartment.  Since leaving Boston in September I've been trying all sorts of new places in Charlotte and this came to mind first.  It's an old style silver on the outside huge booths on the inside kind of place.  It is good for two things - hungover breakfast and I just left the bar and I'm starving! kind of meals.   For breakfast I always get the omelette with avocado and cheddar and hash browns.  My husband always gets grits which I think are gross but he loves them so they must be good.  I've also had the fried chicken and a burger there.  The fried chicken is good and the burger is just ok.  The service is great and everyone is so nice.  The sweet tea (which I've become an expert at since being here) is too sweet, you gotta cut it with water or you'll go into sugar shock.  All in all not a place to check out, especially when it's only a 2 minute walk from your apartment -  kids in Camden South End...this means you!

y3tjyPOc6077lvd34fzQ5g.text: Perfect late night spot for some drunk eats!  LOVE the decor and the retro feeling of the place.  When I went my friend and I got a booth, the juke box wasnt too loud and the service was pretty fast.  Awesome people watching, all mix of people at 3am.    I had the BLT and it was good, the prices arent outrageous.  I will definitely be back!  :-D

NmZOlkl5MQZknWhI8YGxdw.text: The food was great!!!!! The music was great!!!! The staff was great!!!! I had never tasted chicken and waffles but I was super impressed.  The only reason that I didn't give them a five was that the drinks were strong so they did the trick but it was like taking a shot more than having a mixed drink.

PBKAsh967NB2_eZP3vE72g.text: Love that this place is open 24hrs! It's excellent cheap food and good service. The place is tight with poor parking and it always bustling but it's worth it. Their tea is awesome as well as they're fried chicken, hot dogs & sides. I've been here multiple time and have never been disappointed with either the food or the service. I will for sure keep coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious! Quarter dark meat, coleslaw and mac n&#39; cheese

Q7Yfb5AOqtDiP4kLgCiqRA.text: I liked the breakfast (minus the creamy grits -- next time it's hashbrowns for me) and my friend's chicken looked really good. The burger my other friend got was "ok." I might return, but not for a burger. Also, the booths are a bit "cozy."

sS1Sr7PSC5GHhJJBspcxYA.text: My family and I stopped at this diner after leaving the Carowind amusement park.  The diner was packed and the food didn't disappoint.  I had the coconut French toast.  This was the best French toast I've ever had.   Everyone else enjoyed their food and the prices were reasonable and the service was good.

bI5j9F6KJRGOR_U7Hzj1Ow.text: A few weeks ago had lunch with my sis and niece at Midnight Diner.  Was fabulous!  Loved the atmosphere and the food.  The dessert was yum, yum, yum and the grilled chicken sandwich was delicious.  Anxiously awaiting another visit.

U3lPga-qulvz8wxcZ5rT5Q.text: After giving it more shots than it deserved, I'm never going back.  Food: unpredictable, but overall bad Atmosphere: cute decor, poison air Service: spotty, either decent or never again  I wanted to like this place so much. I drove past it every day as it was being built and was intrigued by the large, shiny box. Once it opened, I was extremely excited to give it a try. I mean, it was built to be a diner. It had to be good. Alas, I went a dozen+ times thinking that I had had bad experiences because it just needed time to settle. After all, it's new, it probably has to work out the kinks. I've finally decided that's not True.   We had one waitress who was amazing. A mature lady with witty humor, people skills, and a peppy attitude.The best kind of server you never find. However, most of the servers are below average and a select few are the worst I've had. Ever. Now, what can save a place with terrible service? Amazing eats. No such thing here. The breakfast choices are okay. Lunch is okay. Dinner is okay. The food is not horrible but it certainly isn't great. Nothing tastes fresh. It all just tastes okay.   And okay food does not make up for service this terrible. If you sit within hearing distance of the kitchen or bar, you'll hear servers yelling or making nasty remarks and their hatred for each other fills the air with tension.    Overall, I'm not willing to endure a hostile environment, terrible service, and sub-par food for cheap prices and a convenient location. I'll go to Mattie's Diner for great food, great service, and a pleasant environment and sacrifice my driving minutes instead.

vWwB_fpkopcgqxz5NCQFHA.text: I'm from Louisiana, New Orleans to be specific. I've eaten in places all over this country. I've been a fan of shrimp and grits ever since I heard it in a rap song years ago, but every time I've tried it I was disappointed. Now I can stop looking for a place to get it. Midnight diners' shrimp and grit are what I imagined SNG should taste like and more. They have the solution!

PJmMfpjkLc2RHLxqqw2ICw.text: Bring your ear plugs, it's a diner so it's loud by nature but good GOD, the music is WAY TOO LOUD. Is it a club or a diner???   Eat outside.

w5uDcwjOmEE6G6hmVxTpVA.text: This place was great! We had fried chicken and waffles, shrimp and grits, hash brown with pepper jack and ham. The shrimp and grits were heavenly, the chicken was crispy and yes fried to perfection. Last but certainly not least our waitress was amazing. I felt we had a personal comedian at our service, she not only kept us laughing and enjoying our night but she also recommended local bars and neighborhoods to check out while we were in town. You will have a stellar time if you get La'Tosha.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The view of uptown Charlotte from the parking lot

ZRIBQ27edwsSrFMbqxjWwQ.text: First let me say, the food and service was great! Sunday, November 28 2018 was my very first time at the Midnight Diner. After flying from to Charlotte, I met my sister-in-law at the diner for food and fellowship. We had a great breakfast and excellent service. After eating, my sister-in-law placed a to go order for her family. As we were about to leave, my husband texted me and ask that I bring some food home for "tasting." There's no tasting as I had five adults to feed. I placed two orders of the coconut french toast, chicken tenders, cheeseburger, stack of french toast with a side of hash browns. Five boxes were in a box, so I assumed I had all of my food. When I arrived home (an hour and a half away), I noticed my daughters french toast stack and hash browns were missing. I immediately started calling the restaurant. I called several times and never got any response. I called the next day (11/19/18) and was told anytime the food leaves the promises they are not responsible for missing food. I spent over $110 in total. My sister-in-law spent close to $20. If they ask the waitstaff that worked on Sunday, they can vouch for my story as we tipped the very attentive waiter very nicely. For each to go order, my sister-in-law gave him a $2 bill tip. All in all, I would go back and eat, but the policy on not being offered an apology or a rain check on the missing order is absurd. My warning, check your to go orders for accuracy prior to leaving the premises. Do not call on Sunday (during their peak hours) as the phone doesn't get answered.

rs2k8iIO1PJbyOAajtRT8A.text: First time visiting the diner. For breakfast we sat at the counter. It's amazing to watch all the action going on. Nikki was our waitress. She was attentive and friendly. Breakfast was good. We got a NY Cheesecake slice to go. Couldn't wait to try it at home. It was AH-mazing. They are on my list to go back to try the fried chicken that others rave about.

UzMbEono5U0NJ1Gp7RTyoA.text: This place is awesome. Nestled in the urban city, this restaurant seems like a small fast-food dinner but it packs a serious punch. They have a full menu and carry a full bar of adult beverages. On this trip to the diner, we had the chicken and waffles and shrimp and grits. The chicken and waffles come with 2 or 3 wings and additional pieces can be purchased alacart. The shrimp and grits are probably the best in Charlotte and very delicious. The chicken and waffles is also very good but the best thing about this restaurant is the service. The servers are very nice, inviting and always accommodating. The only reason eye I can give this place is the parking. The free parking is very is very limited but there is a abundance of paid parking. It's great place and I do plan on returning.

BJ-jjhcR-eiQoiT88_aDYA.text: You only get one chance to make a first impression. The Midnight Diner aced it, knocked it out of the park, dropped the mike, & crushed it. I went to this location on ACC weekend 12/2/17. Parking was non-existent. I could have chosen to leave but I actually double parked and waited for someone to leave. Success! I was seated immediately once I entered. I came in with brunch in mind, but when I heard the table next to me ordering "collard greens" I quickly shifted plans. I ordered the 1/4 White Chicken Dinner with 2 sides and a biscuit. (Macaroni & Cheese, and collards). While passing the desert case I saw 1 single piece of Chocolate-Chocolate Cahke and ordered it to go on the spot. The food is EXCELLENT. if you're not careful you just might accidentally bite your fingers. I'll definitely return and can't wait to sample breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate-Chocolate Cake with Fudge Sauce.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 White Chicken Dinner with Green Beans and Macaroni &amp; Cheese and a biscuit.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 White Chicken Dinner with Macaroni &amp; Cheese and collard greens and a biscuit.

q-V4VSCEW8v9re6p9Tbrag.text: I've visited Midnight Diner 3 times since I've moved to Charlotte. Only got one picture of one of my meals.   Chicken and waffles were out of this world good. Hot wings and onion rings were CRAZY GOOD and spicy just like I like them. The shrimp and grits meal was ok the biscuit was better than the actual shrimp and grits.   Server was extremely nice and helpful on all three occasions never had a problem. Nice environment for anyone of any age. Definitely recommended to anyone in Charlotte

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Up close of the shrimp and grits!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits! It was ok. Biscuit was A M A Z I N G ... So fluffy and soft. Only $9.99

TG37QLmtAMMNT2O3uYhDfw.text: Love it here!    I'm sad they changed their fries to the crinkle cut kinda, though.   Their string fries used to be so crispy and good!

tdPT5psve-n7b12DQ18Qfg.text: The Midnight Diner is amazing me and my dad went there for lunch one although it can be very busy at times it has great food. Also there milkshake machine was down when I went there and they made me a milkshake by hand

zY1jDfhDe-akXOrMEOhicg.text: Took my wife there for the 1st time with some friends. Party of 4 on Saturday night and we waited about 15 minutes, which is pretty good considering how busy they were. Staff was friendly. It did take about 10 minutes for anyone to come by and take our drink orders but bro, its a diner, come on, its busy, I was stoned anyway and was busy talking with my friends, so I didn't mind. I ordered the fish dinner which wasn't impressive but was just ok. I ended up eating my wife's other half of her Philly cheese steak later that night and it was delicious! My friends got chicken wings and waffles and said they were excellent. The place is a throwback diner with lots of rock n roll memorabilia on the walls.I will definitely be coming back soon and bring friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

BB2JLV1wdFI-QGFP9iElOQ.text: Went here for the first time last night around midnight, coincidentally. Server was super nice, veggie burgers weren't bad-not what they're known for obviously. I would go back.

HF8p1qbjq0qEPJ97dJbyQQ.text: I go back and forth...sometimes I think it is great, other times I tell myself it is the last time I'll eat there.   Service can be amazing...or amazingly awful.  Food can be dinerific or downright awful. One morning I was craving a burger before work and at 7a it was perfection!  I had one after flying home Saturday night, could not even eat half of it, just no good. A big soggy mess.  Carbasaurus Rex would love this place...the majority of the menu is carb bomb!  My son had the chicken and waffles and said they were amazing!    Give it a try if you are in the mood for diner roulette.

TXEYM99WzExlfl9okupvmg.text: The BESTII kept raving about this place so now that I'm in Charlotte I'm trying it out...all I can say is that this place is AWESOME and I'm so glad she brought me here.  Everyone talks about chicken and waffles but I had the french toast with chicken and it is the best combination EVA, although I do love chicken and waffles...this is my new favorite combo.  The place has a great vibe and the people are super friendly!  If you eva in Charlotte stop by and try it for yourself, you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Chicken and french toast

D9v4HCmP7E_QXC0oZK2m2w.text: Visiting North Carolina and I decided to try Midnight Diner. So I went in as I pulled up  the line was out the door so I thought if the lines out the door the food must be great so I took the time and waited in line to be seated, finally when I was seated I got the menu from Amber who was the waitress and place my order, I ordered Cornedbeef Hash ,poached eggs and and toast.  While waiting for our food i always familiarize myself with the waitress so we can have great communication.  So after Amber dropped our drinks on the floor and had to replace them , But as i for my food i received my eggs in a bowl with water still in it and toast cold and no butter .smh Unbelievable I WILL NEVER GO BACK HERE . i called to speak to manager never got one and i wish i could contact the owner.  They went to far ro say if i didnt have another form of payment since my chip didnt work they would have to get the officer outside , when i already informed them my chip was malfunctioning due to constant use and it happens to tons of people especially a person like me who travels. If i didnt have another family/ friend who had cash i wonder how far it would of went because i actually went in initially by myself and she played as if she was getting the officer absolutely horrible experience, to ad insult to it employees took smoke after order was taken and seem to be a norm . Not a good representation at all. I wish i could give a negative but i trust my review to handle that .

2FysFQK-Q8766Bwkr01Qdw.text: Great food, horrible service. Thats typical. If you can get pass not being greeted, multple different servers, no silverware, u should be ok.

P4PdKhvd7UE6a6Bm8lnZsA.text: Hands down this will be my new go to restaurant whenever I'm in Charlotte. I was being a fat girl. I had shrimp and grits, a wing and sausage gravy for my biscuit... hmmmm... The wait was a little long for well worth it. The only thing was my server looked dirty. And she would reach over our food to refill cups. I don't like anyone armpit over my food. Food was incredible still...

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

Qdikxvct_8OyrvLS-JBx3A.text: The food is good, even better after a night of drinking. Just don't expect a whole lot from the servers. They seem to really not care about the customers. For example, we sat for 5 minutes before even being greeted. Then our food came out and I ordered the Midnight Special. I didn't have any syrup on the table for my pancakes and I was also missing hash-browns. I waited for my server for about 5 minutes. Then my boyfriend walked to the bar to ask for the items I was missing and no one even came up to him to ask if he needed anything. Finally my server came around and told us she'd get my hash browns right out and brought me syrup and hot sauce. I was then charged extra for the hashbrown until I brought it to her attention that I never received my order that was supposed to come with my plate. She took them off but she seemed irritated and like I was asking her to do to much. The star rating is solely on the food... the service we received is a -1.

ZxdpdMNya-0tHolfrm5Hyg.text: I was absolutely devastated by Midnight Diner- my kiddos and I went there after a long day of scuba diving. For whatever reason, the restaurant couldn't fit a family of thirty, and the staff was equally unequipped. We all ordered half a baker's dozen milkshakes, and it took 7 years for the staff to make them all. There was only one problem- the shakes were all chocolate, even though we clearly ordered vanilla. The service was fast paced and fun, with friendly faces serving our ultimately disappointing milkshakes. Overall, we had a great experience here and I hope to head back for chocolate shakes. Maybe I'll go after tomorrow's extreme badminton practice?

hcVM15BMg6ChIsc0MRhedA.text: Being the only place open after a concert, it was pretty packed but I Can say the wait was well worth it! Especially with Nicole as our waitress! Los atiendo muy bien con mucha atencion! Will definitely be back especially to visit our Good friend Nicole la Mexicana!!

xm0fgiyn0K9G4zt49LdiQg.text: We sat there for 15 min with our menus closed ready to order. We saw the 3 tables seated after us receive service and drinks before we even saw a server. I got up and mentioned it to one of the servers. Instead of saying something along the lines of ,"I'm sorry about that let me find a server!" She looked at me with an attitude and told me that we weren't her table....wow. Really helpful. We certainly walked out after that. Never even got the chance to eat the food or even drink the water. Now I never will. They lost my business.

BJBvqZqiWlK427_AdZXwkg.text: Good Breakfast, very crowded, and long wait. The pancakes are very bland, but everything else was pretty good

fskNkGFDG9vWYODjfaIqWQ.text: I can't review the food because we were shown to a table and then ignored for 20 minutes. No one showed up to take our order, not even for drinks. So we left. Frustrating because I love a good diner.

botedPhf6B1HX9-mlEWWyA.text: Great breakfast. Sausage gravy was wonderful! Gotta try the grits. Our waitress, Jenn was the best!

0X-nWdWGs45e5rrRbe3VEg.text: My friend and I stopped in Charlotte for lunch and this place was amazing. The food was better than expected, I had the club sandwich and it was very good! Prices are great as well. The staff was friendly and attentive as well. Highly recommend this place!

MF5bl2kp2VNjWLoFaxE-Fw.text: It's just alright in my opinion. I've been 4 times and was not wow'd. The food is just alright. Last night I had the chicken and waffles and they seemed to be using the same mix in the waffles as the pancakes. FAIL. I like a crispy layer in my Belgium waffles. These were dense and flat. The chicken was undercooked and lacked a good crust, if it is what you like. I've had 10x better chicken and waffles. And really ~6.99 for a chicken breast!!! No. Just no.

eCe4YokdusqDCsF3iQWo6A.text: We ate at the diner after 5k race and beat the crowd. I ordered a hearty omelette which was the perfect post-run meal. Food came out fast. Our server was attentive and refilled our water and coffees frequently. My friend ordered Corned Beef Hash and ate everything. She was very pleased with her meal too. I will be back the next time I'm in the area. Great breakfast joint! The diner is in great condition, clean and had plenty of polite servers.

rGhey-RAD0OFO8yvzps9rg.text: shrimp and grits are amazing! The crunchy french toast is really good too! I love it all!

yy9s9bFQiZenHIAes36bxQ.text: Good food and nice staff. It wasn't the cleanest restaurant but I enjoyed my food. A lot of options as well.

lCScSzZhD3LZaixrdTmeLg.text: Mediocre at best. I ordered the chicken and waffles and my waffle was so dry. The chicken wasn't bad but it wasn't great. I ate half the waffle because I was hungry but I will not be eating here again. The employees were TRASH. Having personal conversations and talking about customers in front of other customers! How professional. All this hype over this place and it's whack. All my friends say the same thing. MEDIOCRE. Try it for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dry waffles and OK chicken

TiIajwl0pzZTh-17dQ3I8Q.text: Oh Midnight Diner... I've heard about this place and that it's so great after drinking and that's probably when I should've gone. Hubs and I went during the day because I was starving and I wanted good diner food. It was just okay, I wasn't too impressed for all I've heard. It was crazy chaotic inside and we were ignored for a good bit before we got seated. The food was not the best, even for diner food. I guess with all the raving about this place and the line out the door, I expected more. Our server was really, really sweet though. Won't be back unless I'm desperate!

k1QPX_8KETiwSlhV5hHXww.text: I live right across the street and I don't know why I don't eat here more often! I have been here about 4 times now and there is always a line out the door later on in the night on the weekends and on Sunday morning. I ordered take out on Thursday night and it was ready in about 15 minutes. I got the Firecracker Shrimp salad and I'm kind OBSESSED now. First off, that bread! Whoa, topped with shredded cheese then under neath all the ooze is garlic/honey flavor. You will want to eat both pieces right away.The portion was generous and full of veggies. The creamy Parmesan dressing goes perfectly with the spicy breaded shrimp.  I also took a few, ok numerous bites of the bacon ranch wrap and mini burger sliders. Both were great, but the sliders....oh I could have ate both of them! Grilled onions, cheese and pickles. That's all you need. Ohh, and that secret sauce! Delicious! The buns are baked in house and they had a sweetness about them. I loved their seasoned fries. I need to try the shrimp and grits next!   I'll be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Firecracker Shrimp salad-to go

KoAbLGTBDnPSKc_amvYSvw.text: What a great little diner find just visiting and have been twice for breakfast. Great food, great service, great prices. What else could ask for! Will return again!

_zOTiga_0RFblJQ2-3fMHg.text: It should be illegal to be this good. And that's not the beer talking. My girlfriend and I stumbled upon this place while walking back to our Airbnb (we're no locals so feel free to take this review with a grain of salt). We ordered the loaded fries and the coconut crusted French toast with 3 pieces of fried chicken. Be sure to ask for that honey butter and hot sauce on the side because that ish was fire. If I lived here this would be the spot!  Also props to CC and the wait staff for grinding here super late!

oqX3BMYS_UXkvjPXrc_muQ.text: Our go to place for great food and atmosphere. Coming from New Jersey this is the best Diner we have found in NC. Grits are spectacular and fried chicken second to none. Open 24/7 and always full of happy faces.

HVeuOn8emjRrOUctmjaigg.text: Gotta love 'The Diner'. It gets busy here. Like, crazy busy. Service has always been good, but sometimes you need to just know ahead of time you'll have to wait to get seated.   If you're trying to call in an order --- you'll really have to get lucky and be dedicated. There are times where it won't go through, times where it'll ring and ring and nobody answers, and other times where you'll be put on hold only to get hung up on 3 minutes later. This is the one area that Midnight Diner realllllly needs to improve upon.  Breakfast --  Chicken & Waffles are good. Not the best you'll ever have, but definitely worth an order if you're craving chicken for bfast. My absolute go-to breakfast order is their shrimp 'n grits. The sauce is juuuuust spicy enough to have a kick, but still easily enjoyable. And the biscuit that comes with it?!?! Double up, buttercup.   Salads -- If you're feeling a salad, you will not regret ordering either the Picnic & the Firecracker Shrimp. Both of these are some of my favorite salads to order from a restaurant. not the healthiest you could go, but hey, you're comprimising and eating lettuce, right? And they come with garlic bread.   Wraps -- The firecracker chicken or cool ranch wrap are crowd pleasers.

1rETaItLnuTgwMcl3TIrjQ.text: This is an eclectic little spot, super retro! It was really crowded when we went but we were seated in no time.   Our food was served quickly and hot! Our waiter was very attentive and knowledgeable.   I had the hamburger steak plate, it was pretty good; though, I'm a salt kind of person so I had to add a good amount for the satisfaction of my taste buds.   The other plate was said to be perfect! Especially the grits!  Go here!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hamburger steak/Mac &amp; cheese/Green beans
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; French toast w/a side of grits

9lCq1BLGZ2tfuL2jDgkUiQ.text: the waffle was perfect, better than Waffle House. the grits were really good. The Mac n cheese were ok. the atmosphere is lively.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

YPipeRgkCyVv7GO7JrTQIA.text: Good ole' Midnight Diner.. a classic stop for a Sunday hangover.   This little diner is quiet small on the inside so wait times can be lengthy (20-45+ minutes) on peak times (Sunday Brunch particularly).   There is a large variety of options on the menu to satisfy any mood you are in. Breakfast is served all day and all night (thank you lord). They also have your typical diner food (burgers, fries, shakes etc). I stick with my normal brunch plate: eggs, grits, and potatoes. It never disappoints.   Rating 4 stars only because it can sometimes be dirty with the high volume of traffic in such a small place. The wait time is also tough on a hangover (out of their control but still a struggle).

sLSvMeNODA61awVQYThMVw.text: Came here at 5 am after work. Easily over a dozen people eating, with food being brought out. Orders were still being taken. Probably as many staff.  Despite advertising as open 24/7, I was told "Closed". Refused to seat us or serve us.  Cool. I'll take my money somewhere that they want it, and I won't be back.

CGME8CLLfYJbA3CuFm9Z1w.text: This is a classic Charlotte restaurant. It's good quality, diner food. Comfort food with breakfast options any time of the day. The fried chicken, French toast and Midnight Burger are some of my favorite menu options. I don't think you can go wrong with any of those. I also recommend the mac and cheese for a side. You can also order alcohol here which is kind of cool.   The parking situation sucks, plain and simple. Not enough spots and the only other option is to pay in the lot behind the diner...$7 for 12 hours, plus maneuvering around that lot is actually pretty stressful with the tight quarters.   This is a pretty popular spot for after hours as well--it's one of the few places open at 3am with a great menu...so expect a wait!

yjrPAf9UWau1rPHWTUzoRQ.text: I arrived in Charlotte relatively late in the evening, and I quickly realized that my meager per dime wasn't going to cover the cost of meals at my hotel. Thankfully, the midnight dinner was open, and a short walk away.  The restaurant was clean, cheap, the service was friendly and good, and the food was very comforting. I had shrimp and grits(excellent), and onion rings (also very good, but more than I could eat; they became a midnight snack later on).  A road weary traveler can't ask for much more in a restaurant. I thank you, Midnight Diner.

kA4ky_dGZlJxDW21E8-BQA.text: Is this True?  I ordered a PLAIN burger and it was brought out the total opposite and the manager came to our table to say "that a new law was discovered "today", that if an order is delivered to a table, the customer has to pay for it regardless"!!!  On top of that, the server came back to our table and wanted to argue with me to tell me that I DID NOT order it plain.  She was very rude and was shaking her head at me....with that being said, I asked for the burger "to go" and came home and gave it to my dog!  It was a bad experience and merely do not understand because we were nice customers.  We've NEVER had this experience and will not return.

ZOmju-x7OwAbajLlWpV-_Q.text: Sometimes the food is great and sometimes it's okay.  It's always fast and cooked to order, and the service is good. the only downside is that the decor really requires an overhaul, but maybe they're going for that old diner look? It's convenient to get to, ample parking. It's no 5 star restaurant, but defiantly a GOOD diner.

G380GxEJ3jdmUlfgxS_MKQ.text: I had the firecracker grilled chicken sandwich and their homemade cut fries. The sandwich was bland and the bun was cheap and tasteless. A co-worker told me that they had the best fries ever. Definitely not. They were greasy and soggy. Some of the worst fries I've wasted calories on. My visit was during lunch. I doubt I'll return to this establishment.

Ln5zjKUMF5GII0CwvMJJMw.text: My husband and I discovered this diner last year and we fell in love, we love to have breakfast at any time of the day so this was perfect, my husband favorite is the French toast and I always try different plates and I've never been disappointed, the coffee is good too. We really like that it is open 24 hours and is very well located. We have brought a lot of our friends because we really like this place and the atmosphere. The prices are very affordable and the sizes are very generous. It's sad that their service is so poor this is the second time that I see this waitress stand in the middle of the diner screaming at the top of her lungs for people to LEAVE! We were all stunned and I really felt embarrassed. I won't be back, invite anyone else to this place or recommend it.

Dod8p2zBjTb_1QyP_jiJSA.text: Awesome - Go see Mona, the best waitress ever! Can'y wait to get back for some chicken and waffles!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles - yum yum
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best waitress ever! Ask for Mona!

8_Mpez4KvdpC3IY9920e1w.text: Great selection of breakfast food here. Grits are AMAZING. I have a very high standard for grits, so that should be an indicator. Also the french toast is some of the best I've ever had. It's not just regular loaf bread. It's huge fat slices, and worth every penny paid. I was not disappointed with this establishment.

qbfNqj6ONFW_MR1VJgxKoQ.text: Was a great place to grab a quick meal at the late evening hours! Menu has everything you could imagine and the service was excellent. Very friendly staff.

5j5OSwxqfHKaKnZjTiaiFA.text: Ms. Vicki was hilarious and $7.99 for a 2 piece fried chicken and 2 sides, damn !  Went Midnight right before the crowd converged. A mixture of Charlotte I'm guessing as I was visiting. good food incredible prices. The huge slices of cake where really good. Our guest had the chocolate and red velvet and the tasted very fresh

8sIzc64GLUcarQVae2MMGg.text: Amazing!! Service was awesome and food is delicious. You have to try the chocolate cake. It is the moistest cake I have ever had. Well worth the price by far.. Will definitely be back soon.

rKGicwxgApseWXCcjI6JlA.text: This diner has great ambiance and amazing food! You absolutely must try the homemade chicken soup, it is delicious!!! Their biscuits and breakfast selections are also on point!!!

IMxpzUOKSaQIYV1N2jjzmw.text: I heard this place was amazing. Food was definitely on point. I had the shrimp and grits. It was absolutely delicious. The grits were creamy, shrimp was tender, and the creole sauce was perfectly spicy.  I wish the service was at the same level their food is. I honestly wanted to order a dessert however I was annoyed and exhausted trying to get our waitress' attention. Between flagging someone down to get us drinks, for a refill we (4 of us) had to put our cups to the edge of the table along with all of our dirty platters. We at that point asked for the check right away. Great food. Terrible service.  Really terrible service.

nRN60i2qcKVeC07vux-BRg.text: I will start by saying this, the midnight Diner is probably one of the better staple restaurants in Charlotte. However my experience tonight did not reflect that. After being sat and refused to change my order by our server, Ashley - we then received beyond mediocre service.  Feeling somewhat stereotyped into the mold of "black people don't tip". Luckily a server by the name of Larry a.k.a "Showtime" managed to salvage what remained of an otherwise horrible experience. He definitely exempified the prototype of what anyone would call excellent service. Needless to say our server received no tip. Hopefully she learns something from her peers. Definitely will be back...and requesting "Showtime" as our server for the duration of his tenure there.

xmzc8PuO3wu7C2yKuueMXg.text: Food is good. Service is odd. This place is way overstaffed but service is hard to come by.

cveSCfvMcU9BNMWj9quLZA.text: I've passed this place more times than I would like to admit, always being curious but never having the time to go in.  Finally, after a morning work errand with one of my employees, I suggested I would treat her for breakfast at her choice of places.  She chose Midnight Diner because she said it was simply-the best for breakfast.  She was right.  We had our coffees and juices on the table minutes after we arrived and I ordered the biscuits and sausage gravy with eggs and was in biscuit and gravy heaven as I sampled my first bite.  I could understand why this place had a line at 2am for drunk people who wanted a greasy and all-amazing breakfast. I was enjoying it in an all-sober state at 9 am.  The portions were massive so I couldn't finish mine, but boy..... I was happy as a clam leaving there.  Best breakfast award goes to The midnight diner!!!!

ZC0h7RYEYxBaCeoB7MNcHQ.text: Food here is great. A good waiter is hit or miss though. Overall, it's worth it. Fish dinner is awesome, so is the chicken and waffles.

1pD7lhYc0tuSqlGpo02lQw.text: Awesome place, great atmosphere, excellent food, and as an added bonus they serve beer and liquor. Our receipt said our server was Latosha, and she was incredible- made what would have normally been a great experience something even more extraordinary with her incredible personality. Enjoyed this place thoroughly and would recommend to anyone.

CLopjsMv5OVs8XzEHJV4hQ.text: This was an excellent recommendation. The food was amazing!! We ordered chicken ad waffles, the corn beef and hash slam, and TWO bubba platters.  In the realm of artery clogging goodness, this diner was on point.  The sausage gravy was phenomenal, as well as the hash. The waffles were a perfect melt in your mouth density.  Also notable, the juice actually comes in a huge glass and it is not over priced.  Would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Bubba platter-hashbrowns, sausage links, open faced biscuit topped with cheesy scrambled eggs &amp; smothered in sausage gravy

MufSgU-GtmSfg9zYa5a2IQ.text: Hot, juicy fried chicken and amazing mac and cheese! Food is always so good here, I always finish everything on my plate. I don't usually like collard greens but I theirs is good! My only complaint is that the waffles aren't crisp enough but they serve them with hot syrup so it makes it all okay :) Service is good, the servers are kind and check up on you frequently. Especially great coming here after a concert in Charlotte.   I love this place.

xuo_f90LvTq2JxNIMRyt1g.text: Midnight Diner is home of the best French Toast I have ever had. The grits are also amazing.  Don't go to Midnight Diner expecting a nice brunch place. It is definitely a casual diner, but the service is great and the food is pretty amazing! Plus it is always open!

D23TOD-0AOhIhHd_qO3Mfg.text: Hands down Midnight Diners Fried Chicken is wayyyy better than Price's Chicken Coops!!! The vegetables are great too.   When it comes to the dessert you will need to order the Strawberry shortcake cheesecake when you first place your order. Every single time I've waited after my meal to order the cheesecake it gone!!!

Z5APDD8mLNyo3Pmci6mupw.text: The first thing I think of when I hear Midnight Diner is, "MMM! Grits!!!!" Their grits are incredible! Whatever I order whether it's the Veggie Omelette (delicious), the Chicken & Waffles (yummy!), or the San Bernardino (yes!), I get grits on the side.   So you know the Shrimp & Grits is an absolute winner in my book.  Every time my mom visits, she asks about this place. I try to spread the Charlotte eatery love by taking her to different places when she comes, but I know it is her absolute favorite.

VljD_u8SwOMgE_D33QKOmg.text: I have been here a few times and really enjoyed my meals here on every occasion.  The coconut French toast is particularly outstanding and the waitstaff is extremely friendly as well.  If you're looking for a diner in Charlotte, look no further!

7FucXj38Zhmx8GJu0YuLYg.text: My 1st meal in Charlotte while visiting for the holidays with family.   Loved the Biscuits and gravy but lost my mind over the grits!

wzh0_jnIQy6lY96Ytb7j0Q.text: Jermaine was pretty f*cking cool. Shrimp and grits and coconut French toast was delicious. Great service and good times. Go.

F9Msnsd8KEetW8dfKTqLsg.text: This place NEVER LETS ME DOWN!! I currently live in Atlanta, GA but every single time I come home (Charlotte) I make it my business to come here for breakfast, brunch or dinner! I was recently in Charlotte this past weekend, so I met up with a friend for brunch on sunday. We were able to sit at the bar immediately so that was a plus because there was about a 20 minute wait for a booth. I got the fish and grits (My fave) with a side of hash browns, and one egg. It took maybe 15 minutes for everything to come out. The food was simply amazing, fish was seasoned and fried perfectly. The grits were PERFECT, so perfect that I did not need to add anything to them. Our waitress was a little slow with responding, but I understand she was pretty busy. All in all I HIGHLY suggest anyone in the Charlotte area try this place at least once!

Gmsl05EBlXbfZEpM1o8Owg.text: Avoid at shift change.   Apparently that's when they deceleration.  Oh, and a 95 cleanliness rating.

jYPR5ucdTF0QS1XGenkMeg.text: Ate a delicious big breakfast here. Food was warm and nicely prepared. Clean environment and friendly staff. The only thing that turned me off was a tall black male staff member chewing on food as be serviced customers. It's not a good message to customers. I'm in food service.  If you eat go to employee section.

i6xFwfTGaaGHFOr4PG_bTA.text: Uptown Charlotte's 24 hour diner,  it's a traditional one. Right down to the chrome all over the outside. Nicely placed with a large parking lot. Very close to the stadium, so expect it to be filled with fans wearing their Black, Blue and Silver on game days. Booths and a few tables inside.  Traditional diner menu with burgers and eggs and things. I did see other people with waffles and wings, but it was actually breakfast time when I was here. I chose to go with the "Uptown" which is two eggs and hash browns with a waffle. Eggs were cooked perfectly, the hash browns were both crunchy and soft. The waffle, however, was beyond desciption. Crispy on the outside, flully inside, it was still nice and hot to melt the butter and it soaked up the hot syrup. Excellent flavor.  Service was great. My waitress refilled my coffee often and cleared plates as I emptied them.  Free wifi, though no power outlets that I could see.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance to the Midnight Diner
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The &#34;Uptown&#34; with eggs over medium, hash browns and waffle.

MFT6mP7YvSFf6-_YM4ULxA.text: Tried to treat my daughter out for a meal. We are seated and for 20 minutes nobody comes to even get out drink orders. Then a family of 5 who look nothing like us are seated right beside us. They couldn't even get comfortable in their seats before someone was asking for their drink orders. Never again! Not this one. YOU WILL NOT get a dime of my money ever again! I made sure I let that manager know why I was walking out!

mLA52yGD7eno4WmUtjVhGg.text: Yummy 24 hour a day. Always great service.  This is my go restaurant in Charlotte, NC. There are no bad menu items and nothing to avoid.  Warning because the food is delicious, plentiful, and the service is great - this diner is always jumping. People flow in and out so the wait is usually less than you expect and the time you wait is always worth the delay. I have had every meal breakfasr, lunch, dinner and after the club meal here. All wonderful, always great service.  I love the retro look it is so comfy and cozy. This diner even has a jukebox you can deposit your coins into to play your favorite tunes.  During my last visit, I enjoyed breakfast pancakes, bacon, eggs and coffee. My pancakes had pumpkin added (real pumpkin not the flavoring) and they were huge and amazing culinary treats. Did I mention that they have toasted coconut french bread toast? Great. Splendiforous! The staff never changes and that us because the owner is so sweet and engaging. Everyone checks on you not just your waiter. You will enjoy it.

CVdMX8zKJ4Z_q_MuqY-0WQ.text: Stopped in after attending an event uptown. We waited just a few moments to be seated at nice cozy corner booth. The place had a wide variety of customers which I truly enjoyed.   I had the chicken and waffles although wasn't the best I've had but not the worse. The chicken had been sitting for a bit as it was certainly not hot. Next time I will request fresh chicken. My dw had chicken dinner with greens and mashed potatoes. She enjoyed it except for the chicken was cold.   My ds(7) & dd(9) had the pancakes and enjoyed them but how can you go wrong with pancakes if you are in the mood.   We will go back again & I will make a special request for fresh chicken if I choose to get it next time. The prices were very fair and my family of 4 left with a 32 dollar bill. Not bad.

ZdGrvp6Kq1hOt_3WPTOHhg.text: So this was my first visit to the Diner. I initially came in wanting shrimp and grits but was quickly swayed after seeing a Yelp review. Although what I ordered isn't on the menu, the kitchen didn't mind substituting what I wanted. So I ordered the fish dinner and subbed the fries and grits for grits. The fish is white cod, which I was super hesitant about but ended up LOVING! My server suggested I get it fried hard and with seasoning. I also ordered an egg and homemade biscuit. Great meal!! Please try guys

h-jPvj7nIG9A4ZdAjJJCKg.text: Long wait, no ownership, no one cares.   We were seated for 15 minutes before having to flag down a waitress.  We were then handed off twice, and finally served drinks.  Five minutes later, they took our order, including drink refills (which never arrived).   After another 15 minutes, during which time they checked with us on our orders twice and never brought an appetizer, we said we were leaving and asked for a check for the drinks.   We got a check for the whole meal.   Never again.

vAVIJmU79ZlLHLL7n83QBg.text: As I grew up in PA, these types of diners were everywhere - the metal outside, the round counter seats, and booths lining the outside wall of the building.  When you had a group of 5 or more, you knew you had to split up into more than one group as large tables were scarce.  This diner has all of that but they have corner round tables that fit larger groups.  The diner itself is actually larger than some of the other ones I've been to, including another local one, Mattie's.  Service here is what I would expect to find at something like this.  Exceptional when they are not busy but I would imagine it could get pretty chaotic in here at busier times but it's something you just accept from the atmosphere.  The menu is broad and you can get anything at anytime of day.  Breakfast at 4pm, check!  Well actually I was working an early shift at work and got off at 10am and treated myself to breakfast.  I ordered what I typically get for breakfast, an omelette, hashbrowns and a pancake. The omelette was their San Bernadino omelette which came with pico de gallo, sliced avocado and cheddar cheese.  The pancake was huge and dense and quickly absorbed the syrup I put on it.   It was good but not great.  Same with the omelette but the food was nothing to write home about.  I didn't expect it to be.  I came here for the experience.  One downside is I thought their prices were a little high for a diner.  I can get a better omelette, better pancake and better hashbrowns at a place on the other side of Dilworth for cheaper.    But everyone needs to realize when they come here, you come for the atmosphere and to get a decent meal.  It's not a 4-star restaurant and in my book, it shouldn't be. But it is still worth coming to at any time of day!

qjuv1UAeOVsw4uQ7Z8xBag.text: Love this place. Excellent food, great crew, great atmosphere, chicken and waffles in Charlotte. May they never close.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

PZdFvsOq1_5HqDnZZVx6VA.text: This was my first time going here and I was highly impressed. I arrived at the midnight diner with two of my coworkers for a evening meal and boy was it Great!!..the atmosphere inside was a 50s vibe. The music was modern and throwback which was perfect and our sever was very young attentive and social.  I purchase the midnight special with 2 scrambled eggs with cheese, two sausage patties, grits with cheese and two pancakes. Boy was that food cooked just right and affordable..will come again. THANK YOU!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Midnight special
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn beef hash , eggs &amp; a biscuit.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two french toast and two fried chicken wings.

xx5YueXV2sEeUHe2N7HdAQ.text: This place should get a 2 1/2 star, I love the hours this place is open but the food is not consistent.  A friend of mine orderd food to go from this place and I had a few bites of her fried chicken and I was really impressed with the flavor and texture that I decided to order a plate to go.  My plate was really disappointing, my fries were room temperature and my fried chickens coating wasn't all the way browned, it was that yellow color before it's full cooked, it was soggy and greasy as if it wasn't cooked on a high enough temperature or something and the flavor tasted like cooking oil. Surprisingly the chicken was cooked all the way through but the coating was not.  Didn't really matter though because it tasted so bad I couldn't eat much of it. Not sure if I'll try again.

v-udqDt5LGz2E-hK5s1Dhw.text: The food is good however, I prefer to butter my toast instead of the cheap oleomargarine. Prices are fair though, and will come again!

Esghj_6Zwku66MEBsFST3Q.text: BEST GRITS IN CHARLOTTE!!  The atmosphere is 60s diner Americana. You will never go home hungry. If you are wanting a hearty breakfast, then you should order the Bubba or chicken and waffles.

fZEg2jDY74OFmrOBseri7Q.text: Been here plenty of times and service and food have declined. Brought a visitor from Michigan arrived and waited over 40 mins for food. Three tables by us received their food and almost finished and still didn't receive any food. Waiter advised food ticket was lost. Once food received asked for manager who basically said waiter lied and ticket was lost so only gave a $4 discount for our whole party. Waiters and other staff came over and advised that manager lied and ticket was lost. Service aside what manager puts blame on everyone else!!!! Will not be going back unless management changes. We could all tell our food was sitting out for a while.

p8WpoH-AAgzHiuQG4YMppg.text: We were visiting from out of town and decided to come here due to the good reviews. Our wait to get in wasn't too bad considering it was a Sunday morning. We were a group of 5 and it took over 30 minutes to receive our food. Our waiter was constantly talking to tables, flirting and giving out his number. This wouldn't be an issue if other tables that sat down after us didn't get their food before us. Our waiter stated it was because there were 5 of us and due to us ordering grits and sausage as sides our wait would be longer. My food was forgotten and while my family finished eating I still hadn't received my food. This shouldn't be the case because other tables were receiving the same food. Overall the food was okay.

6SAo1YFDFPy-qw7vC45gAA.text: I love the diner, and the food is great. The issue for me is there general manager.eddie south, he has no relationship with his employees, he's not hands on at all, he comes in and looks around like he's afraid to eat from the diner, he want even shake your hand, I don't know if that's racist or just down right disrespectful. He's definitely not a hands on type of manager. He works all his employees to the bone,yet he's never there to help pick up the slack! To Eddie south your a hell of a general manager!

6Q6kt0LCx7FofOVe04cFNw.text: The midnight dinner misses the mark, the first time we went we thought it was great and than we went back and everything was very wrong. The restaurant is filthy, their sanitation score is a 90 and I should have know better. The cleanliness is a HUGE issue! Their floors are constantly slippery due to grease, the silverware and cups are always dirty food particles on them, it's just disgusting.

NXDCxupfgtgVCDbxxKkwvw.text: We ate here and we didn't die, that's the best I can say.    We tried the so highly recommended fried chicken and some other stuff that for the life of me can't remember. The food was just OK, nothing great about it but there's no excuse for the complete lack of service in an empty restaurant - we got there around 1:45.    They sat us around the corner and out of sight  and promptly forgot about us. After a while I made a fuss and got a server to take our order ..... but he never came back....  .... and much later, almost an hour after we walked in the manager himself brought us our food. Which was like I said OK but not great. As for the decor, I'm just so tired of the old American Graffiti cliches, enough already!    I hear this place is terrific, when you're stinking drunk. Sober not so much.

vMyPO6Z_zLS0dREg4SioMw.text: Love...love...love!!! Best place for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Always happy with food and service. They are quick and very hospitable. We recommend this to everyone we know and they fall in love too!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best hash browns ever!!! I asked for my bacon to be super crispy.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grits, buscuit n gravy, and sausage links!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. French toast with Challah bread... To die for!!!!

j3BNqi98Mo5rv8zghVzAcg.text: I came here a few days ago for breakfast and it was great.  I got a simple two egg breakfast.   Came with choice of meat, and I got a biscuit and grits.   Being from out of town, I am always down to try regional foods.  Both the grits and biscuit were amazing!    Fast forward for dinner tonight.  4 in my party ordered firecracker chicken sandwich, buffalo chicken sandwich both of which were good.  My brother said the firecracker was not really spicy as you would expect from the name.   Mom got shrimp and grits.  Wonderful!  I got a half fried chicken since my brother couldn't decide what to eat.  I figured might as well get the extra chicken for only $3 more for him.  I ate the white,  he ate the dark.  Sooooo juicy and hot.  Omg, the best.  We were going to go to Prices the other day, but they were closed for Christmas week.   No worries, the chicken here exceeded expectations!  Came with a biscuit and two sides. I ordered the mac and cheese and by recommendation from our server, the collard greens.  Both of which were great.  The collards were a better than the mac and cheese.    And such a fun, happy place!  Everyone was in a great mood.

z-UorbNvLC8IltA59GQ_FQ.text: Great for breakfast! Some of the best cheesy grits I've ever had! The corned beef hash with eggs was great. My husband and his friend shared coconut crunch French toast and loved it, I don't do syrup ;) we also had the biscuits and sausage gravy. I usually don't like biscuits, but this was GREAT. Our server did a great job too! GREAT GREAT GREAT. Everything!

E4BPqwByxuu22-k7vLFn5A.text: Good fried food, beer, and liquor, plus stripers next door, if I could bring my dog along this would be a mans paradise.  I've honestly only run in to stuff my face and then be on with my day here.  Chicken biscuit with a water, in and out in less than 15 mins.  Will give it a proper review in the future, because I'm sure I'll be back.

sZWPutE6FVPb8WeM7G4VzQ.text: Friendly service.  Food was fresh and hot and delicious. Will be back tomorrow.  Grits and Shrimp... Yummy!  Chicken strips ... Fulfilling!

qwGKEUjMJHbzTEeBJYKYSg.text: The late night diner that comes with a side of adventure.   The food is your standard diner fare but the atmosphere is what gives this place its charm, especially if this is a late night stop for you. If you come here right after bars close, expect to stand in line for 20-30 mins, more if you have a group larger than 2-3.   Food is not bad but there is always something going on at the diner. When I went last time, there was some scuffle that occured on the outside. Usually it is just how drunk people are but being from the south it was somewhat entertaining to watch.   The staff is friendly and courteous and the space is somewhat small but works for a late night stop.

OkeGR7gbiPO-0VMCkvuorQ.text: Came here for brunch on Saturday morning. This place was busy for its small size but our group of 7 only had to wait about 25 minutes to be seated. Our server, Chauney, was full of personality, very attentive, joked around with us, and we just loved her. We are in town for a bachelorette party and Chauney really catered to the bride. The food is amazing, southern comfort food. I had the French toast and it was awesome! Overall, cute little traditional diner and would definitely recommend Chauney!

mUzBOqdcy-xbxCiJSh88BA.text: Friendly service, tasty food  This place is good when you are not dieting lol  Could be a bit faster service and cleaner

OrIamO2Izh4jLMmqZ1MPwA.text: Great uptown  (downtown) location. Classic diner food. Service was a little slow, that's the only negative. Delicious biscuits. Very crowded on Sundays. Will return when in Charlotte. Friendly staff. Within walking distance to all uptown hotels.

FmZSTL3k62rIBnI1D_5Mkw.text: My bf went there for lunch and had chicken and waffle. Then he couldn't stop talking about it for hours. So eventually we went there at 1:30 in the morning on a Friday night. This place was packed and the atmosphere was fun with 90s & 00s music playing. We ordered half fried chicken and the coconut French toast. OMG hands down the best fried chicken and French toast I've ever had. We are thinking about going back for Saturday brunch already...

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half fried chicken with collard greens and mac &amp; cheese. Coconut crunch French toast. Amaaaazing!!
