2w6lTWDYFTTXTAB3EF81Ww.text: I can't believe this place only has 3.5 stars. There must be some tough critics out there. Either that or people that don't know good food. I learned about this gem from a faculty member in my doctoral program. She told me she heard good things about this place and wanted to check it out. After talking to her, I naturally went on Yelp and looked at the reviews and pictures. Needless to say, my interest was peaked and I went that same night. There was no wait when I arrived and the hostess showed some southern hospitality. I'm not used to that up in Pa. I ordered the dark meat fried chicken dinner with two sides and an extra thigh (call me greedy). My sides were mac n cheese and collard greens. It also came with a biscuit. The food was so good, I had to eat it slow just so it wouldn't go away as fast. No...the food was so good I tried to come back for breakfast two days later. But I was in a rush and there was a 20 minute wait, so I was unable to indulge. Yes I was very heartbroken. Instead of pancakes, I had a Greek sandwich somewhere else. But if I'm ever in Charlotte again....guess where I'm going.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Before it was demolished. #GoodFood
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yup! Dined all by myself.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Loved it

5eJohPKwpsmciRNJsWmwyA.text: Midnight Diner is a super fun spot to go to in Charlotte. If you're feeling hungry then The Bubba is the perfect meal if you're wanting some great breakfast food. The service was awesome, my friends and I had an amazing experience. Would definitely recommend!

xucWIvQbte-6dKcFb7yZvg.text: Super fire low-key diner big servings and friendly service! Def will come back if I'm ever in the area. Get the midnight special

MrGfXMlj31kjQP69vA7FcA.text: Been traveling for Business to Charlotte since April and finally got a chance to eat here.  Great classics dinner feel, sat at the counter and was attended by Delorian, great young guy, good convo.  Food was wonderful! I recommend the Mackinaw Crunch French!!

edoxRSpdzmEMsoAu52eYzw.text: Went back to make sure it was as good as the first time and we were disappointed. My French Toast was cold and tough, grits were good though. Maybe it was an off day, not sure if we will be back though.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

htSJltz0kOuRRbiIR6Aotg.text: Best grits in Charlotte! Everything on the menu is good here. But if you're a creamy, buttery, grit lover - this is your Mecca. Occasionally I'll get a hankering' for some liver mush (gross on many levels - I know) but they do it right here as well. Crispy outside. Good texture inside. The only downside here is they don't have any real butter for the tables, just the whipped vegetable oil stuff. Bummer. Servers are always friendly. Usually a line late night, so plan accordingly.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meat Omelette.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

-LIIxWjRg5v2u_e6ofoRdg.text: This is definitely a go to spot for breakfast especially after a day/night of drinking. They are open 24 hours which makes it that much better plus the fact that the whole menu is always available. After 10/11p just about any day of the week it's usually a line to get in and after club hours it's even longer. Every time I've been it's always packed with not a single empty table open and once one becomes open it's quickly cleaned and taken. My go to items to order are the shrimp & grits or the 3 chicken wings & French toast. Both are really good. I've even just stopped by to get a bowl of grits, they are so good. FYI if you love Flying Biscuits grits they are the exact same!!  The waffles are usually a hit or miss, this last time they were very dry. With there menu being so huge there's definitely something for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken wings and French toast with side of grits
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits

SSVQv0sFPGiRA5LXByg4Sw.text: So I've been told Midnight Diner is a place that every Charlottean knows about. 24/7 eats. Hangover cures. Decent prices. There is something on the menu for everyone. The staff are generally nice and helpful. Food comes out quickly.   Tip: Try the "staple" dishes. The Shrimp and Grits. The breakfast items. I think some dishes and CONSIDERABLY better than others.

1MWSi1go4wvmOyDvrRfoSQ.text: My boyfriend and I were a bit hesitant to come here for brunch because we saw the huge group of people waiting outside. However, we ended up giving it a try, and it was fantastic. The estimated wait time for us was 30 minutes, but we probably only waited for 20 minutes. The diner decor is on point, but the floor and the bathroom could use improvement.   I ordered one of the favorites, Shrimp and Grits. The menu has a bunch of items that are highlighted to indicate popular items. In theory, these are items that should grab your attention because they are highlighted, but my mind chose to skip over them. I was looking through the entire menu, flipping back and forth, trying to find the popular shrimp and grits, and I was looking at the correct section, but my eyes constantly skipped over the yellow sections! I felt so silly when I asked the waiter where I could find the shrimp and grits on the menu, and he pointed right on the page that I had open, exactly in the section that I kept looking at! The Shrimp and Grits ($11.99) was delicious. It is creamy with a mild spiciness to it. I had a piece of shrimp in almost every bite, which is something I always hope for. I was very satisfied with the portion. Also, the meal comes with a biscuit.  Boyfriend had Corn Beef Hash Slam (corn beef hash with 2 eggs any style and buttermilk biscuit or toast for $7.99). He added an extra egg for an additional $1.25, which I think is absolutely ridiculous. You could buy a dozen eggs for that price! His dish was not anything special. The corn beef hash and eggs were cooked just a little too long.  Our waiter was friendly. It was very busy, so he did forget to give us something to stir our coffee (we did not have silverware at the time), and the bill took a very long time to arrive. However, he did apologize for the lack in service, and he did provide us with coffee to go. The coffee ($2.19) tasted too diluted, but we are thankful to have coffee to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corned Beef Hash Slam
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits

auk8eMM1guFQuWENAaOUww.text: There is a reason this place is always slammed - it never disappoints! I've been intermittently visiting the dinner since I moved to Charlotte and it's fun atmosphere,  great location. And friendly people are what makes it fun to come back.  Our last visit was to console the latest Panthers loss to the Seahawks. Fortunately this place serves beer, which is pretty awesome! We sat down at the bar and had some fun discussions with the waitress who was working and the people around us. The menu is very large and they have something for everyone,  but personal favorites include the bubba (biscuits and gravy on steriods) and the pecan waffle (dare I say it) may be better than waffle house.   Overall a fun place to check out and I'm glad they went through the effort of relocating this diner car all the way to Charlotte!

FwsFsN3qtlS1zZ5VBvkz5w.text: It's been a while since my last visit. I've notice that many things changed. Ordered (as used to) the Bubba, used to had two biscuits with gravy, bacon, and hash browns. Yesterday I received only 1 biscuit (cut in two halves), the bacon was extremely salty and hash browns raw, not well done at all.  I don't think I'm coming back, I live in Ballantyne and I have best options around here now. The stars are only for Dave.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Bubba... 1 biscuit less, bacon extremely salty and raw hash browns.

9vOlRRt9nLyTrFvQLbrzog.text: Very simple place, and everything was amazing. Great service, fresh food, and pleasant server. Good music too! We ordered the shrimp and grits, macaroni and cheese, fish, and fried chicken dinner. Bomb!!!!They close late if you need a good place to eat.

KKiX-rmRKGnQTXo-jOBgyQ.text: First time here and have finally found my favorite Diner, good food  and plenty of it cooked exactly as requested.  Thanks to my lovely server, Zoe and a shout out to April who came to visit me.    I'll be back!!  Linda

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greek Omelette Scrambled, Fries, Rye Toast.

X27CzXNZ3QIpaoqmpkk_1w.text: My goal this week is to try and replicate these shrimp and grits at home. I have to come to Midnight Diner every time I'm in Charlotte. I'm not going home until I visit. IN FACT, I stopped here twice during my Thanksgiving vacation this past week.  Midnight is open 24/7 and has a small bar. The waiters and waitresses are very personable and nice. I've never had a bad experience here at all.   I brought my mom here and she thought it was going to be an "upscale" restaurant. I said mom, some of the best food comes from small diners like this... don't hate. She enjoyed the shrimp 'n grits as well. Its very filling and will leave you smiling. If I can just recreate this at home, my boyfriend would be elated.

w-EjCW4grNnj_ClUsfouEA.text: I had walked by the diner multiple times, and just recently stopped in for breakfast.   The diner is super cute 50's style with great music. The food was great and in huge portions.   I'll definitely be back for breakfast another time!

jtsxcQ2WEXtqGJTEJ5MSSA.text: Second time visiting here.  Both times were good.  At times they can be extremely busy.  To accommodate for this they keep some foods pre prepared.  On this visit I had the french toast, grits( omg, the best restaurant grits Ive ever had!), and bacon.  French toast was hard around the edges, tell tell sign they arent fresh, the middle tasted great.  Grits get a second mention because them things are the truth! They were creamy and delicious! I ordered my bacon limp, bacon comes out in less than 2 minutes not limp. No way was it cooked fresh.   They kindly fixed me some fresh bacon.  Waitress was great! Restuarant was clean.  Parking can be a hassle. There is a small parking lot ajacent to the building, and extra parking behind the building. Be sure to only park in the spaces for the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. French toast

mZfDcwEMMbw5wFJX3mUEQw.text: This is a cute diner & someone suggested we walk there for breakfast. Our circumstances kept us from calling ahead. It was just over a mile walk. We were extremely disappointed that NO accommodation would be made for my allergy. They weren't even willing to cook an egg in a separate pan, totally inflexible, although they were pleasant about it. They weren't very busy. Stay away if you need to make a special request.

HvnqAAnIptni7TyBszSmuQ.text: When asking "where do you go when you come to Charlotte?" This place is always mentioned. Followed by "GET THE SHRIMP AND GRITS!" So, I did what I was told LOL!   For parking, there is a small parking lot in the front but you can also park in the rear area. I was told that we went at a good time (Saturday around 4pm) because if we waited longer, we would have had to wait. Everyone also says that this place is POPPIN' right after the club let's out especially since it is 24 hours. It's a great place to people watch.  You can tell that the waitresses were hustlers. They made sure they claimed their table and also made sure that you were helped. I ordered the Shrimp and grits and yes. YES. YES. .. y - e - s. Everything was cooked to perfection. My boyfriend got a philly cheese steak and he said it was good. He also ordered mac and cheese and also another side of fries. The fries were "basic" and not really special, but they were good.  Shay, our waitress took great care of us also. She made sure that our glasses were full.   Bathrooms were clean and it was appreciated. The floors were also clean around the restaurant. Will def be back when I come back to Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

W-gvEIjqWnMZz4uO_DplNQ.text: My favorite diner in Charlotte Bar None. I eat here all the time. As far as diners go, you can't ask for much more. The fried chicken wings are my go to here. In my opinion these are some of the best fried chicken wings Charlotte has to offer (Price's Chicken Coop is my number one for plain fried chicken wings in Charlotte). I also enjoy their omelets and their hashbrowns (Pro Tip: You've got to get the hasbrowns with onions, cheese and ham. Trust me!!!). Their pancakes are solid but I'm not the biggest fan of their waffles and french toast. The only major downside is the wait on the weekends. You could be in line for up to an hour or two trying to get a table. This place gets my vote for best late night food in Charlotte (Sadly Charlotte does not have a ton of late night food offerings outside of fast food. As the population here grows, I'm sure that will change).

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. You&#39;ve got to get the hash browns with cheese, onions, and ham when you come. Trust me!!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Some of the best fried chicken wings in Charlotte. Not a fan of the French toast though.

b3gvYgziug2Dl-wu8L_lQA.text: As a guy from the Deep South this food is just as good. You can tell when the food is made with  and it is amazing!! The Bubba is definitely my fav, check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Bubba

RDUFG2fO7dVGOkWoEU-Cng.text: Great spot to eat at. Reasonable prices, upbeat & friendly staff, short wait times (in my opinion)...and most of all great food. We had Chicken & Waffles, Chicken & French Toady and a Burger. All were solid and satisfying meals. The chicken was moist but wasn't greasy. And the French toast were nice thick crispy slices. The waffle was ok, nothing to rave about but nothing to diminish either. And The burger was about a 4 out of 5. The atmosphere is always popping and fast pace which I love. This diner is a staple on the Southend Charlotte scene that one MUST eat at.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

cz_XCkeodxYgE8VO254noQ.text: Simple but delicious! There is a reason why this diner is alway busy. The food is good and very affordable. Due to it popularity, there is usually a wait when I deem to go, but it is never regretted. Friendly service,  but can be slow at times. I enjoy their breakfast dishes. The grits are the best in town, and the French Toast is thick cut and sweet. I have never had a bad meal.  Great to go with friends and family, or just to people watch at the wee hours of the morning. Not good for a quick bite. During busy hours there will be a wait for seating, your server, food and your check. I still think it's worth it!

Zy8Bbn0UKLLMsvRAUerlXw.text: Great brunch food and they cater for 24 hours with great food and select drinks. Highly recommended

0NscjJOyEz-IXROImMxJrw.text: Some of y'all wait staff racist against their own people. I'm black and i feel the last few times I've been there, the black staff treated me weirdly but was overly excited to serve the white people i was with. The light skinned girl who works the bar, and the black girl with the Afro whose attitude and condescending manner repulsed me. She had an attitude with literally everything i asked for but never with my whole friends at the table. I've worked in the service industry for years and i recognize that type of behavior quickly. Improve your staff.

ec_xh-Cueqou2_GGiicMzA.text: I love the Midnight Diner. It is the perfect place to go for a quick bite to eat. The shrimp and grits, chicken wings and Midnight Special are my personal favorites. The wait time is never a long unless it's after the club hours (1am or later) on the weekends. The staff is always nice and the prices are very affordable. You can never go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The shrimp and grits were amazing! I almost forgot to take picture. Definitely a must try.

6nsLQnHnUr-BB2mIU8Axbw.text: Good place for good comfort food. The staff is very friendly and professional, yet fun and personable. You can't go wrong with anything chicken. They have some of the best Chicken around. Matter of fact....the chicken and waffle is a must have!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Famous chicken and waffle!

8ZUm9LIHhQG8BTzkKPcsdg.text: It's a great place! Love the food love the service. The service is super fast. BUT the water tastes like napkins or tissue. It's got a weird after taste. Please fix your water. Add a filter.

jXsnlMIfHbUbSjKyjnVhBw.text: Excellent Diner! This is our first time visiting Charlotte and this is already our favorite restaurant here in the city!! The service has been excellent both times we are there, Aneisha has been there both times we have went, and she has gone above and beyond! She is great:) the prices are really good too, especially for the quality of the food. We will be coming here every time we visit Charlotte! Midnight Diner is AWESOME!

4Eg0VTfzLEu0mbv2_bJYMA.text: In town for weekend and stayed at nearby hotel.  Loved this spot so much came back every day for breakfast.

a-zKODyatJ1_KpsvYcXMeA.text: This place is a must try for fried chicken and also great breakfast. If you go late on the weekends you might have to wait a while before u get seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

xmkaFsx3rNfyYnPwkBxBXw.text: This place never disappoints! I've been here several times. Early morning and late at night. It's always awesome! Parking isn't so bad either!

EzmVowyvmbPdsD7YpsBBcg.text: This is hands down the best place to grab a late night bite in Charlotte! I had three people with me and even though there was a line out the door we were seated in about 15 minutes. It was more than worth the wait. The service was great but, the food was even better. Try the fried chicken with Mac n cheese or the blue cheese chicken sandwich and you will not be disappointed!

FUKk-UpAAPMPtviWSNXx3A.text: Nice clean neighborhood diner. The staff was friendly and the food was good. The server was alert and did a great job. Its affordable and seems like a nice spot with no wait. Late night-good spot or early morning- this is a great spot.

h6RXx0FQk8OKgQPGcQ-vlg.text: The two stars I awarded Midnight Diner are due to its kitschy, retro exterior. It's just how I would imagine a diner in the 50s or 60s to appear, aluminum siding and all. There is plenty of parking on the side and a cool neon sign.  When I walked through the door, I was immediately greeted by my disappointment at unmet expectations. The floor and windows were dirty, the white walls severe and abrasive, and the bathrooms horrendous. We almost left after seeing the bathrooms but instead alerted management and decided to stay.  I ordered a bacon, egg, and cheese biscuit and my boyfriend ordered two eggs, bacon, well-done hashbrowns and white toast. I ordered half of a grapefruit but the waitress returned and said they were out of grapefruit. While the food was brought out expediently and made to our satisfaction, there was nothing special or memorable that could make up for the failed interior.   Midnight Diner is open 24 hours/day, and obviously caters to those late-night cravings. But trust me, your drunkenly made scrambled eggs or mac-n-cheese, enjoyed in the comfort of your home are the better option.

JzVvdAJjJgs5T8WDaYfnYA.text: This place is super affordable with most dishes under ~$10. The food was ok, nothing spectacular and nothing terrible. The service was a little slow when we were there, but our waitress was very nice and helpful. Overall, it's a good place to go at anytime of the day (literally, open 24/7) if you're looking for classic American dishes.

obFflp3YV2P_M4do9SIhQg.text: Visiting from out of town and our Uber driver suggested this place. So damn good. As far as diner food goes, the best I've ever had. Our waitress was awesome and very helpful. 10/10 would come back every day if I lived here.

oe18eIEOhMUDannLCnO7-w.text: Fried chicken was so good; tender and juicy. Definitely a good portion too. I had the Mac & cheese and fries as my sides and get this you get a buttery fluffy yummy biscuit. I went on a Saturday well after midnight so naturally it was packed. But here's a tip: call ahead and order. Full disclosure though, you may have to call 2 or 3 times to get through but oh so worth it. Once you've placed your order over the phone you're able to "skip" the line to go pay for your food at the register. Easy peasy. The cashier was very nice and even personally delivered my food to me once it was ready. The officer who was monitoring was nice too. It was very packed but it's good cheap food so go figure.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry Cheesecake

-Nv5IpcZ3tgWksdsvXU_xw.text: Food is good. Not a bad wait for Sunday afternoon. Had chicken and waffles. Had to wait for syrup. Server AJ was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

zCVAm6ZGeKUMGEc0KlbsYg.text: I had the Philly Cheese-steak and enjoyed it with a side of cheese grits. Both were good in my opinion. The wait was long at 11, but once seated I was immediately acknowledged. The waiter we have was attentive. No complaints!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

oWtGRblp3_D1rySZEcP73Q.text: I suspected the tales of epic Shrimp & Grits and life-altering Chicken & Waffles at 2am were bound to be exaggerations, but alas, the Midnight Diner is gold, Ponyboy.   My friend and I stopped in after a very long day at work upon my brother's recommendation. Even after midnight on a Sunday night (actually Monday morning) the place was packed. Boisterous diners of all shapes & sizes were busy celebrating LIFE and FOOD!   We were seated promptly and quickly greeted by possibly the BEST SERVER EVER!! Jaya (sp?) was quick, sincere, knowledgeable, and a genuine pleasure to be around. We asked about the Shrimp & Grits and Chicken & Waffles, and she confidently recommended BOTH. I ordered the S&G, my friend ordered the C&W. Jaya suggested that the waffles were good, but not that special. She then recommended the Chicken & French Toast.   In short order, our food was brought to us, and NOTHING was a disappointment. Maybe the Shrimp could have been bigger, but they gave me 8 instead of the advertised 6, so I was just fine with that.   Yes, it was awesome. The S&G was spicy enough to start a fire, but gentle enough to savor every bite, the undeniable warm, fluffy goodness of the buttermilk biscuit puts Bojangle's to absolute shame, the C&FT was so good it should be illegal and the atmosphere was thick with electric, deep-fried, southern goodness. Stop what you're doing, and go to Midnight Diner NOW!

VWvzbNfc7P_KZbfz7t7t6w.text: 5 stars if you're drunk, two stars if you're sober.  Only come here late at night (midnight's in the name for goodness sake)

inFVIO3sQivIR3YQi54B1Q.text: Good food, good value, friendly service, in a comfortable casual atmosphere. The real rating - I'll be back.    - Food: Had shrimp & grits and their "famous" chocolate cake. Very good food.  - Ambience: Classic shiny diner. Great mix of music from hip hop to classic rock, fitting a very mixed clientele.  - Service: Good service, enough attention without being annoying.  - Location: Convenient - just south of downtown.

Pjdm4gglQYqeNfIsY5nuxA.text: Fish & Grits w/ the creole sauce AMAZINGLY GOOD! Two downers the sweet tea is an express train to diabetes and the seasoned fries had to much salt. Experience was still good nothing that a glass of a wataaa and a new set of fries didn't fix.  Will return!

7wxTwxquSfv1-8AqT9zOUQ.text: Great diner food with excellent taste. Came on a Sunday for lunch with a line out the door. Did not wait very long. Great food, hash browns cooked in butter and not an oily mess. Disappointed the "old fashioned maple syrup"  is the gooey mess that is not real maple syrup. The pancakes are good, but not with goo. Tried the onion rings and they are delicious.

YKTeXKhUwAMqTIEoDzEqTA.text: The chicken was awesome and the Coconut crunch French toast was perfect be prepared for a while to be seated it's always packed on the weekends and late night

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

56C7v1zE984QsUMDYGbprw.text: Breakfast and just took the "Special " of eggs , grits & biscuit.  They know how to PROPERLY Cook grits . .salt in cooking water.  Great service.  2 for under $12, & lots of fresh,  hot coffee.  Definitely worth a return visit

HKdFy-6TzEW9wPHulZE5xg.text: My brother and I went to this diner during our first day visit in Charlotte after a long flight from Los Angeles and we finally had a good meal after a long 5 hour flight. The service was good and the food was really good. Gotta love the 1950s design!

eKQ8Woe-J8mrsPUDSnbfQg.text: Wonderful diner with nice ambience. Short wait times for great diner food. The shrimp and grits were fabulous, get it with a biscuit. The French Toast is better thank expected and thw fried chicken is golden and succulent. The servers are quirky but hospitable. Next time I'm in Charlotte,  I will visit again.

GQ4T129G9I2OVWiUETZ0Cw.text: Standard diner breakfast food. Had the western omelet with hashbrowns and rye toast, and boyfriend had something called the Bubba, which was just a bunch of stuff smothered in sausage gravy. If you're into stuff like that he said it was good. I like both my hashbrowns and toast a little more done than they came out. Overall, large portion sizes, low prices and quick service. Plus there is just something about the diner atmosphere.

n2grLDDyTrQ0hmVzyuMOYw.text: The food here is great and it's the perfect place for a late night meal in Charlotte, but the service isn't the best. I've been here several times and have had to wait for a server 10+ minutes after being seated (on multiple occasions). Also, I recommend paying in cash. The last time I dined here, my card info was compromised. Overall its good food for a good price.

d_yAw1NHFzh5j1n9ETjuOQ.text: If I could leave a negative star I would! I'm usually a regular at midnight diner because I work weekends at a night club not too far from there. However, I just went to place a to go order and was never acknowledged and finally after sitting there for 20 minutes me and my coworkers were informed by a waitress that they were not allowed to place a order. WHAT!? Never again!

M9rS8IRH8VJOcstDAQ8glg.text: Best breakfast in town. Basted eggs were perfect. Toast pre buttered. Perfect. Hash browns plentiful and perfect. Coffee was diner coffee as expected. Overall the best in town. Service? Just right. And fast. Licking your plate should be allowed.

DNpaQqDFOmAqPiBHKGJITw.text: Been here only a couple of times even though we stay in the adjacent apartment complex lol. Probably that's why couldn't take this place seriously. But loved the food, it's proper diner food. Love their banana pudding and Death by chocolate cake more than anything.

zVkNq1IyOk9RkmwqaTv5tw.text: Tonight was my second visit and most likely my last. Don't get me wrong. I'm not going to begin bashing this establishment.  The first visit was okay. I had Steak & Eggs, with Grits and Toast. The grits were suggested by one of Charlotte's Finest 'CMPD', whom also informed me that the owner also owns the Topless Nightclub next door and another restaurant at the Epicenter, downtown. Immediately I could tell that the grits 'though good' were cut with either heavy cream or real butter. I was close, because it was sour cream. Final note for breakfast: Good, but I've had better. This evening and on my second and possibly my final visit, I ordered fried chicken, with two sides. It was priced at $9.99, with a substitution surcharge, for getting a leg in place of the wing, as part of the all white 1/4 chicken plate. I learned of the heavy surcharge when I went to pay. The plate costed an extra $3.22, bringing the net amount to $13.21, plus tax. I could have gotten the wing, then added the leg for possibly less the cost of $3.22.  Nonetheless, it wasn't the servers fault for how the manager on duty handled the situation. I still tipped the server $5+, for fried chicken that could have been much better, if the fryer's temperature was set at a minimum of 350 degrees. The chicken was extremely oily. The breading was good, however the meat within was bland.

a4JDvyaS-sBQoquJ2ZWMYA.text: I live very close by and have for eight months. Not sure why today was my first time eating at The Diner, but it was pretty delicious. My friend and I both had The Bubba which was a beautiful combination of eggs, biscuit and gravy (I got my gravy on the side), hash browns and bacon. I enjoyed every single bite. I'm sure you're wondering "why only three stars?"  Well, the place was pretty empty given that we went on a Tuesday morning, they're open 24/7 so understandably they were doing some cleaning while the place was empty. One of the gentlemen was moving some booths, cleaning around the seats and whatnot and announced out loud there was vomit under one of the seats close by our table. Now, I can't say I'm surprised given that many people probably visit after a night out when they need greasy diner food, but did I want to know this at 7am while I was enjoying my breakfast... NO. Thinking about it now makes me gag a little. Plus I find it disgusting that they just now discovered it.

SlA-QzOdQKyWHR2RhcLJAw.text: The go-to spot for late night dining! They have everything you need. (Including a little bar lol) They have everything you would expect to find in a diner, but better! The fried chicken...gives the Chicken Coop a run for their money. Anyone from Charlotte (and transports) knows what that means. Well worth the 18 minute wait. I'm still trying to figure out what's in those darn grits!!!!!! They are so creamy. The food is simple and delicious. If there's any kind of event going on in Charlotte *cough cough...CIAA*, expect a long wait to get in the door! You won't be disappointed. SN: They also have a little food cart behind the Uptown Cabaret!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stellar French Toast!!! Amazing...
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mmmmmm

U1DbdQwdLfD_SdAoGbNKNg.text: Why two stars you ask??? - The "ghetto" attitude and service was horrible! .The hostess (I am using that word loosely) did not greet my wife and I. She mumbled how many? and turned on her heels and walked away toward the table (the fat one with the horrible wig-yea her). The server Greggggggg (how it is spelled on his name tag) was unattentive and disinterested. The saving grace was the delicious food. However, I don't do ghetto and for that reason I will not return.

4GEeeR0ohLoPIRO9jZvS3g.text: While I used to enjoy the food and I've been a customer since they first opened I will never go here again and it's sad it was a family tradition however tonight the messed up my order gave me 50% of the food and customer service is at its worse ... Check your order to the letter as in open your burger etc even if they tell you it's all there open every container because even when they admit oh yeah you should have had another bag they won't do anything to rectify the situation ... I can no longer go to what used to be a favorite Charlotte spot... What happened to customer service ?

Lc2A3kxKrIlt5tydh9e8IA.text: Three times and out! Though their food is great, their customer service absolutely SUCKS and they really could care less if you dine there or not. First, we stood on a Saturday night for more than 45 minutes while they refused to seat anyone due to short staff in the kitchen (though several people were allowed to skip the line altogether and walk right in to be served, go figure). They then passed out cards to go to another diner in the Epicenter. Giving them another chance due to their close proximity to my work, I called in an order for pick up only to arrive to find no one ever put it in. This last chance I just attempted to call in an order and was told I needed to call in closer to the time of pick up. Im done.

3kLEcniDmv_kdKxsZkCrsg.text: We just had wonderful breakfast at the Midnight Diner! This place was REALLY busy & the wait staff was moving! Our server, Tammy, was super friendly & gave us the "low-down" on how to eat the local cuisine. She was very attentive to our needs & really wanted us to enjoy our experience at the diner-she was a sweetheart. Good food too!

Hy3wlD-Kd35rrxtHD2ztRw.text: If I wasn't starving I would have got up and left. Rhea the shift manager just stood at the bar. 5 coworkers walking about nobody ever acknowledged me or ask did I need help thank god for Kindra for the greeting when I entered the diner because that's the only greeting I got. Midnight Diner use to be one of my favorite places to come and eat but the service has really gone out the window.....

QNRKzFLNNl9Y1jWsNC37hg.text: Retro little diner with great food. The server we had was very nice, but forgot a few things we asked for. It was a very busy weekend morning though.

xfAx3Knowtr3ZRuhv-xy1A.text: Definitely a 5 star spot, no doubt!  The breakfast sandwiches are awesome and at the right price too.  I also love the coconut French toast.  If you like a little spice you have to try the shrimp grits.  Their fried chicken is on point too.  I have nothing bad to say, this is a great spot to get your grub on.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

vGGzz31QxmVqisLFL-CyTg.text: Awe man the shrimp and grits is heavenly...  Also the fried chicken with collard greens and macaroni and cheese is addicting..

CPxPuw3LohkTTXqCeeLMkQ.text: Sooooooooo good. Service was top-notch. The food incredible. Best grits I have ever eaten. No contest. Everything was cooked perfectly. Thank you for a delicious meal.

7rSX8qumJ3G59LZGToH5gQ.text: The shrimp and grits are ON POINT!!!! Service with a smile and very courteous! This is one of my favorite get a way spots!

6nZXB-OLFGj8GZmH08MGnw.text: I came in about 9:30 on a Thursday night and the place was packed. I got the famous shrimp and grits and they were phenomenal. Our server Cori, was excellent and very entertaining. I love the classic diner look and feel. Overall my experience was outstanding. Good food, good prices, and great hours all through the night.

i4DhBYkLiP2OH9gs-07-5g.text: The food is great. Customer service is great. Only downside to this place is it gets too packed and loud. On a busy night you can barely hear the person sitting next to you.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

OZ1xoxQAstA9YpWadI6yCg.text: I used to love this place. Good and service have gone to crap!!!  So disappointed. Used to be our fav breakfast place. I guess if you're drunk or hung over it works.

M4c5Y37IQzWNmKutRPLKRg.text: As far as breakfast goes in the uptown south end of Charlotte this is definitely a good place to visit.  I am new to Charlotte and wanted to try something not a chain so we came here.  Had the French toast and wings.  Thick French toast and solid wings.  Service was fine.  Pretty solid diner.

zRlc6r44HW-Su2Wmk2OyQw.text: Stellar service great hours and solid food. Prices are all reasonable too. Try the fried chicken and coconut French toast.

RxV9u76_EBKyVT53fAMnQQ.text: I would have given the overall rating of 2 (because the staff was unprofessional and unpleasant), except I was there during CIAA weekend and I gave them a little credit since the restaurant was so packed.  Pros: -On a cold, busy night, we were sat within 15 min. -It was clean. Even with all the people there, they turned over tables quickly and everything looked good, even the restroom. -2 of us split a chicken and waffle meal and they gave us no trouble adding a wing. (Nor did they charge us a "share" fee). The chicken and waffle meal was EXCELLENT. -The sweet tea was excellent, but that's to be expected in the South. -The total bill for 5 people (4 meals) was only $40.  Cons: -The "host" (a big man at the front door yelling to guests) was not friendly. Very aggressive and not attentive. I know it was busy but still, he could have been nicer. -The waitress(es) (because we were served by about 3 of them) were ok. They were not overly friendly or accommodating. They were average. One of the ones that served us told us that she wasn't our server when we asked for more napkins. :-/  Overall, I'd go back to enjoy the food on a less busy night if I'm in town again. However, I'd hope that the service was better.

PMNBHQKEQuao2ckGaQuN8w.text: I ate the Carolina burger and it was the BOMB! Great service too. Our server was Sonny. Also ordered the collard greens, those were good too.

MrwKrDKXeu_q43eMB2gXTQ.text: Shrimp and grits! Chicken and waffles! Philly cheese steak! OMG you have to go multiple times and try everything on the menu. It gets crowded on the weekends between 10p-3a so make sure you're ready to wait in line. The owner yells across the restaurant if your just sitting after you've eaten to let everyone know that she has ppl waiting to be seated so GET OUT! overall a great place to grab a bite

TNEfk3ZhXK89oH_oWip2nQ.text: Went there on a Sunday evening, shortly after 9pm after leaving The Liberty because their kitchen was closed (at 9pm!).  I'm glad this place is open 24/7, but it either needs to have better food or be cheaper. I got an egg and cheese biscuit with a side of hashbrowns. This ended up being about $5. The biscuit tasted like it was previously frozen and had a hint of plastic. Eggs were pretty rubbery. Hashbrowns were pretty good. My husband got a peanut butter and jelly sandwich for $4.99, assuming it came with fries as the menu seemed to indicate that all the sandwiches came with fries, but alas no. It was $5 for a pb&j with no fries. Really?  The service was ok. Our server just brought our food and never came back but fortunately another server did refill our drinks.

_EWIq7VU8g5wSrpKfU2HtQ.text: This was the first place I've been to eat lunch by myself. I work right down the street and was wandering around in search of sustenance. There is sat, a shiny, aluminum, airstream-of-a-jewel off Tryon.   The best Chicken & Waffles in town sign out front did a great job of affirming my longstanding craving for fried chicken. "Why not do it on a Tuesday?," I thought.   Cut to the chase: Chicken, biscuit, baked mac'n cheese, broccoli $7 Chicken = juicy chicken wrapped in a crispy, waffle cone jacket Biscuit = ideal Mac'n cheese = ideal Broccoli = steamed, not buttery, Thank you   My big girl pants were feeling pretty tight after this date.

fnkbyJqgDgREufrvDVqPJg.text: Shrimp & Grits.... the rest is history! Like any other diner it's a very fast paced environment. My server was friendly and more importantly - quick! I definitely recommend the Midnight Diner to all my foodies.

LZg3U5Y6vZ9pHUdQ5Dq4_A.text: We were back again torn if i wanted breakfast or lunch because breakfast is all available all day. We opted  to try the lunch menu and once again it didn't disappoint.    My husband got a burger with bacon and fried egg on top which he said was cooked perfectly. I got fried fried fish and shrimp, the fish and shrimp were cooked to perfection- loved the coleslaw. You know its good when the line is out the door.

qPjYT7LbWDCmDpLXQFToiA.text: I would drive 4.5 hours just for their Firecracker Shrimp! Absolutely to die for!! Every time I take a trip (after going to the Midnight Diner) I see if there is any route I can take that is near it just so I can get some of their food! Staff is so so so polite and helpful. Pricing is great for the amount of food they give you. This is my all time favorite place to eat! Worth the time to get there; worth the wait time; worth the money! Thank you so much for this delicious food! I got a taste of Heaven on Earth.

HfeSzPGegbwcMyQt-9lGdA.text: When people started commenting, "you know the names and shifts of the staff?" I should have taken it as a hint that I go here too often. And yet, the hashbrowns keep me coming back for more. Oh, I've had other menu items too and have never been disappointed (the veggie burger is a favorite, and the specials are usually a good call). But dangit, when it comes down to it, I just love a good breakfast.   And in a city that can get awfully caught up in frills, this place is about as frill-less as you can get. Straightforward, simple and cheap.  Why four stars? The servers can sometimes get overwhelmed. Ultimately that doesn't bother me that much in a place like this, though. It's the sort of joint where imperfection just makes it more endearing.

SiI-0cujOU8j1s6yg5mZjA.text: This is one of our first stops every time we're in North Carolina! I've never made it past breakfast to try lunch or dinner. The Challa coconut French toast is awesome! Their grits are always on point. The staff is always upbeat, friendly and thorough. We love that they're open 24/7 too.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pecan pie
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy shrimp grits. GET THEM!

EbnU3kt7bPzUKxb6K-NHKQ.text: My sister and I had the pleasure of having a late breakfast today at the Midnight Diner. This was my first visit but it was sister's fourth visit. The food was incredible!!!! I had the "Bubba" and it was delicious. As a Southern Girl, I know my grits and these were some of the creamiest grits I'd ever tasted. My sister promised me that the Midnight Diner served the best coffee in town. The coffee lived up to it's hype. It was amazing.   I would have rated my visit higher but some of the staff members were absolutely RUDE-not to me but another patron. Apparently there had been some confusion with a call in order. When the patron came back due to the error, two of the waitresses, Lisa and Dana spent more time arguing with the patron than trying to rectify the issue . I found them to be abrasive and condescending.  I felt sorry for the patron and I wanted walkover and yell "just fix it". Watching the exchange was very uncomfortable and these ladies clearly need customer service training. Sometimes it's not about who's right but about just doing the right thing!

8R2LJn191AqrMj2ncHkzeQ.text: It's not high art, it's functional food and it's an option. I went during dinner at 6:30. I had a minimal wait and was seated at a booth by the jukebox whose selections I forgot to peruse. Some other yelper please address.  The booths are comfortable and wide, enough for the two 240lb male consultants behind me or maybe three 120lb uptown clubbing women. I mention the clubgoer set because by and large I think that's where the patrons are going to come from for this establishment. What Charlotte has greatly lacked is a place making more substantive meals than bar food after 10pm between Uptown and South End/Dilworth.  The menu is as varied as you would want with a 24 hour diner. In terms of the breakdown of choices it's 50% breakfast, 30% lunch, 15% entrees, 5% dessert. I'd like if the low calorie choices were more interesting than iceberg lettuce + cottage cheese + protein on top. Iceberg lettuce is nutritionally bankrupt & except for a iceberg/blue cheese/bacon wedge it's not a salad base.  My order of steak & eggs came quickly and to order meaning the steak was as rare as legally allowed. This brings me to my opening statement as to what to expect. It is functional food served here, not haute cuisine. The eggs were a shade runney, which I prefer, the steak cooked well but could have used some rub and the hashbrowns definitely needed something. These are individual nitpickings as there was salt & pepper on the table and the waitress asked if I wanted steak sauce. The one gripe I have is the biscuit. It's more of a bread dough consistency than a Flying Biscuit/Zada Jane/traditional dough. It comes buttered so the flavor is there but the mouth feel is more spongey than flakey. It's not bad, it's just different.  Th service is warm & friendly without being hovering.  Parking will be an issue as there 8 spots. Carson St stop on the Lynx is a short walk away and I expect to see a number of cabs dropping off late night patrons.  Dear Charlotte, if your durnk if firmly on and you're not in the mood for another street side hotdog you now have another option.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. There&#39;s counter service in addition to booths

aiq2bjTO1hEDdprGHxdsbg.text: Hmmm, finally went to Midnight Diner.  We had breakfast for lunch.  The service was excellent and the food even better.  A big plate of home fries, eggs, bacon, and two great big flapjacks!  I am glad I was sharing.  The ambiance is pretty nice with the colorful and there was a nice crowd in the diner at around 1:30 pm.  All of the plates I saw coming out were piled high - good to know if you're hungry.  However, as with all diners in this area, the menus are not as varied as they are in the North but this one is definitely worth a trip to receive the Northern diner feel.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

g3Xpltq5In2yFHv1oNDUeA.text: I will tell you rarely do I ever say that I liked everything at a restaurant.  I have to say the meal I had was fantastic.  I love the ambiance just like an old 50s diner ya know.  The service was very good.  We went at like 930 at night it wasn't line out the door busy yet.  when we left it was. Now the meal oh my goodness.. PHENOMENAL ONION RINGS which I thought were the best in the city but my friend told me they werent even the best in the city. I'll do a review for that place in a minute. The fried chickens was absolutely the best fried chicken I had every had, it was crispy outside and cooked perfect inside.  The Mac and Cheese reminded me of my mom's mac and cheese awesome, broccoli was well cooked, cole slaw was out of this world and the banana pudding of my goodness,, words dont' do it any justice.  Run to this place get there quickly before the crowds barrage the front door. Great Great place

4rlAffo2FxVw0UuoiZX17A.text: Was impressed with my first visit here.  Everything is super shiny and didn't have to wait too long for a table, but I can see this place being packed on the weekends.  We came here after a party at a bar on a Thursday night so we were definitely starving.  The wait staff was nice and seated us right away.  Ordered and the food came out.....  typical diner food - nothing too too special that caught my eye, but good late night food at that.  Add to the fact that I LOVE LOVE breakfast... this place is golden for me.  I can eat breakfast any time of day now with just a visit here.

VPym6h8vso7RmhFypaKMKA.text: I ordered a chili burger and it was pretty gross. Canned chili and the fries were bleh. However, the French toast was AMAZING!!! It was made from hullah bread and I could have it every morning... I would get big as hell but who care it's that good!! I give the French toast 4 stars the burger can go to hell.

0ecGqpYhmz9x9CQvd0hYkQ.text: Stopped in after work...nice atmosphere and staff.  I ordered a waffle with cheese eggs and a side of bacon.  Waffle was good.  Eggs and bacon were not.  Bacon seemed very old and was tough.

tA9Ml_-eDbqEH2fltM2hng.text: Their biscuits are always fresh but for the most part the food is just average. The location is great and they are open 24hrs. Do not try to go after bars close at 2am because the line is always wrapped around the building on the weekends.

PBJMP9a-98E3RmzNaKcIlQ.text: Awesome food and great service. I asked to have some substitutions and they did it without even thinking about it. Music is a little loud so if you're looking for a quiet place this isn't it. Can't wait for my next trip to Charlotte so I can go back. Went for breakfast on January 30th, 2015.

YRcgXojO3EhF_EZp8mRnsw.text: The food was good...I ordered the coconut french toast along with their chicken wings the wings could have used a little more flavor. I also has their carrot cake it was pretty tasty and a good size portion!

Ztep2UHBD-FQwCHna1ZJkw.text: Food is good, like home cooked food. Always open, so perfect after a night of drinking or post night shift. Good sized portions. Ask for Luke he is the best waiter there, always on top of things.

wmbUy_sfP9pnnqF8mNTioA.text: This is a neat diner but I was underwhelmed with the food.  I ordered the chicken tenders which were good.  My friend had avocado burger which he said was bland.  Cute concept but would not return.

_8TYJ9Hi_uXYn7UFY8VUGQ.text: I work at the hyatt and recommend them all the time because they are close and open 24/7 ....but after my past couple of experiences....with them messing up my order I may stop sending them business....I send them guests everynight but I'm tired of having my burger messed up. Ticket and receipt and order was taken right.....but they messed up making it....no mayonnaise it'll save me trips to the bathroom on third shift here.

IG7wtxXjOSl2lIvARmhRRQ.text: This place is a find!  We landed in Charlotte after a very early flight and Yelped it for a breakfast place. It was just what we were looking for. From the start the hostesses greeted us warmly, no waiting!  We ordered a few different biscuits but the best was the chicken biscuit with a little bit of honey... so stinkin yummy!  Also ordered a side of hash browns with ham on top and were not disappointed. They were flavorful and the portion size generous. Nice strong coffee, just right sweet tea with friendly service.  Great tunes playing in the background only added to the authentic diner feel. Gotta try this joint!

hX2fYCLK9KDw7_BbKm-SBg.text: Had the chicken and waffles. Wings Crispy and juicy yet light enough for breakfast. Service was great especially chasmine! She let me sample her coconut French toast which was super good! Give this place a try.

Q7rtD7LbXKhRLn6Ht3QEAA.text: I'm from the north so diners are kind of our specialty. They got the diner part right and it's nice to have a late night option, but the night I went here I was kind of scared for my life. Cops everywhere both inside and out, and the people going there to eat were pretty abrasive. Food wasn't bad, it's just your typical diner food. I guess it's a good after bars/clubs place.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

jL4cFG4UmUaVfkgpUs04nQ.text: So I was back in Charlotte again! I'm from Charlotte, but this place is new to me, seeing I've been gone a few years. My sisters friend brought  us here during our visit... I believe it was late Friday night, right around 10:30PM. So we were there before the club/party people... however it was still full, but we were seated quickly. Our server was friendly, but my water glass stayed empty.  First off... so are you saying I can get breakfast at 10:30PM?!? YES. I'm already inclined to like this place! I had the Midnight Special: Eggs, sausage, grits and pancakes. The do something different to their grits.. those things are super rich and creamy. I'm a grits fan, but I could only eat but so much of them. The pancakes were kind of thick... but they didn't get soggy as fast as IHOPs so that was a plus.   Sister ordered the shrimp and grits and she LOVED it. I'm not a shrimp and grits fan, but I tasted... and tasty it was lol. And my sisters friend ordered steak with eggs and hashbrowns I believe. She said the steak was tender, but it wasn't really seasoned, so the A1 sauce was a must. She comes here often, and was raving about the chicken and waffles.... something to try next time.  This place is definitely a late-night joint and would definitely hit the spot for me simply because I love breakfast at night.

OpuxZsI7LNIcjhbVzAaa1g.text: I'm adding to my previous review. Today I ordered something I will never try again. Their spaghetti bowl was disgusting. Don't get it.

ER4heH7ZzHjvoRZqpwr2HQ.text: I've frequented this dive for breakfast, lunch, and , dinner!  Lets get down to the point.. Fried chicken, corn beef hash, hash browns, waffle, biscuit sandwich, chicken sandwich Have all been out of hand. I am now a fan of grits thanks to this place.. And what better than a beer with your chicken n waffles.  Dont come here if your looking to watch your weight because you will be disappointed and come on yelp and write a bad review, ruining it for potential patrons. When you visit MD go in with an open mind and a appetite. I can then guarantee you will leave with a smile from ear to ear. Oh yea and the waiters are great!

kzNzoIKvxaJrLJetS-9TKw.text: Still outstanding. Imagine people waiting in the rain to get in. That alone should say it all.   The coffee is just absolutely the best in Charlotte.  I finally got to try the fried half chicken with Mac n cheese and onion rings. Pure gastronomic bliss folks. I could barely move when it was over. I'm hoping we can come back for breakfast before we leave. I just love this place. They do soooooo many things well.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half fried chicken with onion rings and mac and cheese. Pure comfort food for the soul.

lLsgujAATSmwwTnLknDO-w.text: This place is way overrated! Although the staff is friendly and the food is ok+decently priced, even their to-go orders take forever= I've never waited less than 30mins for anything- including salads! Inside feels grimy, music is cranked up way too loud, the late-night crowd is a mixture of hood and trash clientele, male customers verbally harass you if you're not interested in flirting back with them, panhandlers bombard you in the parking lots... not surprised that shootings have happened on this property. I highly recommend going to the other 24hr places in the area.

ud2o8Lnt_FYLzlqUW8Y4zA.text: If I could give this place a "0" I would but I will give it 1 star because the food is GREAT. However the Customer Service is TERRIBLE. Especially when you order to go. They never get the order correct....NEVER. I live downtown and would order from here like every two weeks. SOMETHING was always wrong with my order. You speak to the Manager about it and they are so lackadaisical. So only thing I could do is not spend my money there. So I didnt eat there for a Year. Even when my friends wanted to go, I would decline and sometimes we would choose another place or I would just go home.  My wife wanted the grits really bad today so I got POSTMATES to pick up the order for me. Yeah, it was wrong...AGAIN. Missing my bowl of Grits (main reason we ordered) and I ordered 2 midnight specials and only received the eggs and bacon for one of them. So All i got for my meal is the pancakes! what makes is worse is the POSTMATES guy was like "man.....they are kinda rude and rushy.." He showed me the receipt and the receipt is CORRECT.  I called spoke to "Reba" who said she was the manager on duty. Might as well had spoke to a street sign. Had to repeat myself multiple times and she seemed annoyed.   I will not be going there ANYMORE and I have already secured the contact information for the owner. I will be writing him directly. I am a business owner and i think its important for him to know that though his business seems successful on paper because people come back for the food, they probably could be doing 10xs better if the service was better.  Owner Name from NC Secretary of State website: Brian M Dominick

_ahlNaNWDqGBvoGCEDb1rg.text: Went in for a take out order for 3 people. Waited at the bar for it. The waitress handed me two bags and I assumed everything was in there so I didn't check. Got home and realized I was missing my order (shrimp and grits). I was not going to drive back so I called and she admitted the kitchen forgot it so she said she'd refund me the money back to my card which I thought was great. However, never received a refund so I guess she lied? And now that I try to call, phone doesn't even ring. Terrible. Basically they charged me for shrimp and grits that I never got.. I would say I got robbed.

bqjSjRCRr2KSejTDDHS4ww.text: Jennifer was our server and she's the bomb! I ordered the Bubba and it was great. My wife ordered the chicken tenders and thought they were the best! All the time we were there. there was an out the door line. Will definately be back for more! BY thje way....the coffee was not burned!

Hz0d8Nw11bfILsA7roJ8vQ.text: Onion rings were excellent and full of flavor. The big fish sandwich was the best fish sandwich I've had in years. Prices are great as well.   The only complaints (which warrants a 3 star instead of a 4 star review) the waitress told us no substitutions (we wanted a different side which was the same in price) and the bathroom and floors were dirty.

MSAS6NCjEBLrPslEVmit5w.text: Simply an amazing diner. We were greeted by the host and taken to our table where Bonnie would be waiting on us. I ordered The Bubba which was one of the best comfort meals I've had. Overall the experience was fantastic and one of the best parts was the upbeat attitude of the whole staff. They generally seemed to be having a good time and Bonnie did an excellent job taking care of us. Definitely would recommend Midnight Diner.

O6I9Fljn9GV5umWDJYvxKg.text: Every time the line is out the door and it moves kind of slow because people don't like to get up and leave right away. It is a good late night spot and their desserts are always good. A little noisy though.

urF8iJdhVugSiEB_4X_YdQ.text: Place is great. Very homey. Im here on a layover and had the chicken and waffles and the shrimp n grits. Both fabulous!

TXSU-9rUrpeIV_0BQxoWSQ.text: Very good food...reasonable price.....great location.....outstanding atmosphere...Excellent staff!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

MxxfwIAK82_6mxo_BXtj5Q.text: The shrimp and grits were awesome! The staff was very friendly and attentive! I will definitely be coming back during my next visit to Charlotte.

bQ48VZ4auh4_fFtfHu06Qw.text: Great diner. Shrimp and grits were amazing. Want to crowded and a great menu selection. Friendly staff.  Highly recommended.

cNCwlX3J3gIQouP1VDhL4Q.text: Great spot! Right after seeing a show, looking for a place to get our grub on, we found this place and Daaang! Awwwwwww snaaaapppp! Them shrimp and grits taste so good make a grown man cry. If I'm ever on death row... This is where I'll get my takeout for my last meal. It's that good. ILL BE BACK!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dis gurl know how to treat a guest! Thank ya for da killah service!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Succulent ordeeeerrrrvvsss got me salivatin&#39; and make tummy go &#34;guuurrrrrrr&#34;

9a-ySzz9AAMLlXbyeWB5Rw.text: I absolutely love this diner. The waitstaff is friendly and the food is delicious! Try the grits!

yJwtQoN7j22N_FBMaju6Kw.text: I would have never tried this place had my niece (NC resident) not brought my son and I here after our afternoon of shopping.   The chicken and waffles are VERY GOOD. I was pleasantly surprised at how soft and moist the Belgian waffle was. No joke. I didn't use any utensils because I just wanted the "finger lickin' good" affect after I tasted my first bite.   The chicken wings are probably one of the best I've had. Simple down home cookin' is what this meal reminded me of. Traysel took good care of us too!   This SoCal girl will definitely be back the next time she is in Charlotte.

O1YtR4oKywqcrdHuuShRvw.text: Yeahh...the shrimp and grits ARE ALL THAT!!!  Never had grits so creamy!!!!  Firecracker shrimp(think that's the name) is also a good appetizer...shrimp is covered in a tasty sauce and they are kind of crispy...Yum!!  Mac n cheese was good too but needed a more cheddar taste.  Lil one had the peanut butter and marshmallow toasted sandwich...well I ordered it but she did not eat it...but that's just her being contrary. ...that sandwich was that bomb too...but on the kids meal.  Next time I want to try the Bubba!

5jhVijdRSGlv4ktuGtQM-Q.text: Well Well Well, after writing a few other reviews today, my friend and I started to talk about places to eat and of course one of my favorite places in the Queen City has to be Midnight Diner. The selection of breakfast, lunch, and dinner is to die for. if you try going here after the club lets out you might just die of hunger waiting to be seated....lol It is a diner though so don't expect them to move for Uptown to Pineville into an enormous building, this is not a China Buffet. I will say that it is larger than most Diner's that i visited up North. I have been here at least 5 times or more and still haven't made it off of the breakfast menu, when I here Diner I just think breakfast. I give them 5 Stars so you know what that means, they have free WiFi and Great Food. I always get a different waitress, but they all are so nice and great at what they do.   ENJOY!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZGaMSvJtCPPxHSVr3bddcQ.text: Met my daughter there on a Tuesday night.  Although busy, there was free parking available, we were greeted, seated and served right away.  We did not expect a gourmet experience.  We ordered the fish platter, mac & cheese, and spaghetti.  The food was acceptable and reasonably priced.  In summary, we had a nice, relaxing experience near downtown.  We would definitely recommend to others.

AJ0RLXARNBk0kPdAMuswzw.text: Keiosha was great. Chicken & waffles for $9.99. Group of us were 6 deep and were seated at 2:30 am and waited in a long line that went quickly. Roughly 30mins. And food came in 20mins...perfect for an after party/club'n crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. These some good ole fried chicken wings...and yummy waffle. To bad the butter wasnt real
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

RQaL3d9SJ2Chy8A9kMLwkw.text: We had another fantastic experience at Midnight Diner; this time for lunch instead of breakfast.  First, being close to Uptown, let me say that I'm SO glad they have very close parking for customers.    Our server, Rachael, was fantastic.  She's what every server should aspire to.  She was friendly, perky, attentive, and genuine.  I hope she never loses that optimism.    One of the lunch specials was Shrimp and Grits with a creamy Cajun sauce.  Rachael recommended it, but my partner was already contemplating it.  That sealed the deal.  He ordered that and I went with the Black & Blue Burger.  I tasted the Shrimp and Grits.  It was SO delicious and full of flavor.  The creamy Cajun sauce was a great addition.  I should have ordered it.  The Black and Blue Burger was just okay.  Maybe it needed more seasoning and blue cheese dressing in addition to the chunks of blue cheese.  Of course, being a bit redder/pinker inside would have been nice, too.  Unfortunately, you can't get that in NC (Boo!).  The fries accompanying it (with a side of ranch that I requested) were delicious, though.    And you can't beat the prices or clean, shiny atmosphere at Midnight Diner.  They're two for two in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

f-tvLTbpYB8OX10xJMl0Eg.text: What can i say but DAYUM!!!!! this food is off the chain. I had the Big Boy breakfast. Nice biscuits with homemade sausage gravy, a slab of country ham, and some buttermilk cheese grits. Needless to say I made a Happy Plate. If ever in the Charlotte area please stop by. Open 24/7 for the party people.

WnFREl5yLvBCbb9DaxtPEA.text: Ive come here on two different occasions and I truly enjoyed my food and dining experience as a whole. I love the quaint little diner. The first time I ordered the shrimp and grits which is to die for and the second time I ordered the fish sandwich and my counterpart ordered the fried chicken. The food was good and the service was good as well. I cant wait to bring my mom and some other out of towners. This is my new go to spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp n grits

3rcaS13UD7xED5C0pLnohQ.text: Fast food. Very friendly service. Food was quick, fresh and hot. A must stop if you are in the NC area.   Upgrade your waffle and fried chicken to FRENCH TOAST and fried chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken and French toast.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

IMi_Qyla6C4D1MOoUAJF_A.text: Your basic diner- that's how I would describe this place. Came here for breakfast- typical breakfast food. Service was fine- waitress was pleasant. Prices were inexpensive. I got a biscuit sandwich- the biscuit itself was wonderful- savory and sweet. Wouldn't mind checking this place out again for lunch or dinner- I heard it's good.

7YBBHxen53mTRVGiXw-Yxw.text: Everytime I go to Charlotte for night life, I always have midnight diner on my mind.   By far my favorite thing is the shrimp and grits! They use a great blend of green and red peppers and just enough spice. This is paired with a fluffy biscuit on the side.  This time I tried the 2 piece chicken and waffles, and I will say again I was impressed. I am a pancake over waffle kind of gal, but their waffle had a nice taste and was cooked well! I added some hot sauce to the wings, and then devoured my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

rGx_chiayAaecQel6FFzXg.text: Hits the spot for what you need. Came here after a night out. It's just what you'd expect cheap greasy breakfast food. Hits the spot!!

kR6a4ECIgnFpdl0s_IxGYQ.text: I've been to this place a few times at different hours of the day. I have had the fried chicken (tasty), the "philly" cheesesteak,  and one of their most talked about items...the Cajun shrimp & grits (Amazing!). As a northern I typically don't eat grits. If I do, it has to be made like my oatmeal or cream of wheat which is with butter and sugar. In this instance though, take it as it is. You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

kSg4N5KTkO9LR5u4oswA5g.text: Service is good. Food comes out freshly cooked and hot! It gets busy but good still comes out promptly.

q07RLqCen-hofQmCTAduWg.text: Horrid. Grotesque and if there were a worse adjective I would use that. I can't fathom how this place has any good ratings. Perhaps drunken millennial smasholes? It took us 20 minutes to be greeted at least. My well done burger was cold. Not quite sure how that happens and my husband is currently sticking his finger down his throat in the bathroom bc he felt so ill after his oh so delectable meal. Spare Yourselves, your digestive tracts and go elsewhere...you're better than this.

Mc6zBqqAbuBSO_MyTdg3uw.text: This restaurant has one of the best shrimp and grits I have ever had!  The service is quick and prompt. I would highly suggest going on a weekday morning when it is not that busy so you can truly enjoy the experience.   Though I have only been once, I can honestly say I've been sold on the shrimp and grits alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Bubba w/ sausage patties and a Belgian waffle.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits!

NjfIGAuLqMzYChIu_BR6XA.text: I'm a bit disappointed by this place. I got the fried chicken with mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. Everything was bland. With that said, the chicken was fried to crispy perfection and was succulent and oily, just the way I like it. The sides were luke warm though and just unpleasant to eat.   I guess it's a good place to go if you're watching your blood pressure. Me, I need some more salt and spices!

gjSHluXQ57ocii7IGi_Wcg.text: OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE! I definitely had doubts because its one of those places thats open 24/7 and a lotttt of people come here after a looong night out which is what I did the first time I went to Midnight Diner and it was delicious! But then the other day I got take out for Sunday morning breakfast and it was just as good! So sober or after a night of drinking, midnight diner is a must!   Both times I got a grilled cheese with cheddar cheese and french fries, yummy! And a really large portion for only 6 dollars! My boyfriend got chicken and waffles the first time which was great also. And the second time he got the midnight breakfast special i think it was called. 10 dollars for eggs, pancakes, hash browns, sausage, and cheesy grits! Sooo much food, good food, for really cheap! We also got a side of macaroni and cheese which is probably in the top 3 mac and cheeses I have had since I moved to Charlotte!   Just know, that if you plan to dine in, you are definitely going to wait whether its late night or breakfast time, there is always a line at the door. Trust me, the wait is worth it! I cant wait to go back and get another grilled cheese and try some new items on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Midnight diner special
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waffle

XbDVB6k9mE0CYk35mJo6yg.text: Great time and good comfort food! I think our waiter's name is Darren and he was incredible! Very entertaining! Request him when you go, he had a pun for everything we said/ordered, which is a pretty unique talent lol! This wasn't my first time at this restaurant, but it was definitely my first time feeling it was worthy of a review. We had a large party and he managed to keep us entertained and our order was accurate!!

3Nt9wD_2CWRh0gNzsdHYDw.text: Y'all, this is my guilty pleasure! Their menu is GIGANTIC and they so many options! The only downside other than steaks will 9/10 be well done (lol) is the wait time. It feels like it's ALWAYS crowded, the space itself is not the biggest so I guess that's to be expected. The staff is almost always friendly (you can't win them all), the pricing is excellent and it being 24/7 is the BEST perk! Especially when the entire city of Charlotte feels like it shuts down at 6pm on a Sunday... #southernliving

FWYYM1dmXMFDT_1LbPfvBQ.text: Nice place with friendly staffs and very delicious food this is a great place to take your family sometimes a little slow with the service because of been so pack with customers.

X1YsQUpmNmyXv6ZC5VnXOw.text: Came to Charlotte for the weekend from Richmond, VA. We do not have a 24 hour diner like this, so I was very excited after a five hour drive to try it. It matched my expectations and then some.  I had French toast which was great to eat after a long drive. It was flavorful challah bread which was excellent even without syrup. Eggs were solid. Tasty strong coffee.  The rest of my family had burgers, and fried chicken. Overall, very tasty food at fair prices. I'd I lived in Charlotte, I would be here very often.

Eptzpv2RXOM6--4Ib0Oz5g.text: AMAZING. shrimp n grits were to die for. good service. nice theme however it's tight space but its great overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

KheHsQ94EwO1bcFMvyqlCA.text: Listen Mid night dinner is my go to place for breakfast lunch or dinner of after the club any time I'm getting those shrimp and grits. My brother loved the chicken and waffle and my BFF ordered fried fish that I almost ate all of her food and I clearly had my own plate. I love this place it can get packed after midnight they serve alcohol at the bar but every one is really there for  the food. I mean I seriously wrote dinners and drive in about this place because the grits are so damn good I want to know the recipe. If your in Charlotte come to uptown and check them out you wont be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Liver mush and smothered biscuit
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

trNJ40_DSYhj4gPpmJibiw.text: This is quickly becoming one of our favorite breakfast spots. I've been stuck in a rut our last few visits. I get the special which has two eggs, your choice of breakfast meat, grits or hash browns or fruit, and pancakes.   The grits are some of the best I've had outside of my own kitchen. And the pancakes. Oh, they are fluffy and delicious and the perfect treat at the end of my meal for this pregnant lady.

jC7aE5iqNKSmhz0bl-fBFA.text: This is definitely my go to restaurant when I'm feeling hungry after midnight! It's best to go before 2, because that's when the clubs close and there will definitely be a line out the door! I have been several times, but the most recent was so funny! We were sat (almost immediately) - just 2 of us. And the waitress - I cannot remember her name - welcomed us with open arms! She got our drink order and we needed a few minutes (well I knew what I wanted, but he didn't) to order.  I got the eggs, grits and bacon with a side of toast. Eggs over hard. I don't know if that's on the menu, but that's what I wanted (and I think she made it work). Everything was delicious! The grits are hands down my favorite - add a little cheese and I'm in heaven!! I ate everything and I was so full! My fiance wanted the chicken and waffles (and she suggested to get French toast instead) so he did. He said it was way better with the French toast and he will always order it that way!! There was a larger group - about 7- that came in after us. They were definitely a little buzzed but they were great entertainment! They sang along to every song that played and they were cracking jokes.  I will definitely be back when my 2 am hunger kicks in!

n0Wlv4jyDQWpRDhAwDShow.text: A neon red and shiny chrome jewel in the Queen City's crown. Come to the midnight Diner any time of the day or night for a hearty breakfast or dinner. Try the shrimp & grits, chicken salad, full bar, waffles, or a big slice of cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Uptown
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Happy waitresses
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Happy waitress

VeFGniGq9zAi_vySBkrnig.text: I came to Midnight Diner for the first time for brunch. There wasn't anything special. It is just your classic diner. I really liked the feel of the diner, very retro and the records on the walls were cool.   But when it comes down to it, people go to restaurants to eat. And honestly, the food to me was mediocre. I got the uptown which included a waffle, 2 eggs poached and hashbrowns. My husband got a tall stack of chocolate chip pancakes and an egg and cheese on a biscuit and 2 scrambled eggs. I also ordered a coffee. The presentation of the food was really unappealing to me. It did was kind of just thrown on the plate. My waffle was good, I liked that the syrup was nice and hot and I asked for the honey butter as well. I really despised the taste of my hashbrowns. They were too hard and there was a weird aftertaste. Overall, you do get your money's worth. The price is actually pretty great for what you get and the service is good.   Other food looked better. Something I saw frequently ordered was the shrimp and grits. For breakfast, the french toast or omlette looked the best. It does not hurt to try. I may come back for dinner one day.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waffle
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hashbrowns
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Egg and Cheese Biscuit

He2ZiaFb1VcXpr98-09xBw.text: This was the only place open when we got stuck in Charlotte after missed connections. The service was awesome! We had wings, pancakes, chicken fingers, fries, grits and hash browns. I would say get the fries and grits for sure. Hash browns were good but hash browns. I really liked the chicken fingers and wings! They weren't too fried or breaded which was nice. It's a fun spot and I was grateful it was open at 1am!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hashbrowns with some bites out oops!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings and grits

ykn11uQAneQTNyuOWQMXug.text: HOLY COW! The French Toast was totally the best I've ever had!! I love challah bread especially when used for French toast.  I have to admit that when I saw the menu I was not prepared for the price but once I saw the amount of food I received I totally understood. It not only smelled delightful it was delicious. I plan to return very soon in order to try some other menu items.

Lqp8YlvjEM8Br3ZTO4pPrw.text: Hit or miss. The quality of your food and service depends on the crew working-which shouldn't be the case. They could definitely use some consistency training. Some of the older guys are so grumpy! They don't even speak. I can go elsewhere and pay less if I want to be treated rudely. One evening, after politely notifying the MOD, I left. The waitress was clearly preoccupied with her phone and kept coming in and out of the restroom...without washing her hands. This place is a staple, but def not worth the hype...anymore.

98-Tw0-8QFg4_cKAdMzKCw.text: I came here with my bf about 1.5 weeks ago for a quick lunch before we headed off to a daytime activity, and luckily since it was a workday (we were on PTO), it was super easy to get seated right away.   I ordered with my stomach rather than my brain and got the following items: chocolate milk, grilled cheese (with tomato) which comes with a side of fries already, and a side order of hashed browns w/ cheese + onions. Our waiter asked me if I wanted to sub my fries for the hashbrowns, and I was like "nahh, it's okay". Boy, I should have said yes. When our food arrived, I took one look at it, and I was like holy crap what did i do.   There was so MUCH food. I finished 3/4 of my grilled cheese, 1/2 of my hash browns, and 1/2 of my fries. And I felt soooo guilty since I hate wasting food. However, service was super quick, and our waiter was so nice. Limited menu for vegetarians, however, there are still some options available. Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

5dE_M_gJNsIWfMQkNoTCgA.text: We love Midnight Diner for a casual but delicious meal. They serve breakfast all day but have a wide range of other menu options.
