They also have a good selection of meatless options for vegetarians. The food always seems fresh. The staff is usually friendly. The atmosphere is casual but comfortable, just like an old diner!

gyBzHbArEi0-XYgFiKqYSw.text: This place gave me such a bad experience. I had such a rude hostess. The only person that was nice was luckily, my waiter. It took forever to get someone to wait on me because it seemed like the others were just standing there for no reason. I wouldn't go back again. Food was nothing special. I would've been better off at a wafflehouse.

jxyqPbIVu3Y9V14obIFh0g.text: So if you follow me on the social network @RockSolidReview, then you might already know that this place called the Midnight Diner was recommended to me by my parents. My mom's favorite dish is the shrimp and grits, so I had to go with mom's recommendation despite not being a huge fan of grits. OH MY, WORDY! Well, that changed instantly with the first bite. The grits, the shrimp, even the side biscuit were the bomb dot com! Let's talk about that biscuit for just a quick moment. Do you see the small pool of melted butter puddled atop the perfectly browned upper crust? If not, go back and look, it's there, and it is delicious! The biscuit was thick, doughy, but also flakey. Now, I don't know how to articulate grits nearly as well as that biscuit, but I can write how savory, creamy, and amazing they felt in my mouth. The smooth texture slid down my throat like a southern jazz fest. Since I feel like this review is taking a somewhat sexual turn, I'm just going to stop now. If you want to find out what I'm talking about, then go to the Midnight Diner in Charlotte, North Carolina.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ben Lolli outside Midnight Diner
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side Salad

W4gTwEiVwyiHpbt2g10QDA.text: We went on the 4th of July after watching the fireworks at BB&T Stadium based on the reviews. When we arrived the line was out the door and down the sidewalk!  We waited 10-15 minutes before being ushered to a booth. Our drink order was taken quickly by a friendly waitress and were given plenty of time to review the menu.   Several customers were having the shrimp and grits and others had the chicken and waffles. My hubs opted for the shrimp and grits, I had the Denver omelette and our daughter had the pancakes and sausage. The pancakes are REALLY good!! He liked his food and the omelette was filled with ingredients.  The food came out pretty quickly considering every seat in the place was occupied. We were surprised to see they even had a bar with premium liquors.   This is a place we'd visit again the next time we're in town.

cvA1Kv2Yqtn7BH3A-zoUJQ.text: WOWOWOWOW. The reviews did NOT lie-this place was incredible. We walked here from downtown Charlotte on a lovely Sunday morning and it was only a sweet 15-minute stroll.  When we got there we were seated right away but there was definitely a long line on our way out-so get there early!  Our waitress was so friendly and clearly had a deep knowledge of the enormous menu. There were 5 of us so we got a pretty varied group of breakfast foods, including the bubba, shrimp and grits, chicken and waffles and cornbeef. We're a pretty chatty group but as soon as the food came out we went silent from awe and stuffing our faces haha While everything was delicious, the top two were definitely the shrimp and grits and Bubba--the grits in particular are amaaaaaaaaaazing absolutely get them. The shrimp and grits was sooo flavorful and spicy! The shrimp were perfectly cooked and the added veggies were colorful compliments. The Bubba was a huge mix of sausage gravy, biscuits and eggs-it was truly enough for two people. The sausage gravy was also so good-truly old school farmer breakfast filling and the biscuits were soft buttery goodness. I dream about this place on the weekends and may drive the 2 hours for it one Sunday ;)

0KPqcJ_34SzGSR_ZcE606A.text: This place is amazing. This was my second time here. I came at around 3:00am after bar hopping. We had to wait in line outside for about 30 minutes. There were cops monitoring the line since it can get pretty crazy. Once we sat, everything was so quick. We just went with the basic pancakes, bacon, eggs and hashbrowns. Our waitress was super nice and attentive. I would highly recommend to anyone who wants some good diner food. This place is definitely worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

rs8Bo69yv4CVcAIpLI-3AA.text: I like the retro style. The food was good. The wait was short. I will definitely be back when I'm in Charlotte again.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

YNzkJf2wAzmGvONyb-JX0w.text: Was in town for a layover with friends and one of them who lives in the area suggested Midnight Diner. Went in at around 10:45 am on a Saturday morning. There was a wait to sit inside so we decided to sit outside. The weather was perfect. Our server Sandrell was such a pleasant lady. She greeted us and took our drinks out in no time and then she put our mains in. We had the chicken and waffles, the San Bernardino omelette and shrimp and grits and eggs and waffles. Everyone was satisfied with their meals. At first when I tasted the omelette Is was underwhelming but after adding hot sauce it was a game changer. The hash browns were crispy on the outside just the way I liked it. The shrimp and grits were FIRE! Probably the best shrimp and grits I have had and I've had a great amount of shrimps and grits from different places. The biscuits served here was so soft and yummy. Even after getting cold they were still soft. All the servers here are very pleasant. Service was great, prices are fair for what you get and the energy is great. I highly recommend for quick brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

KefSJKMb5HoLMRTNw5eBzA.text: My all time favorite late night spot. Not only is it open until almost 5 am, the atmosphere of the diner is really fun and cute, and the food is great! Midnight diner is always good food and a great time. This restaurant is also the reason I love grits today. Their grits are top 1. Other good things on the menu you can't go wrong with- firecracker shrimp/chicken, shrimp & grits, corned beef hash breakfast, and chicken wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corned beef hash, eggs, toast, &amp; grits
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; grits

8YoTguzkDTT267dN0C_FGg.text: Midnight Diner has a huge menu, but I decided on the shrimp and grits after I noticed everyone around me was ordering it. It seems to be their signature, and now I know why. I'm from the north, and let me tell you, those grits were mind blowingingly flavorful and creamy. Very cool ambience. Mediocre service. Very loud.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits

oYPyDSUE6ScCfkOt0NxYjA.text: He Said:  I'm sorry, did you say "Liver mush"?  Yes, please!  If you were to read our breakfast reviews you'd notice a common theme: we are always on the lookout for a great breakfast spot when we visit a city and if there is scrapple or corned beef hash on the menu then we're definitely showing up.  They have corned beef hash, but the liver mush was the True draw for me.  Not disappointed!  It was a healthy-sized slab served with wonderfully crispy hash browns, two eggs that were nearly perfectly runny, and fantastic rye toast.  I had a side of corned beef hash, because I have to, and that was a little disappointing--particularly since it wasn't delivered until I had finished the rest of the meal.  I was pretty close to telling our waiter to forget it, but he was hard to track down.  Also, I think the corned beef is canned. A deal-breaker?  No way!    The coffee was good, the vibe was diner-classic, the staff was friendly, though perhaps a bit stretched, and the prices are just right.  I am sure we will be back.  She Said: Eggs Benedict wasn't an option at Midnight Diner, so I decided on a breakfast sandwich. I got it on a biscuit--eggs scrambled, bacon, and with cheddar cheese. It was tasty enough, but the side of hash browns was the best part of my breakfast. They were perfectly crispy and delicious. Our waiter was very nice--if a bit distracted by the many patrons. The diner was definitely busy, but the food is good, the space is fun, and I'd say it was worth the wait.   Potty Points: 3 out of 5 potty points. There wasn't a wait, and it served its purpose--but it's an odd space, that's for sure.

nb5mmGnsRYXlFcf2HE7-dQ.text: Cheap, greasy, comfort food for the late night hunger pains.   A small line stays active yet once you get inside the Servers are pretty attentive. Unless there are characters & hooligans that are overly intoxicated holding them up.  To note, Law Enforcement presence is heavy.   The kitchen can't accommodate food allergies & preferences so sticking with the basics aka 'Sides' is the smart way to go. For the Southern Food Fans, I saw heaping plates of Shrimp/Grits & Chicken/Waffles.   For the late night diner aspect this concept works.

9_5rW6CwRymJo45CKaq-fw.text: One of my favorite late night spots to eat! I used to order the Chicken and French Toast (made with delicious thick cut Challah bread, YUM!) with a side of collards (Awesome, when cooked right) or mac and cheese (DELICIOUS!) but now I get the shrimp and grits (BEST THING ON THE MENU!!!!). Even the Grits by themselves is amazing! Best grits in town! If you're hungry after a night of partying this is the place to go. I must mention that some days the collards are a hit, some days are a miss.   I also suggest getting there before 1:30 am or after 4 am otherwise you'll be standing in line for a table and if you want to pick food up it has to be called in before hand.

YsJXrSpmGsZDO5epCjAJnA.text: WOW! I really cannot believe I have not been here until yesterday after constant recommendations to go check the diner out. I've been hearing 2 things from everyone: Chicken & Waffles and Shrimp & Grits.   Let me just say their menu is quite extensive to suffice for any meal of the day. The glistening metallic hub always caught my eye when I drove through the city and every time, it was bustling with people. I got to try both the Chicken & Waffles and Shrimp & Grits and both did NOT disappoint. I also got a side of hashbrowns. Everything that was supposed to be crispy, was crispy! The chicken was straight out the fryer and brimming with its juices once you take a bite. My biggest regret was forgetting to ask for hot sauce for my chicken. My hashbrowns were a little too oily on the bottom which I didn't particularly enjoy, but the top layer was nice and crispy.   Service was exceptional and our waitress told us she was sleepy. However, she never let that get in the way of giving us superior service. Also, I really appreciate the parking lot because that saved a lot of time and money.

N_V5VAJMfQEUdD7-46PhUA.text: The only negative thing I can say about this place is the long wait. The two times I've been there, the line was out the door. Once I was seated and started eating, I understood why. The food is outstanding. I've had the chicken wings and waffles. Delicious. The chicken was crispy, fried hard and well seasoned. The waffle was perfection. But to me, the absolute best item on the menu was the grits. They were the most creamy grits I've ever eaten. I got them to put cheddar in my grits. They were delicious. Next time I'm there, I will definitely get grits again. The menu has a very large selection of food. I really enjoyed dining there.

bkzThSqucXq2PaUkLP7HEw.text: Never had my son say it was the best burger he's had. And we eat out a lot. My chicken and waffles were awesome and so was the banana pudding. The vanilla wafers didn't taste like they were from the box but tasted like mini cakes.

jfHWYwZXInQaGZdZ3KpANw.text: Everything we had was SOOO good. Coconut French toast and wings is a must try. Service was great too. Definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coconut French toast is amazing. Fried chicken was really good. Service was great! Definitely coming back.

_c7Z_cJfsKxunvYYh7BO4Q.text: Went to the Midnight Diner for the first time.  It wasn't so bad.    A friend and I went at late night because we wanted something good to eat.  I suggested the Midnight Diner because I always see people going here.  I ordered the Chicken & Waffles, but I honestly wasn't impressed.  The waffle was good, but the Chicken was dry.  Maybe it was a first time thing, but I'm willing to give it another shot.

5xphxTiOMg7ApwySh9XHhA.text: Heard so much about this place. Stood at the front and waited for someone to greet us for almost 5 minutes. Most of my table ordered chicken and french toast. My husband's chicken came out extremely burnt and had to be sent back. I ordered a breakfast plate with eggs, sausage and french toast which was just okay. I was extremely excited to try it,big highly disappointed. I can say our server was great and made good recommendations.

bHc8Slk3D2HzldSs-czt5A.text: Such an awesome find last night! I got the Bubba and my gf got the chicken and waffles. Everything tastes great and the staff was super nice. Also it was a very clean diner I recommend this place to anyone who loves comfort food!

QMK-E2GAZzC1cZC5rnhAgw.text: Stopped in accidentally, place is busy and packed.  We ordered the chicken fingers which was yummy but the fries came out cold.  Dad had the chicken salad which he said was ok and my daughter had the veggie burger which she said was ok.  Chicken was the best thing. Not sure I would return.  Lots of staff, most just talking and not working, but friendly.

RpewPoLCrKk6HCg8_kX-AA.text: Very friendly atmosphere. The shrimp and grits are amazing. Creamiest grits you can imagine. Check it out.   Two cautions: 1. Saturday and Sunday mornings are busy. 2. Limited parking.

0lQ1UfFbu1jyTS_YodcaVg.text: Late night food option. Great service for drunks. Try the grilled cheese all the way.

D1tfZGAxL2qFb_wQZZtCFw.text: This place almost always brings in a crowd. We love it, however, the service isn't always the best. I've always enjoyed my food. Love the grits! I'll order shrimp and grits or grits with scrambled eggs and bacon.

hv3nwWo_9zw-podFqHrHmw.text: Wow. This diner is unbelievably great! Came in town for weekend and brought 3 kids. There was a long line outside but they move people thru so it was only a 15 minute wait.  Well worth it so stick around!  I was starving so I had the Midnight Special. It was huge and delicious.  2 kids had waffles and chicken. They loved chicken so much we ordered more chicken.  Pancakes were also ordered and fluffy.  The staff is on it and place clean and dinerlicious!  We will be back!!

NEkFZOIySAC_iTPbCe-HqA.text: While their food is quite filling anytime of the day; the staff could be more efficient and accurate. I agree with one of the reviews here, I've been here 5 times and every single time I go(all evenings-around 9pm-2am), there is a number of staff taking smoke break right outside of the restaurant. I don't like breaking through a barrier of smoke just to go to the entrance nor do I like having the smell cling from such a short encounter. Sometimes the host is nowhere to be found so the servers just sweeps you off your feet to their section when eyed upon.   DON'T EVEN think about doing carry out orders either, it's never accurate and when you try to see if your order is correct by opening your to-go boxes by checkout, you get a slap down saying that "you don't need to check it, I made sure everything is in there." BALLS. I've had spaghetti without the house salad it is suppose to come with, no dressings, no sausage...the side items never made it either. They have a pretty clear sign that once you step out with your order, they are not responsible for missing items. CAN A SISTER PHYSICALLY CHECK IF HER ORDER IS RIGHT BEFORE SHE PAYS? WITHOUT NO FALSE ASSURANCE?   While I'm done with being bitter, I would love to thank the wonderful cooks and chefs. You guys make my tummy happy.  Their fried chicken is crispy and just right. French toast is enough to explode your abdomen on half orders. Tea is southern sweet. Grits are wonderfully buttery and creamy. Make sure when you order a breakfast sandwich, check if it's biscuit or sandwich bread. We were bummed when we got bread. Shrimp and grits, spaghetti hits the spot if you're "hangry". Can't pledge for the burgers since it's been dry(patty) and bland the last two times I've tried it.    If you're ever hungry late at night, try midnight diner. It's a miss or hit on the menu but give it a try. Some of the servers are to adore but some could use a good pair of boots up their donk.

eqyTBM8JNakMY5KZD4HP1w.text: Not bad for the first time around. Dave started off pretty sluggish and inattentive but he pulled it together and redeemed himself. I ordered the chicken and waffles while my colleague ordered the burger. When her burger arrived with onions, she asked me to switch plates. Even though my taste buds were set for a sweet and salty combo, I was just as pleased with the burger and home cut fries. I will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

FyizsSwXe0x7t-ezyfcB2A.text: This is our second visit to the Midnight Diner and it is phenomenal.  Jetaun is a master server very efficient accommodating, attentive, and positive. Robert was very helpful getting us seated on a busy Sunday and the food was no less than perfect.

g2cF5UhBqv6HWuJ862thNA.text: Solid, but nothing to write home about.  I had been craving a waffle all day and was disappointed with the waffle here, as it was really nothing better than what I could make at home with a waffle iron.  Also, the menu stated that it was supposed to come with whipped butter, and it did not.  I had to use the little packets of imitation butter and it just wasn't the same.  The corned beef hash, on the other hand, was excellent.  My husband had fried chicken, which was also excellent.  Service was adequate, but again, nothing to write home about.  They seemed to have about ten servers walking around looking frantic... somehow overstaffed but at the same time not delivering good service.  It was strange.  I will be back, however.  I want to try to desserts and something other than the waffle.

eN-sVuds4QQ2dRTq6f_N7w.text: Came here starving after a few bar stops and saw some recommend Coconut French Toast and Wings and goodness gracious it was goooodddd! It's worth a try if you're looking for somewhere open 24/7

OQWHRFTlXEnbkC384GLjGw.text: I enjoy going to the Midnight Diner, it's always there when you're hungry. We've gone many a morning afters, and many a late evenings. I love the firecracker shrimp salad, warm delicious shrimp tossed in firecracker sauce and put on a bed of sexy lettuce...(didn't know lettuce could be sexy did you?).  I've also had an omelette here, fries, grilled cheese, carrot cake. I haven't had anything I didn't like. My friends have tried the chicken and waffles, and even french toast and chicken (upon request), chili cheese-fries, hot dogs, and the Mexican burger YUM.  The crowd here gets interesting, so keep a look out for some good people watching moments. We love when we get a fun waiter/waitress to like Lissssssaaa, which is exactly what her name tags reads.  Try out Midnight diner for your next late nite, or after hours get together, or morning after a good time Uptown!

eF6MmP6C9RL-BgsH1ZNtKA.text: Back when I used to drink like a fish, I ended up here at the end of the night or early the next afternoon many times. In a drunken stupor or in the early stages of a hangover, I want the grease cure and anything that is bad for me. The food is probably fit for consumption sober as well.  This is a comfort food zone & its best to put all thoughts of counting calories out of your pretty little head & replace them with thoughts of chicken and waffles. Yes, just like everyone else who has eaten here, I've had the chicken & waffles.  This is THE meal to sop up a night's debauchery & it's just awesome all around. I'm a waffle purist and don't go for all that fruit and circuses on a waffle. Why mess with perfection? I mean if it ain't broke, don't fix it. But if you want all that shit on your waffle, they have it. Gotta be making stuff complicated.   A huge Belgian waffle with a side of 3 fried crispy chicken wings.  The waffle is light yet slightly firm(as it should be). Nothing worse than a waffle that is as soft and floppy as a pancake. If I wanted a pancake, I'd get a pancake. Lookin at you free breakfast at Hampton Inn.  If that doesn't sound good to you, then I don't know what to tell you. Get a salad? Find a place with linens & pay too much? One of those two.  The fried chicken could be some of the best in Charlotte. Once upon a time, some friends & I split a whole fried chicken meal in the wee hours of the morning with friends. After spending too much at the bars, it works out perfectly divided 4 ways since we are cheap & broke at that point. Chicken quartered, fresh and fried, always hot & never greasy. Food here doesn't sit under some heat lamp for 15 minuted before making it to your table. What's up with places like that? Bring it already.  Served with two sides, the mac & cheese is superior. And it was served with made from scratch biscuits.  All the other diner favorites are available. Deli sandwiches, omelettes, grits, etc. But weren't you listening?! Just get the chicken & waffles.

NgYP85QVtSwMUYNI34k2Vg.text: There are few places near uptown that are as accessible and as easy to get to as Midnight Diner.  I ordered the coffee and it was generally what I expected from a diner lol.  I didn't come here for the award winning coffee.  It's a good place to stop by to grab a quick breakfast that is decently prepared.  The morning crowd is drastically different than the late night crowd; it is comprised mostly of professionals on their way to work.  The service is much better early in the morning.  You'll see what I mean if you visit this place during the night hours.  Overall I love occasionally stopping by this place.  Try the Fried Chicken for lunch.  It's good.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak and Eggs

KCjGuonkUsCRNTQyYlunYA.text: Clean, no spotless!  Delicious!! Fantastic service.  Priced reasonably.  Comfortable and nostalgic.  We'll be back.  Thanks for a wonderful comfortable dining experience. I had the burger and fries and my husband had the firecracker shrimp salad and we topped it off with sharing a delicious brownie dessert.   No line at 5:00 pm Saturday but I can see that almost any other time there would be a wait.  Definately a fun place to stop in Charlotte.

FKqu7JqAdahB_WzPbt---w.text: My husband decided to take me here. We went very late in the evening. The line was out the door. (Which I know isn't unusual for this place). The line seemed to move at a decent pace. In no time we were seated and waited on. The server was very friendly. The atmosphere was very loud and chaotic. I had a very hard time hearing my husband who was sitting right in front of me. We are young, so our ears work perfectly fine. The food came out extremely quickly. I ordered breakfast (eggs, hash browns, bacon, toast, grits and a pancake). My husband ordered dinner (philly cheesesteak with fries). Our food was very bland. No seasoning or flavor to taste. I used salt and pepper to make my food more appealing. My husbands sandwich was very bland too. No flavor. I figured at least his food would have some sort of kick to it. We didn't understand all the hype about this place. Their sweet tea is extremely sweet. Which is perfect.

h7SRmqyzbzeBEZxChWuITw.text: Follow-up on the challah french toast:   Visited on 10/5 (see review that date) and said I would go back for the french toast. No disappointment on that one!!!!  Oh, my: .the syrup just drained into the Mackinaw City crunch and powdered sugar covered delight composed of thick, generous pieces of lightly egg battered challah. What a delight, bite by delicious bite!!!!   Need I say more???

Vx43p20K9MWRPljOnhxcqg.text: Everything I've had here is has been great! Definitely the best fried chicken I've ever had. You can tell it's been marinated and the skin is delicious. I've had just about all of their sides and they're all good. Their French toast is awesome and the burgers are one of the best around although I'm not a fan of them cutting it in half. Surprisingly the spaghetti is pretty dang good. Overall above average food especially for a diner. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

RJlTjyw8u6hQrGWe76N0fA.text: This is a place that's pretty good at what they are - a retro diner with the predictable treats of burgers, milkshakes, club sandwiches and fried chicken fingers. Service was good, food was exactly what you expect and they do have a new age juke box. Decor matches the theme too.

YxqOSrYOIzQs30XhpHkAkw.text: Midnight Diner in Charlotte is so delicious!  We went for brunch on a Sunday morning.  There was a bit of a wait but it was worth it.  The Bubba is amazing.  I got it with a side of hash browns.  They are perfectly crispy!  My friend got hers with grits and the grits are some of the best I have ever had!  I would definitely go back again.  The shrimp and grits are also amazing!

xbftQCqqxEZYtQOEtroXlQ.text: the WORST service EVER experienced!!! as soon as you walk IN to the restaurant you're greeted by POLICE TAPE that separates the entry from the exit!!! and don't try to order anything to-go!! the worst host to facilitate a restaurant EVER!! i was cursed at and then asked to sit outside and CALL the restaurant to place an order instead of simply going to the register inside!!

q_nlu_fqfqUG3YN-M7AnTg.text: Clean Restaurant, fast polite service and the hospitality is through the roof. The food is "delish" I highly recommend this diner whether it be breakfast, lunch, dinner and even late night.

Lu8nEx0YWT5fMgGm49OukQ.text: Nice shrimp and grits w a fluffy biscuit was a great way to start my weekend ! The music here is old school and customer service is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

sAB4nH-o2OXKmC0WKSJvpw.text: Beware!!!  If you pay with cash you may get jipped.   This was my first time coming to this diner and the server (Angel) kept my change. My total came up to $27.23.  I gave the server $40 cash. When he returns with my change he only gave me $2 change. I was in a hurry to get back to work and didn't notice the difference. I left him an additional $4  on the table and left. When I got close to work it dawned on me that the server owed me $12 in change, not $2.  I called back to the restaurant and spoke to the manager (Kia) who explained that there's no way for them to track cash payments.  She stated that she would call the server to question him since his shift ended shortly after the lunch hour rush, and call me back. I didn't get a callback. I really hope that it's not commonplace for their servers to swindle patrons out of money.  The manager made no attempt to make this right for me. I was only left with the possibility that I may get a call back from the General Manager.  It's only $10, but it's my $10.  It doesn't matter if the food was good or if the atmosphere was nice, they stole from me. This restaurant will never get my business again.  I'm so disappointed.

2HMUF40b4CbQLY5d0cqAxA.text: Cute fun dining experience. Shrimp and grits were great!  Burgers were fine (not amazing not horrible). Milkshakes not so much.

Si-HKRjb-_vr_L3IcJegrg.text: Perfect stop after a night on the town.

7Q6-2RLxE04o1qpQWp047w.text: I love this place and never have a complaint when I visit. I've both dined in and ordered to go. The staff is friendly and very helpful. There's an extensive menu but I always go with the shrimp and grits which is my personal favorite. Good portion sizes and even better pricing. There's a parking lot in the back and plenty of seating. It gets crowded on the weekend and there can be a wait.

Qqlmi9qnrQ5k_rq4EeCqAw.text: If you are in town and want to have a southern breakfast, this is the place.  Hands down...THE BEST GRITS you will ever have.  Made with lots of cream and butter.  Aren't they all you say?  No way man, no way. Go to Waffle House and you will get water grits.  If you are ever going to try grits, do it here. Worth the wait in line.  The Shrimp and Grits entree is even better.  Enough said.

IJHO8wK6if5MD3w5NRJ24g.text: The food here was good! We were lucky to have gotten here before they got busy on a Saturday night around 630pm. The portions were HUGE and the service was good. All the food we ate was extremely hot and fresh, you could tell they just made it before bringing it to our table. I would definitely recommend if you're in the mood for comfort food  also, the music they played here was on point! Haha my family and I will be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizers!

CISVH7cRu3VJIqDgWO03Uw.text: After a few Midnight Diner experiences, I am fully convinced that there is absolutely nothing served at the diner that is anything short of utterly delicious!  My favorite menu item so far is the chicken and waffles. (But, instead of wings, I order chicken tenders. It requires ordering the chicken tender appetizer and then an extra waffle. #lifehack) In addition to the crazy good food, in my experience, the staff is always efficient, helpful, and all-around great!  If you go around brunch time on the weekends, though, be prepared for a wait!

z-pleRvoTU66E5sOGmHo4w.text: I really like this place. It's an ode to a traditional 50's diner, music and all.   The food. It's diner food. No frills, nothing fancy, but good food. And the portions are large. Their sausage gravy is probably the best in the area, I always order it on the side.   Coming from the north, I did expect a "diner" experience, meaning you order food and it's out in an unimaginably quick time. Not the case here, but that's not a qualm, just something I didn't know of when I went here the first time.   Parking- their lot is small, but there's a big pay lot behind the diner and there are spots (free) that are labeled for the Midnight Diner.   Also, expect a wait on weekend breakfasts and late night. Late night...it gets crazy inside. Overall, it's definitely worth a stop if you're in the South End area.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. One egg breakfast with a side of sausage gravy

Edgf1LWTXSVQ21luATd0LQ.text: This was a nice reminder of NYC. The prices are affordable. The service was great. The food was good. It was family and date friendly. I will definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

DR1Si0izb--v4pBp2WNXhA.text: This is a 24/7 place, and they are currently closed, with no explanation other than a paper "Closed" sign taped inside the door. It looks like they are doing typical cleaning stuff in there at the moment. But what do I know, maybe there was a murder and they need a few minutes to clean up the mess. Nevertheless, if I drive across town for an early breakfast, I need a better explanation of the situation. OPEN TWENTY-FOUR HOURS, SEVEN DAYS A WEEK. Or not.

H4Hv5t860_V3QriGFmRjzQ.text: This Diner is amazing! I've been living in Charlotte for 10 years and I've never had anything bad from this place. All of my guest that visit me from out of town I bring here to kind of show off LOL, but they absolutely love everything! The chicken wings are amazing, the Grits are to die for, the pancakes, waffles..... I can just keep going on and on! Eat here!!

g-AvQiKFv2s6UlyD3ZvxoA.text: I went to Midnight Diner at 2:30 am. I was in town for a conference downtown. I ordered the shrimp and grits. It was okay, I didn't really care for the sauce included. The customer service was actually great and we didn't have to wait. Midnight Diner has limited parking on the backside.  This is the classic late night/early morning spot after a night downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

EXH8oyoXFSfTy7AoP5yFEg.text: Overpriced, but generally good food. Friendly staff. I work nearby and swing by every once in a while to get breakfast for the staff. Saturday nights and Sunday mornings are ALWAYS packed.  I have never tried it, but several people say they have the best shrimp and grits in town... Interesting if True.

2g7VL6yd-WgrUzz4Cx9gig.text: What is wrong with this picture? One person eating and the other sitting waiting 15 minutes after I'm done eating two scoops of grits that were cold because my waitress went missing.  And another thing you think she came and asked or even waited on the table nope! Another nice young lady came and assisted once she seen us foaming at the mouth for drink.  I will never recommend or eat at the diner again!  Wait time horrible  Cold food and a horrible waitress!!!

oqUUi5NdQRddxTLRs7KGJA.text: Well, that was rude...  Restaurant is not packed (it's currently 8/4/19, 4:48PM) and I was told I couldn't sit on the left side of the restaurant....there's a table right by the hostess stand,/'d another one 6 rows back that's empty, and they told me I would be sitting all the way in the back corner of the restaurant.  So you tel me there's multiple empty tables, and you're pushing me to the "Second to the last table" in the place?   I can eat anywhere. I don't know who is in charge, but you lost business because of a waitress and a hostess who didn't care to give me a better seat.

3D8ZIOQ7H5pC6PdfdMAydA.text: For what this is, it is great.   Their menu goes on forever.  You'll be able to find almost anything that you want. I always like to get breakfast foods here.  During this visit, I ordered a veggie egg white omelet, grits, and wheat toast.   It was all very good. The service was also good.  Best of all, the atmosphere is a throw back to the 1950s.  It is just a feel good place.  The outside of the restaurant is so alluring.  If you are passing by, you will definitely want to pop in for a meal.  The other thing that I like is the view of the uptown skyline.    If you like photography, you can have a blast from their parking lot. Definitely go, if you haven't been.  It might be the best diner option in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

tMLU6V5ELW1Wi4KcRlp0dQ.text: I was given the side eye when everyone found out this was my first time here and I've lived in Charlotte for 4 years now. But this place definitely lived up to the hype! It's weird because the restaurant itself isn't huge but it seems like they are always able to accommodate whatever size crowd is thrown their way. The customer service was A1, Tru took great care of us and displayed incredible knowledge of the menu. She also made sure we didn't wait too long for refills and she consistently kept us informed on the status of the food. As far as our meals, I had the shrimp tacos which were delightful, and a side of macaroni and cheese which also didn't disappoint AT ALL!! Totals for 2 meals was just shy of $25 so priced very well for a place with a reputation as theirs. I will definitely be back to explore more of their menu and will certainly invite everyone to dine here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Good food, uptown Charlotte

BJrFNFxGEaA8BqxYU7OuWA.text: I stopped here one day before my facial appointment. I had an hour to kill and wanted to stay in the area. I was promptly given a table but I had to ask for a server as time passed. It was some confusion as to who was handling my table . One lady took my order then another came over and greeted me. She was nice and pleasant. I wish I would have gotten her name.  I received my food pretty fast . The shrimp and grits just didn't do anything for me. It wasn't nasty but it wasn't great either . It's something that I can say I had but no reason to order it again. Overall, I'm not a big fan of the diner and was reminded why I never eat there .

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

DMnDnRU4tPC625ZPlPL7IA.text: Typical diner fare, but great flavors and fantastic service! My husband tried the chicken and waffles and loved them and I ordered the grilled cheese with tomato and bacon and it was exactly what I was hoping for! They were also so great with my two year old, which I always appreciate. Will definitely be back!

5pg3kkierdK7gfs5nK194g.text: I think midnight diner is a staple for CHARLOTTE and the lines around the corner shows it!   Pros: variety of options, all day breakfast, great seasoning on this visit (even though I've been several times) my food came out super fast! I ordered the infamous shrimp and grits and it DID NOT DISAPPOINT ! Just writing the review my mouth is watering. My friend got Mac n cheese and I tried it reluctantly knowing I would want more. It was so good! The shrimp tacos looked delicious! Everything is almost always seasoned to perfection and the biscuit is so soft and fluffy!   Out waitress tru was really nice and gorgeous! She even came to check on me when she thought I didn't like my shrimp and grits and I was just savoring the moment . The water was oddly hot when we asked for no ice. That was weird. We were sat immediately which was impressive considering how packed they are!   I highly recommend people visit here at anytime of the day. I've also tried their waffles and chicken. The waffles are HUGE and fluffy- honestly this place is so good I actually order without hesitation and I always take a long time to order

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

yZbuU8eKZWfnzqRMxp9wEg.text: I work close by and found this spot about the first couple weeks in town.  I love me a good ole diner and this did not disappoint.  I always have a good meal well priced good service.  The plates are plentiful and served with extras to make you happy.  Fun environment and very enjoyable for a quick meal or a bit of a hang out after a night out on the town.  I come often and refer often.  I always get the huge salads and my favorite is a grilled cheese and burgers!! This is just a fun place to eat and I will recommend it to all that are new and living in our city.

P3Q9w3MwZsH0U_fDXHyYtQ.text: My friend & I decided to go here on a whim because it was super late & we didn't want the usual fast food spot or Waffle House. Despite it being rainy, it was packed. Honestly at first I was turned off because I didn't want to deal with the busyness, but decided to wait considering this place always got rave reviews.   After getting seated, our waitress was super nice & attentive. She was patient with my friend & I because we were so indecisive. We wanted literally everything on the menu. I settled with the Midnight French which is French toast, your choice of meat (I got turkey sausage), eggs (I got overeasy), and a side (I chose hash browns).  Okay so the sides were pretty basic: nothing to get hype about. BUT THAT FRENCH TOAST!!!!!! I regret getting a half order (2 slices). I got the coco French toast which is essentially French toast with corn flakes and coconut shavings/ flakes. It. Was. So. Good. And the bread isn't thin either- thick...similar to Texas toast style.    Oh something else worth noting: service was FAST. It was super packed/busy so I anticipated to wait at least 25-30 min. No- my food came out 10 min after ordering. I will definitely return for a full order of that coco French toast

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

YLpUNAvbGVmJbko4UiTkXw.text: Gosh, I hadn't been here in years, and I've really missed it! The food is so delicious, customer service was amazing, and the place was so packed, the line was out the door and down the street.  My party ordered so much food and our bill was still under $40! We ordered the Midnight Special, 2 sides of "all the way" hash browns, 3 sides of bacon, corned beef hash slam with over medium eggs, tea, water, sodas, biscuits, and let's not forget those creamy grits!  So delicious and all our food came out quickly, piping hot, and to my surprise, correct!   Salute to the cooks in the back and the large wait staff who were shucking and jiving to meet the needs of all the customers. I will be back when I'm in the City again!  I truly missed this place and am so glad that it is still thriving and putting out great diner food!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

vJAjM1iLiQqXTkfK0bzyMw.text: Great late night eats if you're in Charlotte. This place is crazy busy all of the time, the line to get in is often out the door and down the sidewalk. Make sure to plan accordingly.   The chicken & waffles and Mac & cheese is on point though. If you're with friends & have time to burn, this is the spot for after hours fried food excellence.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles

JLwafJH0IziXDOmiKPNmKw.text: Food is amazing, especially the biscuits. Ordered The Bubba and the combination of the biscuit with eggs and cheese and gravy was really good.

styPVQl5Z5sNrK7dIAegMg.text: Chicken and waffles. The end.   Okay but really, get the chicken and waffles! Juicy delicious chicken with a huge fluffy waffle with warm syrup. Makes me hungry just thinking of it! The menu is so extensive! Something for each and every taste bud and craving!   I love the hustle and bustle of people coming and going. The chatter and music playing it just has such a great vibe! Perfect spot to go for any occasion! Early business breakfast, dinner with the in laws, carbs to soak up to much drinking? They are there for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot tea with honey and lemon

Eu3sZsbpuhDBfsp6iLQYMw.text: I haven't been to midnight diner in forever. Went on a Saturday night which is always a bad idea because of the wait. The wait was just long enough to be annoying but not so long that I wanted to leave. There was plenty of parking when I arrived around 945/10pm. Our server was friendly and helpful. I prefer the midnight special with French toast. The eggs, turkey sausage and hash browns were standard but the French toast was soooooooooo good. I'd go back just for the French toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Midnight special- French toast, scrambled eggs, turkey sausage and hash browns

U62vVSeLIFeKpQ40WENaqA.text: I been eating here for years and always consistent. Shrimp and grits is my go to. Add one chicken wing to really make the meal pop. Service is always quick once seated but late night after the club the wait is crazy. A casual day the line will be fine. Its perfect for right after leaving uptown and priced fair. Im a huge fan of the classic diner setup. I will be back like always :)

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits...Gotta add cheese for the love

8WgoFAJiNyInS0QzEsRSRw.text: This is a fake diner, there is no Greek food. Southern comfort food type of establishment is more accurate. Fried fish was rather good.

EZIu34FFJDKoh7FgGBq6eg.text: There is always a line of people waiting to eat here. It's an old fashioned diner and the prices are pretty cheap, but the food is nothing special.   I came here for breakfast on a Sunday my first weekend in Charlotte. My friend ordered waffles and I ordered a biscuit and a side of fruit--oh, and a mimosa.   Our food was just ok, but I was impressed by how soft and flavorful the biscuit was and I wanted to know their secret (because I was learning how to make homemade buttermilk biscuits). We asked our server if the biscuits are made in-house and she said they are Pillsbury. Whomp whomp  Note: there is a big parking lot behind the diner where you can park free on weekends or after 6pm on weekdays

70w-vtL0N-by-XDzafK93Q.text: Popped in off the light rail and we couldn't have been more excited with the energy this place has to offer! High energy and sweet staff. Smiles are clearly free here and abundant!! This place is a gem! The food is fresh and hot! This is a NO MISS place!

YYmCg6V8NQK4zwoqq7GtkA.text: I love their creamy grits and good in general but my boyfriend had hash browns that were hard as a rock. First time we've ever had food not great from here. We did come around 2-3 am though on a Friday so it was pretty busy so I will cut them slack on that. I do think they should handle their crowds better with the lines that's why I am taking off a star, the crowd got kinda crazy at times. I would come back but probably more so during a week night or during the day. I went last night and it reminded me why I don't come here during the weekends anymore it's too crazy here. People should definitely be aware of that when dining here late night. Parking can also get crazy at night, with people just driving everywhere and running in front of cars. I guess because they are drunk? I don't know. I think there should definitely be more security here like at Red Eye but to each their own.

woDL2cMex3mzQqE6mAyI6g.text: Food, Service, Atmosphere tied for AWFUL! Blaring music Adele? BBD? Hip/Hop? in contrast to rock and roll theme tacky and annoying.  Asked to turn down, cranked up again before we left.  Server disinterested, beyond rude( walked away abruptly when a concern over food quality was expressed) zero listenening skills or attention span.   3burger/fries ordered, no way meat is ground fresh, over cooked , tough and similar to jerky in texture to dry to taste if seasoned.  Hand cut fries, limp, underseasoned, cold, why bother?  Staff seemed more consumed and concerened with their inner circle than actual customers.  I felt sorry for the line of people entering when we left.  Like us maybe they just didn't know better.  One of the few times I would never go back.  First impressions: horrible.

BECdZwAKkmsoeUf2LK_fjw.text: the coconut french toast is to die for!!! good service. friendly atmosphere.  would go back!

fyAx6lxM3dgUDpd42OfO3A.text: If you like the Waffle House, you'll love the Midnight Diner! I had some of the best fried chicken I've ever had. Simply amazing. I had chicken and waffles. I was a little disappointed in the waffles, they were a little dense. It made it seem like it wasn't cooked all the way. The fish dinner was incredible. It was light and battered just right.   Now, this is a great place to people watch on a Friday or  Saturday night. I saw some very entertaining things. The 21st century iTunes Jukebox is great. They jammed some serious old school and new school music. It was a fun dining experience.

To400EjA6P_WU-XSlGOFCg.text: I came here a few weekends ago looking to get a late night dinner. Never again will I go here on a Saturday night. The wait is ridiculous. About 20 minutes later, I sat down at the bar area. The waitress was ok at best. It seemed like the place could have had more waiters on hand. Anyways, the wait wasn't too long for the food. I got 2 biscuit sandwiches which were good. Come here if you're done partying in Uptown for the night and looking for a decent midnight meal.

8_M_BEk_jm3oVn3fd5RPLQ.text: MIDNIGHT SPECIAL!! The food here is amazing no matter the time of day. And dem GRITS is uh-maze-N. If you've enjoyed the breakfast buffet at Uptown Cabaret after a night out, then you'll love this place because it's the SAME FOOD!  Fun fact.

eTz1pHWzBDh_A8vVYGuKcw.text: I love this place! This was my second time here once being late night like 2:30am-ish and the second on a Sunday morning for brunch!  To be honest I have no memory of the first trip so this review is for the Sunday brunch which was great. It's a small dinner with booths and a "bar" I guess.. not sure what to call it. We arrived semi early for brunch so there wasn't much of a wait but by the time we left there was a line out of the door. The food was really good especially the eggs and they give good portions. The wait staff was attentive and friendly ! The best part was the music playing it was such a variety and who doesn't like to hear a little Usher "Climax" on a Sunday morning!!   We were charged .50 to add cheese to the eggs... the waitress didn't mention this but I'm sure it was on the menu somewhere ... overall nice spot to pick up a quick bite to eat.

vu9-ImIrEClGtVBmgP30Tw.text: You know you have to try a place when your waitress at another (very nice) restaurant recommends it and tells you their shrimp and grits are better than the place you're at. She was right. Shrimp and grits were $9.99 and cooked fresh when I placed the order. They were the best I've ever had - great texture, creamy and with a Creole sauce and jumbo shrimp. They were served with a huge, also excellent, biscuit.   Our waitress was friendly and efficient. She checked in to make sure I liked the food and offered to pack up the leftovers, send me off with more lemonade, etc. All of the staff seemed pretty sharp and customers were a good and fun mix of groups of friends plus families.   This is walking distance of the convention center; maybe a half mile from NASCAR.

Bnavj7Swx-vSrXyj8VMPVw.text: The French toast and shrimp and grits are a must! The food is always consistently great!

Y1twY7kAMrlzyc484qbNfw.text: I usually get the fried chicken here, which is delicious.  It comes with a biscuit that's sadly usually old or overcooked that I end up not eating, but I don't really care 'cuz it's free.  They have French toast which is made of that huge challah bread and tastes like you're eating bread that's been dipped in the eggs from god's ovaries, ohhh it's that yummy.  (God has ovaries right?  He's like, both, right, has everything?)  Their chicken noodle soup is sadly a disappointment.  I'm always on the search for delicious chicken noodle soup, and theirs was all... bleh.  The broth was icky and the noodles were thin and twirly.  Restaurant chicken noodle should be thick strips of noodles, you foolish fools, not twirly little pathetic bastards!!  But that's not why they get four stars instead of five.  The reason is their music.  Usually I come there late at night and, I dunno, I guess they're going for this trendy club-atmosphere or something, because they BLAST that shit and it's awful.  It's not that I hate the music (which I do because it's awful trendy crap, but I could change it by picking something out of the jukebox if I wanted), it's that it's SO.  Friggin'.  Loud.  I guess, I dunno, the rest of you people have so completely damaged your hearing that you don't notice, but to me it's physically painful.  It's like sound warfare and I feel like I'm being attacked.  Plus I can't actually talk to my companion(s) without shouting at them.  Since atmosphere is a big deal when going out to eat, there have been a few times where we've decided NOT to go there because we aren't in the mood to put up with such loud nose.  But you know, they change that and bam.  I'll give 'em five stars.  And since we all know how much everyone wants MY five stars, I bet they'll be doing it within minutes.  Huhuhuhuhuh.  Update:  They don't do cheese fries anymore.  For some reason.  Considering cheese fries is just melting cheese on fries, both of which they have, in like a microwave or under a heat lamp, this loses them a star.  It was my favorite side.  :C

Y7BwGRVtCRNUReFe32UN9A.text: After reading reviews I had high expectations going here.  This place is LOUD!  Aside from that the food is nothing special.  Just more frozen dishes prepared behind the scenes.  The quality was no better or worse than any average place out there. If you want to eat like the majority and mediocre food appeals to you, this is your place.   Don't expect the staff to be friendly as they are too busy to say much more than "You know what you want?".   Decent food is a lost art these days so do not think you are getting anything great here!

fSINu21aG0o_xXk40O1Vnw.text: AMAZING!!!  Best grits I have ever eaten! Thank you for welcoming us twice in less than 24 hours

0HETPOgteez_HpGviwgcNQ.text: Everything you want in a diner and more! The food, service and aptmosphere were better than expected. Gotta love the Bubba Breakfast!

pzQjgqRU9x8MuOXf_lpOSg.text: So if your use to going to Waffle Houses and like them... You will like this.  The diner is styled after the 60's or so everyone is overly friendly and the food is good. Though this is a greasy spoon. I am sure this is a really nice place to hit after your night uptown in the bars. My breakfast was just ok. SORRY.    Yea I would go back for  quick breakfast.  There is other available parking near the diner that is free just follow the signs or the folks there are kind enough to help you.  yea... This place is not dog friendly.

Gy6wqC84XxuvVGftzicnSQ.text: Let's just say I waited a few months to let Midnight Diner work out the supposed kinks I've been reading about, because I had a pretty tasty dining experience here! If I could give half stars, Midnight would earn a 3.5 overall.   The place: 24/7 diner that's quite snazzy looking. It's a really modern take on a vintage diner, if that makes any sense at all.   The scene: 8:30 am breakfast with a buddy on a chilly Thursday morning  The staff: Really, really friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Lisa, our server, was really laid back and offered some great menu suggestions - even noting that certain items were best for a hangover. That's important knowledge, folks.   The food: I went with a veggie egg white omelet, side of wheat toast and they let me sub fruit for grits. My buddy and I also shared a side of turkey sausage, too. My omelet was of average size (not behemoth) and stuffed with veggies and melty cheese...just what I was looking for. The toast was, er, toast! The fruit was fine but I'm not sure how fresh it really was...almost tasted like it had been refrigerated for some time. No worries though. The turkey sausage patties were flavorful and a nice accompaniment to my eggies.   The price: A touch more expensive than I expected, but then again each order comes with quite a bit of food. I believe my omelet was in the $7-$8 range but it comes with a side of grits or hashbrowns and toast. Carby carby! I will note that the turkey sausage was $2 for two small patties...a wee bit pricey but tasty nonetheless.   So, overall the food was good - a solid choice for a low key meal. I'm sure I'll be back to Midnight Diner as it's really, really close to my house and one of the few spots open all hours of the week. However, I do enjoy another local diner quite a bit more due to the freshness and overall vibe of that place.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

cZJAwN-t1YQ9sqVgOjm50Q.text: Okay, so maybe this place is located on the same lot as a cabaret and quicky motel, but don't let that fool you into thinking this place shouldn't be visited!   Perfect for a late night meal after a show at the Music Factory, Midnight Diner welcomed us with bright neon lights and a staff that was more enthusiastic than a well tipped stripper. I'm pretty sure there were more waitresses than patrons at this time of night and they were all giddy over what ever song was playing on the jukebox. Our very own Pourina R was seen dancing with waitresses at said jukebox and I got called out for singing along to some 80s pop ballad. This was the fun type of atmosphere the diner had at midnight.   I got the french toast and, OMG, the slices of bread were gigante. One and a half inch thick challah bread dipped in delicious french toast batter, dusted with powdered sugar and drizzled with syrup. It was so enjoyable (and filling) that I was able to revisit it again the next morning.   My dining mates all got fried chicken with mac n cheese and some other side. I recall all mac n cheese being gone by the end (or middle) of the meal, so it must've been good.   Parking lot is unpaved, bathrooms are clean, and jukebox is ready to go. I believe this is now my favorite diner in the QC.

2oN5RTxZem2EeTOln3L0Vg.text: Went here for an office lunch last week  on a cold rainy day and had a pretty good time. Our server was very nice and attentive. I tried an omelet with spinach, fruit and a biscuit. I was afraid of what kind of fruit I would get since I was ordering "fresh fruit" at a diner, but I was pleasantly surprised. It was very fresh chunks of pineapples, pears, and grapes! My omelet was very good. I also had a side of the mac and cheese but it was not what I was looking for. It was a little heavy for my taste. Others at the table had the fried chicken, mashed potatoes, pancakes, and one tried a burger. Everybody seemed very satisfied with their food. I would be interested to try this place again. The music took me back several years but it was fun to reminisce!

kW68GGkKmqcYGzhD_FuD5g.text: Alright...this place has taken an early beating, but I still needed to try it for myself. And while they are still working out obvious kinks, my experience was A-OK. I went here for lunch by myself and sat at the countertop area in front for the TV. Nice that Sportscenter was on for me. The menu is extensive and detailed. About 7-8 pages I think, but don't be intimidated by the thinkness. It's just the words that are big, probabloy for those visiting late night that can't see so clearly.   Ordered the "midnight special" which is your typical breakfast place 2 of each. 2 eggs, 2 pancakes, 2 bacon/sausage and hashbrowns. All this for $8.99 (see biz pic as I took one). Maybe an extra $1 too much or so, but for the size of the pancakes I can see how they justify it. Only issues was that my over-easy eggs were a little too runny in terms of the egg white. Probably go over-medium to be safe.   A lot of people running around and I did see some food come back ans I was sitting in front of the expediting area. That said; my meal was good and I'd probably go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Midnight Special

Crf9q-EE2e3133Kqr1_KaQ.text: Amazing food and service was perfect my 92 year old world war 2 vet grandfather couldn't come in the front and they let him in the back door. Food is cooked perfectly and is delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Food almost gone.

35P_743lKaUrGEm6nz8zaQ.text: After an impromptu mid-week visit to Ikea with my bosses, we stopped here because it was recommended by my boss's sister. It was late night and most things were starting to close. I'm glad we went here! This is definitely a True diner. The greasy smell is overwhelming, as it should be. Ladies, just to warn you, don't come here right after getting your hair done, because it took me two washes to get the smell out of my hair. Aside from that, the portions are huge!! My bosses had overflowing plates and could hardly finish it all. Me on the other hand? Well, I would recommend you don't bother with the chicken tender meals. I ordered the biggest size they had and was pretty disappointed. The reason for this is because the tenders are really, really, really tiny. I'm serious. They were about half the size of a typical one from Zaxby's. I had probably twice as many French fries as I did chicken tenders. They didn't taste bad or anything though. My waitress also forgot to bring me the dipping sauce that was supposed to go with them. They are a little bland. Try to order something else. The French toasts and biscuits are massive. The syrup is really good. With such an expansive menu, it's almost a disservice to order something as plain as their chicken tenders and fries.

0N0-J9NRjppCvwGEzcOo0g.text: Bad service, great food. Our waitress came to the table once only to ask us if we wanted our ticket. We were sitting outside in the rain, and she never tried to get us inside or to a table with an umbrella. That's it for the negatives, onto the positives, the food. I ordered the shrimp and grits and it was phenomenal. The grits were amazing and the shrimp were great. The Creole sauce put it over the top for me! As for my girlfriend, well, she got the French toast and quite frankly; it was amazing. The bread was HUGE and it tasted great. All in all a good experience. I almost gave 3 stars because of the service, but the food was just too good.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

zg5HIqO6RbPQwppdjVYXfA.text: The atmosphere is great, I love the location. As soon as you walk in, it feels like you've stepped into an old movie. The music is pretty loud, and the wait staff are singing along (which annoyed my friend a little). Its an extremely comfortable place to be.   The food is really good, I had the shrimp and grits (something i have to try if its on any menu), i also tried the collards which were really good but spicy.  It was in a creole sauce and it was so rich and creamy. The amount of heat in the creole sauce was medium, not as spicy as the collards.   If i stayed in Charlotte this would definitely be a place i would visit once a week.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

MYeiYeJHf6O4yBM1rvBOXg.text: Passing through Charlotte on my way from the airport, looking for breakfast, I found this diner. The service was good, the waitress was very friendly, and more importantly the food was on point, real comfort food. If you're looking for a friendly no-frills diner, this is your place.

s0FvjXvNzCtesd9CWa2FmA.text: This is my favorite diner in the Charlotte area. Their coffee is awesome, and the bubba is where it's at!!!! Order with a side of grits because they're amaze. Highly recommend. It does get extremely crowded on weekends, though, so keep that in mind especially if you're really hungry lol

UHcZ4RQoKKwfFMQyn780eQ.text: Very nice and authentic diner. I was really missing a diner since I moved from New York to North Carolina. I ordered the burger but it wasn't really that great.... in fact no burger is great at a diner. However my kids ordered chicken and waffles and I had a piece of them and it was great! I will be coming back here to try out the chicken as it seems to be what this diner does best! I will also return for a omelette to see how they compare to the NY diners!

2ovP00bdxsI0Qh6uYpE6TA.text: Food is OK but the music is obnoxiously loud.  I left there 2 hours ago and my ears are still ringing.  I put in my earbuds to tone down the music but it only cut it by 10%.  You have to yell to be heard over the music just to order your food.    I wouldn't eat there again if the food was free and they gave me a $50 bill when I departed. Totally disgusted.

gjiP34humln0KtSlBjGyjQ.text: The midnight diner is pretty much a 1am staple and always full on weekend nights. The patrons here are varied (the drunk, buzzed, almost-passed out, and people who just look like they got hungry in the middle of the night). I recommend getting filled up here if you've finished your night of partying and drinking. You'll feel much better the next morning. For the more sober customers though, the food is just okay. Servings are relatively large but I didn't care for the chicken and waffles. The chicken was decent--the classic Southern stuff. But, the waffles were sort of mushy like a defrosted eggo waffle.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

-qlEu5kDbzbZsxROb6aJuA.text: If it looks like a diner, smells like a diner, has slippery floors and drunk people like diner...its just a diner. I will say, the chicken and waffles were delicious as was the shrimp half of the shrimp and grits. A word of advice...leave your party about an hour early to avoid the line that will run outside and down the block after the clubs close.

4VCSCsesVZ-TxM7AinpTxQ.text: I love this place. The shrimp & grits are to die for.  So creamy and delicious. The fried chicken is good also. It's the perfect place after a night out on the town or breakfast.  You can eat, drink and chill in a very casual downhome place. Good food, Good Fun, Good service.

Ktmi170xU5XMQ_bY1Xaz7g.text: Great diner food!  Great atmosphere!  Friendly staff!  I've been there a couple of times and have gotten the BLT, fried chicken, and breakfast sandwiches. It's typical diner food, so be prepared to get your food a little greasy but with popping flavors. It is the best diner food that I've had in Charlotte!

DfKF0cnHAtESLNHAeoy1uA.text: Probably my favorite late night spot. The crowd is eclectic, electric, and eawsome (forced that last one). I think their fried chicken is the best in town. Better than Price's. Freal. I know controversial, what will Lenny Kravitz think?  Sadly the waffles kind of suck but hey no one is perfect.  Cool story bro, get ready: I was wolfing down a club sandwich (that was pretty good) and Jared Leto say me and my fervor and said "I'll have what he's having". It feels pretty good to be Jared Leto's food muse.

_lGkRytxvGLHkVJyIkm-eg.text: Definitely do not go here sober or during the day hours. The food simply isn't that good at all. The coveted fried chicken is alright but there are many other options in the area. It is a good late night option after a lot of drinking. The crowd can get extremely rough. The food is average but you will have some good people watching opportunities. Don't expect much from food and service and you'll be alright.

CXCBCwbZ0fpdM53wWVR22Q.text: My favorite thing here is their grits they are very creamy and always served w/o lumps so you know they are freshly made. I loved the grits so much that I ordered a second order. However, I was highly disappointed in the quality of the bacon they served here which was very hard and slightly burnt. Service was ok... but waitress was really annoying sharing way too much personal information. Won't visit this place often but when I do visit grits are going to be my go to item.

8bPMBWUd3iUKslLcpJT7ZA.text: I couldn't even tell you what was best. The absolutely incredible menu, the tasty and very fresh food, or the amazing staff you want to bring home and make your best friends or neighbors. We went twice in 24 hours. No trip to Charlotte should miss a trip to Midnight Diner, and since they are open 24/7, you can fit them in for any meal.

IxhlRUutX3_-NSi87pFVcA.text: Absolutely the best fried chicken I have ever had!  So hot, crispy and fresh!  The fries were delicious.  I walked through the restaurant and was eyeing everyone elses food.  It all looked fantastic.  I can't wait to go back and try it all.  But I won't try it all, I'm always going to get the chicken.  It was that good!

NLEN_ZwK1GRrL-GFM6M99Q.text: Best Diner in Charlotte !!! Breakfast was outstanding. Generous portions prepared exactly as requested. Friendly service and fair prices. And I hate grits, but the waitress brought some over for me to try. All I can say is "Delicious!".

m6f8ssv9YFzJo3OGx7tapQ.text: Ok... This is Charlotte's biggest secret!!  Shhhhhh.... don't tell anyone..but their Shrimp & Grits, Chicken & Waffles, Fried chicken Mac & cheese collard greens dinner is the "BOMB"....     I truly can't believe,  that I've been in Charlotte for 4 1/2 years...and no one gave me the 411 on this place..    Well, I guess that's why it's Charlotte's secret..lol!!     Seriously... it's one of the cleanest, nicest place in Charlotte to enjoy a delicious meal, without breaking the bank.                                                                                         Great diner atmosphere, coupled with old skool music... What more can you ask for....  Check it out!!!!

zdDZeWY2sLsaUwyYoE9dTw.text: Get the coconut French toast with chicken wings...out of this world good. I still crave it

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coconut French toast with wings!

sy72Hg1hWx7pdi6AAxz7bg.text: The food is good. I ordered the shrimp and grits were excellent as usually. A littlehot at first but I got used it. They are usually very bust. The wait staff is friedly. My only complaint it the music is too laud which m@kes the staff talk louder the the customers talk. I can put up with that for good food.

dMkWzlOoLLQOzgSpMWeXrg.text: I've been here several times when visiting Charlotte. There is always a line however, it goes pretty quickly. The food is still always good and they have a full bar. Their fried chicken is awesome as well. I would highly recommend if your in Charlotte.

lPrEWiXHN0SvXl3sk34Dvg.text: OMG,The Shrimp And Grits are out of this world.I found this place on Yelp and so many people raved about the shrimp and grits with a biscuit,I just had to try it for my self.The Grits were creamy the shrimp were cooked perfectly.I Was in Charlotte for the CIAA tournament and I had to try this place before going back to the ATL.

MvB5kYmVOs3nlm6WbW9W3g.text: Overall, the food and service were a-ok, but nothing about this visit blew me away.  As other reviewers have mentioned, parking is sparse, especially when you are there at lunchtime on a weekday.    Since I was by myself, I just sat at the counter.  The place was pretty busy and it took awhile before anyone came to take my drink order so I already knew what I wanted to order when my server finally did stop by.   I figured since I was at a diner, I couldn't go wrong with ordering breakfast.  I went with black coffee and the San Bernardino Omelet. The coffee was pretty good and did not taste burnt.  The omelet was made with diced chicken, cheddar cheese, avocado, and pico de gallo.  I went with hash browns as my side and whole wheat toast.    Overall, the omelet was not bad, but I did not care for the pico de gallo - it had too much harsh onion flavor for my taste. I pushed it to the side but unfortunately, it left an aftertaste of onion on part of my omelet.   The hash browns were "meh"... a little bland and just a touch on the greasy side. (I probably should have gone for the grits.... I saw in another review that they were creamy and tasty.)  The toast was not really toasted at all, which was not good.   (As a side note, while I was waiting for my order, I had a peek at their biscuits, and based on how yummy they looked, I should have gone with the biscuit instead!)  Another thing I spied while I waited for my dish was a plate of chicken & waffles...which looked pretty good.  If I go back, I may have to give that a try.    The employees were very busy, but nice, and I think if I had gone at a less busy time, I would have gotten more attentive service.  However, the manager did come by to see how I liked my omelet, so I appreciated that.   At $12.95 for a coffee & an omelet plus $3 for tip, the price was a little higher than I had expected when I walked in the door.   But, the menu is quite extensive, so if I happen to be in the neighborhood again, I would stop in to give them another try.

mUCeOmvPEEACGh3ZY_tdGw.text: Awesome place eat...awesome staff...reasonable prices. My family enjoyed it especially the creamy grits

NOFXCjoz6i0KOz94Bojs-w.text: Waitress was a total sweetheart. Ended up getting my food to go, will eat it at work later today... Review to be continued.

tRpOZopXaXfVd5fW-OUFeQ.text: All was well and good until we saw a giant roach crawl across the floor as we ordered, to which the waitress grabbed a napkin and caught him with then put it in the trash can. She apologized and said they had just sprayed and he must have been a stray. Um, okay?!?  We decide to stay despite this because my wife really wanted shrimp and grits and had read that theirs were good.   Food comes... My burger had literally the nastiest looking shredded lettuce which smelled like it was turning and was a lovely pale yellow/green color and the tomato had the hard stem included in the center.  Completely inappropriate for a sandwich of my kind. I try to make the best of it and just dissect the burger and rebuild it. I squeeze some ketchup out for my hash browns and the taste was so foul I just couldn't bare to eat them. The ketchup was in one of those red picnic bottles and obviously had been refilled over and over again, and never cleaned out, because the ketchup tasted old and thick-- just plain bad.  We will NOT be back!   I suggest Eddies Place or The Diamond instead if you are in the mood for delicioua diner food along with a clean establishment and quality service.

_BQt0gSsWZ5Ctew83oYLFA.text: the coconut French toast creamy grits chicken wigs and waffles the mac and cheese I could keep going.............and so should you!

2ttrGWFwytXJvvqUioNpDw.text: Chicken and waffles.  Repeat after me: CHICKEN AND WAFFLES.  You must have this.  The fried chicken wings that come with it are the biggest dang wings I've ever seen.  Among the best fried chicken I've had in the South, too.  The large, Belgian waffle was a bit soft rather than crispy, but tasted good (and some people like waffles soft).  Maple syrup comes on the side so you can add as much or as little as you like.  Grits are very buttery so you won't need to add butter to them.  Cooked just right and creamy and yummy.  Satisfied my grits craving nicely.  My companions enjoyed their 3-egg breakfasts with bacon, and my Canadian friend tried grits for the first time.  He likes them.  :)  Very busy on a Sunday for brunch/lunch so expect to wait about a half hour to get seated.  Small amount of waiting in the foyer so if it's hot or rainy that day you should bring an umbrella for some shade while standing outside.  Alcohol available is limited to beer and a handful of distilled spirits.  Price of the meal depends a lot on what you order, as this place has a huge menu that is served 24/7.  But the three of us had breakfast for around $40 total.

AxAQlkKtROcLVXisXENH1A.text: Although the line was super long to get in, the chicken and waffles was amazing. The waffle tasted home made quality and the wings had the perfect flavor and seasoning.

3YA88ThJAt233YerfXqAMQ.text: I'm surprised I haven't reviewed Midnight diner yet because I come here a lot. I think I'm actually the duke, if that gives you an indication of how much I enjoy / frequent this place. So, let's get this out of the way. The food is 5-stars ... and by food I mean Chicken and Waffles ... and by Waffles I mean French Toast. I could literally eat their Chicken and French Toast for any meal of the day and I already have. I'm guessing their other menu items are delicious as well, but why mess up a good thing. I'm dinging them a star because it gets a little cray at night. You literally have to get pat down by an armed police office in order to pick up your take-out at 2am. I mean, I'll do it because once again the Chicken and French Toast is bomb, but yeah I don't like mine with a side of potential stabbing / drive-by. I will say that there's some pretty good people watching in the after-club hours. All shapes, colors, ethnicity, creed, organisms, and nations of ratchet. From the trap stars to the drunken southern bell that missing a shoe. Priceless entertainment ...  All and all, Midnight is the quintessential diner and I urge anybody to give it a try if they're in Charlotte. If this review has proved useful to you, please show your thanks by providing me with an order of Chicken and French Toast. :-) ... just kidding.  but for real though ... :-|

6VavYte9Y4ud126LF_7LTg.text: Great place for breakfast!! Always packed and busy so get there early! I recommend the chicken and waffles, hash browns, orange juice, and fruit. The diner is very reasonably priced for an uptown Charlotte restaurant.

--9PmsMTQB2CsMVKx1JHUg.text: Oh boy! When the hostess is rude as soon as I walk in the door I just turn right around. Only went because Arts BBQ was closed. NEVER AGAIN!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. This WAS the fried fish and shrimp dinner... I&#39;ll be back ;-)

u9YAy1t5NHFSesWLCC39fA.text: First time there today with family. All positive from friendly greeting at door, good service and very quick! The food and portions did not disappoint. ..will be back!

JvUvJb9fRuo00qoXexRzAw.text: OK, I understand this will likely start a chicken Fatwa in the Queen City; but, I STRONGLY believe the MidNight Diner Fried Chicken FAR SURPASSES Price's.  Don't get me wrong, until recently I too was a Price's True believer. . .Midnight is better  It's clearly brined, given a gentle salt H2O soak (and possibly buttermilk) and hand tossed.  The oil is peanut.  It's fresh and not over-used.  The crust is lightly peppery, the mashed potatoes are homemade with JUST the right amount of pleasing potato chunks and you have a choice of classic southern white gravy or brown love.    Again, dig Price's for a quick in-and-out greasy adventure.  Nirvana is achieved at Midnight.  Couple lunch with a hand made strawberry shake.  AHHHH.    My apologies to many in the Charlotte Metro Region.  Don't believe me, go there now.  Oh, that's another plus, to wit:  MidNight is open 24/7, 355 days a year.  (Closed Christmas.)  No, I'm not an owner, a friend of an owner or stockholder.  Just DIG their chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZaADER4n-GLJw-n5rJPFhA.text: This is my favorite breakfast diner in Charlotte. While there are lunch/ dinner options I know my go entree is the shrimp and grits. I have never been steered wrong there! If you plan to go after a night out, the wait will be horrendous but the food is definitely worth the wait. The booths are very spacious and good for groups. The staff is overall friendly  (unless dealing with impatient, intoxicated people during the late night hours which is understandable). If you are not from Charlotte then this is a place you can't overlook on your visit.

KqwwEHT1RI8HQ5E8rSp-mw.text: A Charlotte institution! 24 hour real diner food. Highlights are their spicy shrimp & grits, chicken & waffles, pancakes, etc. I wouldn't recommend showing up either too late in the morning or too late at night, or you'll be waiting in a pretty long line. It's worth the wait if you want some classic grub.

6GWSYmBCI-5WN845crAaDg.text: I was highly recommended to go to this place by a few co-workers and since I am new to the area, I decided to give this a try because I love breakfast. However, once my food came out....Let's just say, I don't get the hype. Maybe it was an "off day" but my pancakes were teerrrible... I mean, how can I put this. You really can't screw up eggs, hash browns and bacon - this is almost IMPOSSIBLE to screw up. The pancakes? This is the only reason why I came.
