The pancakes were: FLAT, TASTELESS, PLAIN and Tasted like boxed pancake mix, mixed with water. These were some really bad pancakes. There was zero flavor and looked undercooked. FLAT. Oh, I said that already. The only reason why I'm giving it a 3 stars? Well, my husband liked his French toast. I'm going to give it another try because my coworkers SWEAR this place is great but I will steer clear from the Midnight Diner Special. No pancakes for me.   The service? This was another blah - I don't ask for much. But he was not attentive at all.

9_TvNg4FrTuZnSHVYBqVJA.text: Fun atmosphere, basic breakfasts and meals, some taken up a notch.  OH, and a beer menu! Hubs was thrilled with The Bubba and it looked amazing. Eggs on biscuits with sausage gravy.   I was happy to get the Midnight special with turkey bacon.  Basic egg breakfast made your way, but the pancakes were heavy/dry, although good flavor.  Obviously a favorite in walking distance of the Uptown!  Good thing we got there early, or we would have stood in line.

ZklPplR-HP-kkfLtfv365g.text: It's about what you'd expect from a 24 Hour Diner that isn't notable for anything. The Diner is located in Uptown (Downtown), where the only other business open is their neighboring bottom of the barrel Strip Club. It's got a Menu full of your average greasy diner food served by fine middle aged ladies with a slew of bad tattoos to go with their bad attitudes, who are probably going to be chewing gum to cover up their cigarette breath. These lovely ladies look like they ended their tenure at the Strip Club years ago after too many cigarettes and whiskey and way too much diner food, so they just moved on over and started waiting tables for dollar tips all the same. Go here if you enjoy that sort of ambience, sometimes I do.

4MiBegb1uLdRJM954KPBZw.text: I've eaten here at all hours of the day and have never had a bad meal. I do always order breakfast foods though, so I can't say much about their other items. But they do breakfast well!! Their Belgian waffles are great and you can get fruit topping added which is the perfect pair. The fruit topping is an extra charge, and seems a bit high to me for what you get, but it makes the waffles even better so I get it. I usually order eggs over medium which I've come to find is hard get right while eating out. I ended up with over easy, but that seems to happen at every restaurant I order eggs at.  Today I got the bacon, egg and cheese biscuit which was bomb. They really do biscuits right here and give you good deal of cheesy goodness to go with. No gross clear, fatty bacon here, it's the good stuff. And my co-diners all enjoyed their "Bubba" (which I've had and is awesome everytime) and the coconut french toast which I tried and really is good. Doesn't taste overwhelmingly coconutty so you still get a nice crunchy sweet french toast on HUGE, THICK challah bread... so good!  I'd recommend Midnight Diner to any breakfast goer or late night eater. Every time I've been there it's been a good meal and the service is always on point with a friendly smile and quick service.

8VmDuAn7rHwfDxRS-W8REA.text: I can't speak to any of their food items except breakfast items, because that's all I've ever had here.  But I can say, without a doubt, that they definitely do breakfast very well.  Twice now I have been to this adorable little diner; once on a weekday, once on a weekend.  The decor in here is a throwback to old diners, with checkered patterns, red and white chairs, and awesome neon lights.  They also have framed records on the wall, and much of the time play music from the 60s.    The staff is pretty friendly and helpful as well.  On my first visit here, one of the waitresses was singing and dancing along with the music.  It was awesome!  Both times, our food came pretty quickly and was nice and toasty warm.  Now, onto the food, which was tasty!  They seriously have the best grits I have ever eaten.  I had The Bubba the last time, which was biscuits and gravy, grits, sausage links, and cheddar scrambled eggs.  It was fabulous; the gravy was mildly peppery and delish, a perfect topping for the biscuits.  My partner had the chicken and waffles - the chicken was so tender and juicy, I have never had a chicken wing like that.    Maybe someday I'll venture to try their dinner items, but this is definitely my new go-to place for breakfast. The construction going on there right now makes it difficult to get in and out, with parking being a bit of a pain.  Still, it's worth it to fight through the workers to go, especially considering that the construction (hopefully) won't last forever.

J8HTtQ2Sev0NESNujOGatA.text: Foods good. Typical diner style food, at diner style expectations. The line gets really long if you're visiting at night during the weekend. I recommend trying the bubba. Really filling, really tasty, and only ten bucks. Enjoy!

1MWVgRk9vmpbappXt-9evg.text: I was so excited to find a diner that was open late hours and serving real diner food.  Unfortunately, there were too many things about this place that I didn't enjoy that I most likely won't go back unless I'm with a group and I lose the vote.    Upon entering during a busy weekday morning, we were seated pretty quickly, but the hostess and people behind the counter did not appear friendly.  Our server was nice, and the orders came out after a wait, but the food was not great, and expensive for diner food.  I am used to breakfast bills coming in under $20, but not here.  Music was playing loudly at 8 AM and it was hard to have a conversation with someone.  I really wanted to like this place, but wasn't impressed.

TuM9YwsaNcPyxJf5TZOwXQ.text: Absolutely wonderful experience! Super clean, awesome music variety, amazing food! The hostess was attentive and the waiter was super accommodating and was very personable! The experience was great as there was a good atmosphere and friendly staff. I've never been in the Charlotte area and happened to stumble upon this gem of a secret in downtown Charlotte! I will definitely be back and bragging about my experience and highly suggesting it to my family and friends as well as my fellow yelpsters!

LCx6Ftfv3nKZUSc-D0Dppw.text: This is better known as the "Turn Up Diner". This is a great spot to visit after a night of drinks. While, I had the newest server that was slower than molasses, you can overlook that due to the quality of the food. I had the fire cracker shrimp meal. It comes with fries and coleslaw. The music was def unique from most restaurants. They featured many R&B and hip hop songs. I would recommend them fixing the ambiance and cleaning the bathrooms each hour on the hour. Overall, I had a good experience.

hbUnnqSS--tomqgwAH9x6g.text: Some of the best shrimp and grits I've ever had. The grits were southern style so they were creamy.  The shrimp were seasoned to perfection. I will always come here when I'm in the Charlotte area. The service was great and the place wasn't huge so I'm sure it gets crowded. Well worth the wait if need be.

CRaPtY8fR5G7sgoEecw25Q.text: Holy smokes this place rules. My husband ordered the coconut crusted french toast and it was literally the best french toast I've ever had in my life. Biscuits and gravy were great, corned beef hash was excellent and I typically don't like it much. Our server Angela was really nice and prompt, will definitely be coming back here and bringing out of town guests also

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coconut crusted french toast

a0JKqctSt4BL2m2U2M8G4g.text: Yuck!! A HAIR in my shrimp and grits!!! I called and spoke to the GM Eddie South. After I told him about the hair he curtly asked me what do I want him to do about it. I told him he could apologize. So he begrudgingly did.

kpLDrn9LlS3nGfXzP5fj0Q.text: Very clean restaurant,staff is really nice,and the shrimp grits dish is so good..also that place is open 24/7 which is great!!!!

X1QV4hFPajA2x10rYrngmQ.text: Fried chicken n biscuits with a side of sausage gravy and shrimp grits ... to die for! Best I've ever had!  Great service!  Must stop if your driving through Charlotte ... Just off Route 77!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great vibe!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken n biscuits with sausage gravy and shrimp grits ... to die for!

Qok47iwi34_yJ3klkPUf5Q.text: Great value. Great menu selection. Very clean. Home made biscuits were yummy. Can't go wrong with the fried chicken. Tammy was great and very personable. Was in Charlotte for the week and had 3 meals at the diner and every day was different.

E9rsc3JM769gkQUVjmFnTg.text: 1 Star because 0 wasn't an option. TRIED to eat here Sunday morning (6/14/2015) at least 10 people on the clock and no one would seat us, no one even spoke to us and they weren't busy. 3 booths were occupied. The girl behind the counter seemed more interested in filling A1 bottles and gossiping with co-workers. We stood at the front where the please wait to be seated sign was for several minutes before we decided to leave.

GlsW2eHwgpEW3QAvWR07XQ.text: I've had bad experiences and good experiences here but what else could be expected of a place that has such high volume. This restaurant is very popular for a good reason. It has an awesome location and is open 24 hours plus has an extensive menu and booze! I'll definitely return and play "waitress roulette" because some of the servers are less than...

j6kqFvnScrXELJXr7ZaXTQ.text: I hate grits.  But I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE grits from the Midnight Diner.  If I could bath in them, I would.  :-)

dEV1Ea7kbqNZrd0cC-mRXQ.text: Great food. Fast service. Fun atmosphere. Open all day and all night. Yes, go here for the food and for the jump back in time.

emJzD73O5mHJAomt0cA26g.text: Just take a half-step inside the shiny, chrome doors and see how Midnight Diner came to rest on Carson/Tryon. Uhhh....not so much hammer-and-nail here, but how about a nice trip down the highway on the back of a semi-truck? Sure. Rad. Pretty rad indeed.   Churning out pancakes, waffles, hashbrowns, omelets, and burnt coffee like they're going out of style, Midnight Diner is a haven for late-night carbloaders from all corners of Crown Town. If you're showing up for a 5-star meal, you might want check yourself at the door. It's a diner through and through. Low ceiling, cushy booths, counter seating, jukebox, old waiters, waitresses, line cooks. Like a Norman Rockwell. Just great.   You'll most likely walk out smelling like a mixture of vegetable oil and bad coffee, but sometimes pancakes are the only thing that will satiate an all-night rage before you hit the sack.   I'm especially fond of the hashbrowns that come "smothered, scattered, and chunked." Cheese, onions, and ham. Also, biscuits and gravy in this joint are spot on.   Glad that Midnight Diner is around and keeping Charlotte's nightlife well-fed with good ol' "brinner."

p7t0IpeRbqvxsbg-LnEkzQ.text: I usually don't write negative reviews and tend to focus on praising businesses but our experience was so terrible, this place deserves this rating. I went for the first time with my husband for breakfast and service was terrible! The scum of the world works there. Not even to mention the 90% sanitation score they have that I noticed only after eating. The food was disgusting, people who rave about the "amazing" food here, have clearly never had "good" food before. The chicken wings I ordered were cold, and the french toast was flat out gross. My husband ordered a corn-beef hash that looked like dog vomit, it was not fully cooked, the eggs also came out raw. He requested to get this fixed or something in place, and the gold teeth manager in the kitchen refused to. We were extremely disappointed by the terrible customer service and food and will never be returning. What a dump of a place!

QQupjy5DWT_lNIyGYrDEUg.text: Awesome food, typical diner menu. Incredibly busy at any time of the day. Great location, terrible staff.

UI3hrhrtBrMDOvRoiTKebw.text: Food is more than adequate. I had chicken and waffles. It's a nice change of pace for a late night spot instead of ihop or waffle house. The selection is huge. Breakfast and brunch items as well as soul food offerings. The music is too loud and our waitress didn't have the best attitude. Overall, a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

braNlP9SJbVEnWghPzCO0w.text: My wife told me everyone loves and talks about this place, so we decided to have a late dinner here. I had the fried fish, shrimp, and fries. It wasn't too bad, nothing to rave about. It could've used more seasoning, that's subjective. All in all, it's a good spot for a quick late night bite with the homies or a mistress.

IgrGD5lzx1hfK-vr6l7nKA.text: What you would expect in a Diner..... A good simple and hearty breakfast.  They have all the standard breakfast fare, be it omelets (egg white variety too), pancakes, french toast or belgian waffles.  They have amazingly tasty and buttery biscuits so forego the toast for the biscuit, and order a side of sausage gravy to split with your table.  Also the grits are amazing, and I'm not a huge grits fan, but these suckers have butter or cream in them that make them delectable.  I suggest having one person get grits and others in your party get the hash browns and you go halfsy and share.  The Friendly staff seem like they have been there for years, and they are efficient at least while sitting at the counter where I was.  Believe me you will leave this place exceptionally full that will last you all day.  I'm still full while writing this review, and I was there about 6 hours ago :)

jdk2ubjIGDV6TZgCkDIuWA.text: Never filed a Yelp review before.I have been to midnight diner countless times. I called in an order late one Saturday night, knowing that they would probably be very busy. I showed up and, as according to their policy, waited outside for my order to be ready, accompanied by two police who were guarding the door. After a good bit of time passed, I tried to speak to the host desk about the progress of my order, only to be very aggressively denied access by one of the police. Time comes and several thwarted attempts at speaking with an employee of the business come and go(gotta love cops) and I have been standing outside for forty five minutes waiting for a to go order that I was quoted ten on. Finally a more reasonable police officer offers to find a manager for me, amanager comes outside and inquires about people waiting for Togo food. My food had been ready for twenty minutes and I had been unable to access it and even unable to access an employee to ask about it because of one of the hired police officers guarding the door like a bridge troll.The food and the service are always good here and the management was very gracious in this particular instance. I just hope going forward that they scrutinize a bit more about what type of security they hire.  PS my food, upon receiving it after this whole ordeal, was still delicious.

m8JzeAoFtfcUWg6_6zqEYw.text: Wow!!! Visiting from Raleigh with the wife.   We wanted something good but,  we got better than good; it was great! Can ya'll come to Raleigh please??!!!

K0Dzyd4uS8J4rAsFzXhcuw.text: I came here on a whim based on a friend's suggestion, and I'm very glad I agreed to go! We arrived at the diner late at night, and was pleasantly surprised with the atmosphere of the restaurant. It was a good mixture of past and present, and the place was packed! Definitely a good sign for someone who wants good food.  I ordered the chicken and waffles and didn't have to wait long at all. Though maybe time passes quickly because my friends and I were talking so much...  Well, whatever the case, the food was so good! I'm not exactly a chicken and waffles connoisseur, but those may have been among  the best chicken and waffles I've had.   Oh they also deserve some brownie points for the way they train their employees. My friends and I happened to visit on a training night, and it was so nice to see the new hires being guided thoroughly and patiently by the experienced employees. A completely different experience from that one time I worked in the fast food industry... *shudders*

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The chicken and waffles I ordered

2yPmARvmEddhkjmu-4cYYA.text: This is my second trip to midnight diner. This time, I had the shrimp and grits I'd heard so much about and I wasn't disappointed. It came piping hot, so much so that even after several bites, I still had to try to cool it down before eating. Huge serving, and plenty of sauce, which in my opinion sets excellent shrimp and grits from just okay shrimp and grits.

6716CDhw2myW9ae5fAjaGQ.text: 3.5 stars   We've come here before, I had the dynamite shrimp grilled.. Was ok, not spicy at all though. We decided to stop by again today for brunch. It was packed but luckily the bar was wide open.. Who needs tables right? Our server was not as attentive as I had hoped though she was nice. Only filled out waters once. It also seemed very busy but still.   I got the midnight special with a side of rye toast while the bf got the bubba special. Food didn't take too long considering the crowd. Wow, I got a lot of food, couldn't finish it. The grits were so good! It feels like so much butter you think there was cheese in there. Not for the dieter. The chocolate chip pancakes were good, I like that they give the syrup warmed. I took stars off because I asked for poached eggs and a majority of my eggs were overcooked, almost to a full boil. Bleh.. The rye was also overly toasted and very hard. The bf's bubba special looked amazing, I couldn't take a pic, he ate it too fast lol open faced biscuit, cheddar scrambled eggs, sausage gravy, hash browns and turkey sausage. Very yummy and great bang for your buck! I'm getting this breakfast the next time I'm feeling eggs!   We also took a slice of chocolate cake home. It's very rich.. Took 3 days for us to take it down. Tip: use vanilla ice cream.. It balances the richness. Midnight is open 24/7, nice! Great drunk munchies! Breakfast, lunch and dinner, everything sounds good. Will be back, hopefully my eggs are the way I like it. Maybe for the shrimp and grits next time, imagined they are very good here.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Infamous chocolate cake
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Overcooked poached eggs
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Midnight special

2XLvlVbdqz2w4nd30oRknA.text: Ok, there are lots of reviews and photos for Midnight Diner, so I'll keep mine straightforward.  We ventured here on a weekend morning for breakfast.  Don't be put off by the parking signs - on weekends, parking is free.   Even on a Saturday, we were seated very fast.  Service is very matter-of-fact and efficient, but not Charlotte-friendly.  We liked their coffee, since it's stronger than most diner coffee.  And our food came out very fast.  But here's where it gets really good...the food!  I had The Bubba, an open-faced sausage gravy biscuit with scrambled eggs (including cheddar, yes!), and their creamy grits.  I thought Flying Biscuit's grits were the best until I tried Midnight Diner's.  I don't know, it's a toss-up now between the two.  And the eggs and biscuit/gravy were just perfect.    My husband had their corned beef hash slam.  He gets this dish a lot, and thought Midnight Diner's was the best yet.    We have returned a few times, and my husband always gets their corned beef (still the best he's had), but I've tried other items, such as the standard eggs with bacon, biscuit, yadda yadda.  Their hash browns and grits are both phenomenal.  Once you've tried both, try just picking one of them!  I always get both.  :)

T84dGRPtwpFURo_leJMjJQ.text: Cleanliness is in question here. The booths, tables, and floors were all dirty. The crowd was also acting inappropriately and disruptive.

ByfMkrPRtBo3s1BOWvd97g.text: It was my first time at midnight diner. Staff is really nice and attentious from the hostess to the server. Our server gave us suggestions before we ordered and was always present giving us refills and asking if everything was all right. She even cared about the fact that I'm pregnant and made sure that my food was well done and the broccoli cooked with no salt. Great service. The food didn't take too long to be prepared and everything tasted really good.  I got the hamburger steak with broccoli and mac n cheese and my husband got grilled cheese and breaded chicken tenders. It was all really delicious. For drinks we just got ginger ale that was always refilled, and that's how it should be. Overall we had a great experience and will for sure be visiting again.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

l75eN-P35V-7mZc8YaHjpA.text: What a great place.   It is one of my go to places especially when guests are visiting from out of town.   The grits are out of this world and a menu to please everyone.   Yes, weekends can involve a wait but always worth the wait.  Staff is attentive without being annoying.

g6f40TI1rwhQTgk0b3TDRQ.text: I love this place - but I never go there late at night. The lines are ridiculous on the weekends! I usually venture over on Saturdays or Sundays. The San Bernadino omelet is my favorite and the biscuits are delicious. Everytime I've been I have been seated within 20 minutes as well. I live in DC now, but midnight diner will always be one of my favorite go to brunch spots.

GlmWzrdMmuzIliAZhfshqg.text: Good southern comfort food. I got the buttermilk chicken and it almost put me to sleep. Come here hungry and leave ready to take a nap.

7RBS0IEcg2ByHKxJReT1uA.text: Amazing food. The shrimp and grits has to be the best in town. I have been here several times and never let down. If you come to Charlotte Midnight Diner is a MUST

PMu7Ig1Fx3AC8JBbHPVQhw.text: Hands down, the BEST shrimp and grits that I've had in my ENTIRE life!! I know, it sounds a bit extra, but trust me on this! I've heard a number of people tell me how good they are but questioned whether or not any of their dishes could be better than the signature chicken and waffles. We came in around 8:30p and were seated immediately. Our waiter was Leon and he was very friendly and attentive. Our food came out in a timely manner and was cooked to perfection. Of course I ordered the shrimp and grits, but my husband order fried fish and a side of grits. Everything tasted AMAZING!! I was more than pleased with our entire experience and would definitely recommend it! The bathrooms were clean and well kept as well. We will definitely be back soon!

VBVMhS4XGYX70d38SJcFYA.text: This diner is a fantastic find. Extensive menu. However, I need to rave about the French toast. This French toast is made of thick slices of challah bread, grilled lightly, and served with melted honey butter and warm syrup. The French toast was lightly dusted with powdered sugar. While I didn't choose a particularly healthy option, I did look for one and there were several omelet options that looked very appealing and there were many options. I plan to get up early for my morning flight out of town to go back for another round of French toast or to try one of their omelettes. I would also add that my waiter, Dave was great and we bonded over our love of honey butter and he strongly suggested the coconut encrusted French toast.

8KO2GyYhPmu2H_IWlv_1mw.text: Came here specifically for the livermush and the shrimp and grits.  Both were great.  Solid diner food.    Less awesome was the torn up seat with the red duct tape over it, the broken AC, the pace of service, and the actually warm (not tepid) water served (we were given a full cup of ice, but the point of no ice in my water is to avoid ice...).  Also, the ketchup was very, very watery.  Our two male staff members were friendly, but some of the women seemed rude to their customers and the manager had to yell at people at least three different times while I was there to sort silverware as they ran out twice.  We were also given someone else's signed credit card receipt.  Awkward!

0qULiJtARJJOLyVkE3_zGQ.text: Shrimp & Grits!!! so good. service was awesome. Me and some friends came to NC and during a night out we heard about this place. Saw the reviews and decided to try it about 3am, it was worth it.

BR6ho31NlIjoP5PrX8y-hQ.text: Came here after finishing a 5k walk uptown around 10 in the morning. When we got there the wait was 15 to 20 min but I don't think we barely waited 10 minutes for a table. I ordered the "Bubba" which is a split biscuit and fried egg with cheese smothered in sausage gravy along with pork bacon and hash browns. It was delicious!!! Will definitely visit again.

6Uh9uYpI6-dCNm7ueGrz7g.text: I was really impressed by the reviews and I wanted to visit this place. I am not from NC, I feel this place needs more midnight food spots. I visited this place on a Saturday night the wait was for 45 minutes no one to attend even after you see some spots empty. Bad customer service as they don't even maintain a list of the guests you just have to stand all the time strict notice outside that you're not allowed to use the restroom unless you get a seat :O.  Coming to the food we ordered the famous Shrimp and Grits, Chef Lee's famous fried chicken with the side of mashed potatoes and gravy, fruits and Banana pudding. Shrimp and Grits were good 3/5. It has good flavor but you need not come just for that. Chef Lee's famous fried chicken big no to this 1/5. This wasn't a good experience I am not sure if it was oil or not great meat but we just left it like that.  Banana pudding was ok 2/5. I wouldnt suggest this place for people from East coast. You will be disappointed.

pGIr9ElpjQVgtOXWAUfCgA.text: An original breakfast place has long been my favorite breakfast spot. Many have tried to replace it and failed. Midnight Diner has done the impossible and knocked it off the top. We've been here several times and I've yet to have something I didn't like. I just had the shrimp and grits and I have to say it was right up there with anything I've had in Charleston. Nothing fancy just amazing food. My kind of place for sure.

htGJp07FYALD0gjRlo323Q.text: So good! They have a mix of breakfast and burgers/normal food. They also serve beer and local beers. I got a waffle with sausage eggs and grits. I killed my waffle. My Server was also super nice and literally brought me anything I could've needed without asking!!

Uzh0qfByOcoDI4Bl8DfOJQ.text: Went here one night after leaving the Firehouse lounge. Very welcoming and was amazed that it was open so late. Will definitely have to go again

3t_IKkXI2n-_tRd1O48hwA.text: Been here about 6 times for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It's really uneven in terms of both food and service. Our first time, for a late lunch, food and service were both solid. After that, not so much.  Prices are good. Breakfasts are large. The sliders come with mayonnaise on them which I despise, so that kinda ruined one of the lunches. Had a spaghetti with meat sauce as a special last week that was truly bland and soggy -- and the most expensive item on the special menu. Also had the smallest Texas toast I'd ever seen.   Was there a few days ago on a sort of busy day and the staff were absolutely in the weeds. Couldn't even point people to empty, clean tables. We waited ages, with our small child getting increasingly unruly, before my husband just finally took a seat. They seemed annoyed by that and took forever to bring set-ups, water etc. I'd hate to see them when they were really full. As we left there was a line out the door and quite a few empty tables; the staff just never found their rhythm.  The place is clean and there is a good jukebox. At times the music can be too loud, but it's fun. I like this place and will probably return for staples like breakfast or a burger, but will stay away from their specials. I'll keep looking for the diner experience I know that's done better in other parts of the country.

mBGalr_X1L324ICpqkwWbQ.text: DAMMIT. I want to like this place. Seriously, Midnight Diner, I want to like you. I want you to be my place where I go when I need to get a quick lunch, or a greasy breakfast to bring back to the office when I have a hangover. Why can't you be that diner? WHY?   I'm updating my review. Unfortunately, I can't add any more stars to it because, well, it was really a two star experience. I had previously only had lunch at this place, and if you've noticed my other review, obviously wasn't impressed. Everyone kept telling me that for a good experience, I needed to get their breakfast food. I didn't really know when that opportunity was going to happen, since I'm not a huge breakfast food fan, and I only work near here, not live near here. Then - BOOM. Heavy night of happy hour Thirsty Thursday-style, and this morning I was feeling the need for greasy breakfast. My head was saying, "Diner, this is your chance."   I ordered to go: biscuit with sausage gravy, an egg over easy, side of bacon, hash browns. Picked up my order with good timing, and as always, the staff was friendly, attentive, and awesome. Never have any complaints on my end about that. I like the people, which makes this even worse.  The worst part was the bacon. This sentence carries a lot of weight, because usually in my life I'm more prone to saying, "The best part was the bacon," and I'm talking in reference to anything. I have never not finished bacon until this moment. You could tell that underneath the overcooked, dried, burntish bits that it was good, thick, applewood smoked bacon that would have been INCREDIBLE if it had just been cooked right! I had to stop eating it not because of the taste, but because my jaw hurt from trying to chew it.   Eggs had no salt on them. I asked for over easy, but there was that transparent rawness to them that suggested more sunny side up. The hash browns were also flavorless. No seasoning/salt/pepper/nothing. Also, kind of soggy instead of crispy. I put some of the sausage gravy on them to make them a little more appealing.   Saving grace: biscuit and sausage gravy. I uh, didn't actually get around to eating them yet, but from the looks of it that scratch-made biscuit is going to be tasty, and from what I tasted of the sausage gravy, it's the best I've tried yet. Then again, this is my first restaurant sausage gravy.   I'll iterate from before: I hope that if I have to go to this place again, I'll be able to return with a more positive review. Still waiting for that good food experience.

LLecfzr4_m7BWOjm7fFe6A.text: I try not to go to extremes when reviewing things; when those around me pile on the criticism, I try to find a silver lining. But it's hard to find anything that went right on my first visit to Midnight Diner.  We were seated promptly. That's the good news. My guest and I both ordered a mushroom swiss burger for lunch: Hers all the way, mine with lettuce and no other trimmings. She got fries, I got onion rings. Coffee for her, Diet Coke for me.  Then we waited. And waited. About 40 minutes. Lunch rush? It was busy, but not that busy.  When our food finally arrived, it was all wrong. Her burger came with mushrooms and swiss, but no toppings. Mine came with the lettuce, but no mushrooms. By the time we realized it, the waitress was gone. Five minutes later, my guest was able to flag her down about the condiments. She scurried away, presumably to remedy the mix-up; the condiments never scurried back.  To call my burger skimpy would be a disservice to skimpy burgers. The burger was sliced in half, and after one bite of the first half, I was left with mostly bun. Maybe the left half of that particular cow would be meatier...  The waitress did re-emerge eventually to refill our drinks. She offered to bring me another Diet Coke. She brought Dr. Pepper instead. The straw was nice, though.  It's a shame: I've been waiting for a good all-night diner in Charlotte (other than Landmark). I guess I'll keep waiting.

FPjbuxR3pq84E7Fc8SUZiA.text: I went today for lunch. I have driven by this place waiting for it to open sooo many times!! Well it's finally here and I'm glad because it was pretty good for its second to third day open! Parking is annoying...not many spots.  The server was really overwhelmed when we first got there but turned it around midway through. It took a few minutes to be approached and then a little more time for our order to be placed but I figure it couldve been worse!!   It's rainy and gloomy in Charlotte today so I opted for the "Famous" Fried Chicken with Mashed Potatoes and Gravy....Famous? What makes it famous? (like in ELF when he finds the "Worlds Best Coffee"...I love that movie, anyways)The flavor was lacking and seasoning was needed, but the fry on it was good and the chicken was moist. The mashed potatoes were also bland along with the gravy.   All in all not that great of an experience BUT it has all the potential to be great once they figure things out! The servers are still learning the menu as the chefs are too! I will be back only to be proven right that they just need a few days to get into their groove!!

M6feVjyfMk5H2JUKRv2Krw.text: This is definitely a late night spot. Generally speaking, I wouldn't want to eat what they serve unless I had some liquor in me. And, the silver prefab pod thingey is a trippy novelty if your'e in a "creative" mindspace. The inside is lit with yellow recessed lights accented with pink neon, so it's bright but not harshly so. Service was great and the food was acceptable. We ordered the uptown breakfast(s) and I had a side of mac n' cheese. The portions were smaller than I had anticipated but I don't suppose you really want large portions of the kind of foods they serve. The mac n cheese was mostly butter topped shredded orange cheese which I assume was cheddar.  Coffee was excellent and our server was prompt about refilling. They have just obtained a liquor license so beer and liquor will become available in the coming weeks.   The dining experience was totally satisfactory for 'late night.' And, as music lovers, my party and I were digging the gold record montages.  Driving here is not recommended as there were at least 5 police cars on patrol and limited parking.

3QLi0vtnvkdVJq8cx7rOXg.text: A real life diner, finally in uptown (or at least on the very edge).  Breakfast is served anytime along with a menu of mostly simple staples- burgers, sandwiches, and desserts- which are on full display at the front counter.  My wife and I went for breakfast on a Sunday recently, to see what this place was all about.  Atmosphere is mostly good: tight booths and bar seating in a long, narrow tin can of a space.  Large plasmas adorn the walls with a mix of local news and sports.  To be able to sit for breakfast without a wait on Sunday was a real treat, and I had high hopes at this point.  Service is mostly there, if not with a dash of attitude diners up north are known for.  Heaven help you if you are indecisive or ask for explanation of any menu item- our server at least acted like such a question would be heresy.    We both had breakfast and this is where things start to go downhill.  We both has eggs over medium that were more like over easy- too runny and loose for my taste.  We also ordered a few sides like mac and cheese.  These were small and not hot- like they had been made much earlier and didn't even make it under a warmer light for long enough.  The real issue, though, was with the kitchen and the other diners' entrees.  There was an air of unease amongst the other tables around us as people waited for food and then sent back orders that were under-prepared.  Servers seemed upset, themselves, but did little to put the guests at ease.  This place is new, so I get the sense the kitchen needs some seasoning working at this pace and then the staff needs to work out the timing.    All told, this likely fine for late night dining you are not likely to find elsewhere in the uptown area.  But, for a quality meal where time is not of the essence, I'd currently look elsewhere.

iSfmrzdsbS5fpSXyZ3f-kQ.text: One of my favorite things about Jersey are the diners. This diner was shipped on the back of a semi from Jersey to Charlotte and I am so glad it did! I visited with my husband for breakfast one cold morning and even though the line was out the door, it moved pretty quick. We got shrimp & grits, hash with ham, onions, eggs, french toast and some other stuff. The french toast was HUGE and delicious. It is a must-try. The staff is friendly and although it can be a little loud it is worth it for the delicious food. GO FOR THE FRENCH TOAST!

VGiVOO8jc-JKkBRlLI5U9Q.text: Our waiter was fantastic,  the food was to die for. My mom and me went for lunch there for the first time so we wasn't quite sure what to expect but I'm glad we went. I had shrimp and grits and they was absolutely delicious,  I mean roll your eyes delicious lol. My mom had breakfast and she's a picky eater amd she enjoyed her food so much.  The atmosphere was very pleasant, clean, and playing old school r&b ( real music ) lol. Took my brother home a fried chicken dinner and let me say this is the closest to my grandmas southern fried chicken that we will ever get. The cook really has a blessed talent and loves what he does. Oh and the collard greens oh man to die for, and they wasn't cooked with any kinda meat, which is hard to find in the south. So I will definitely recommend and my mom and me has a new restaurant for our mother daughter day out.

sUjCLJm3UL0LghwGc8OSuQ.text: Good after hours spot! I usually go around 2am on the weekend after hanging out at the epicenter. The food is okay, but the people watching is hilarious. FYI, the crowd can get a little rough.

i-FrsAjUVaIhr1KHZIIwCA.text: Very excited to go to Midnight Diner for lunch today for a couple of reasons...1. ) wanted to see if this dining car had been built by my family (back in the day..Fordero Dining Car Company from New Jersey)..unfortunately it is wasn't, but it is a good looking dining car but missing the touches that I am familiar with.  2.) miss going to a New Jersey diner so wanted to see how it stacked up (can't stack up to a NJ diner experience..so put that thought out of your head)..3.) the food - and that is really what the 3 stars are for..  We got there about 12:30pm and was excited to see Hamburger Slider Combo for $5.95 - that is what my husband ordered.  My English teacher mom would be very upset that we didn't notice it said "slider" and not "silderS"..So, when the very small SINGLE slider showed up at the table my husband was not so pleased.  Not only was it a single slider it was a very thin slider..(think the waitress would have mentioned this fact since it was a male ordering the slider..she could have saved the meal by suggesting that if he was hungry he should opt for the full size burger). Slider was good but portion was not ample.  I must have lost my NJ mind at the front door because I ordered the shrimp and grits with Creole Sauce Special for $5.95. I forgot I was looking for the NJ experience because no diner in NJ has Shrimp and Grits on the menu..But I always order Shrimp and Grits if it's on the menu..that's just my thing..The grits and Creole Sauce were very good - maybe a little too soupy.  The shrimp were small, but what do you expect for $5.95.  But there were ample shrimp.  I might have felt better about the dish if there were about 5 larger prawns - but then I realize the price would have been more.  We will go back because the philly cheesesteak wrap (there are none of those in NJ diners either) and the regular size hamburgers looked good.  The free parking is a definite plus.   The menu has different items - there is something there for everyone.

LmuJP7PREYPbU7XzRmMpRw.text: Came here on a saturday nght like at 3 am...   Get the BUBBA... how can you go wrong with sausage gravy, biscuits, cheese scramble...  service is terrible

XcS74QOwjtW-jfq-IyIhuA.text: Fresh off of an airplane and hungry for breakfast we headed to the Midnight Diner for sustenance. I had hoped for a biscuit with country ham but alas it was not to be found on the menu. I settled for biscuit with sausage gravy and an egg on top. Not bad.   The menu has a fairly good range of selections .My companion's omelet was good. Nothing extra ordinary nothing bad.

zh4ZHlk6zqg4LLomCdBdrw.text: Great service and atmosphere make the delicious and affordable food taste even better. :)

wqgYoLtRO_BrwzfQKqUuTQ.text: I have been here roughly half a dozen times and my experiences have been consistently good.  I have had everything from eggs and grits to hamburgers and apple pie and it is all delicious.  You just can't go wrong here.  Aside from the food, I love the fact that this is a 50's throwback diner.  You would think it has been around for years but in fact it is pretty new.  Despite it being a fairly recent addition to Charlotte, this diner has character that usually comes with age and lends itself as a great haunt for all times of day and night.  A quick tip: Saturday and Sunday get very busy so either be prepared to wait or time your arrival (especially on Sunday - be mindful as to when church services get out).

-YrIFRdwZRPzEDgJzPFVkA.text: Nice spot amongst the South End haunts that occupy the area. It's wanna-be retro, but that works for me!!!   I went on a Monday during lunchtime, and it wasn't bursting at the seams busy like many places South End, so I was happy because a a less busy place usually also means better service.   My waiter was a bit off putting, but the food came out soon and this is a diner, not Morton's so it's okay.   I ordered the handspun Strawberry milkshake which was delian! It tasted like it had real strawberries in it and the ice cream was thick and wonderful, as I could barely put my straw in the shake because it was so thick! Major kudos for that!!!!  I decided on the classic chicken and waffles....which were good but nothing spectacular....the dish definitely met "diner" sized expectations. The wings were crispy and hot just like I like 'em. The waffles here are thin, not Belgian style, but I actually felt that complimented the wings so that it didn't become a gluttonous meal...  The place was very "Americana", and looked like a regular recreated retro restaurant with Elvis posters everywhere.  The only negative is the parking, I wasn't there during a busy time and even then their tiny parking lot was full, so nighttime parking may be a hassle for those not arriving via light rail.  Go to Midnight Diner!

gnPkX_CGXHNfDtzrfLpn9Q.text: Great place for breakfast (the meat lovers omelet), haven't tried any other time of day yet. Reminds me of the diners of old, except a lot cleaner. Excellent service, never wanted for anything. (Thanks Dana for being able to read my mind). Would give 5 stars, but the prices are a teeny bit high. However this will not hold me back from going back again and again and again. I sense the Landmark has met it's match.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

vXiA9qwGIxke1tlhDpbpLQ.text: Our table had a sampling of many things on the menu from omelets and waffles to milkshakes and pancakes.  Everyone left happy!   The wait staff were incredibly friendly and all of our food was cooked as ordered and was served very quickly .  The San Bernadino omelet was perfection.

a0jJo55-Z9Iw85J2jGvqjg.text: I'm a bit surprised by the bad reviews. I've been here 3 times since it opened in September, and I've been very pleased with the food and the service. After all, it's a diner, and if a diner can fix a grilled cheese sandwich the way it's supposed to be made, then it gets good marks in my book. The fried chicken is ridiculously good, and I have a hunch they might be getting the fried chicken from Price's Chicken Coop! Okay, maybe not, but it's just as good.  I'm sure this place will get better with time. I like it, so that should count for something, no?

OM2A54UvQ62SNjzlXQ89sg.text: My first visit to Midnight Diner was during Speedweek and the food was great, fast service, even in a packed house. But the second time was a dull Wednesday evening with hardly anyone around, and service was sloooow. We were a bit early for a show at the Tremont and thought we'd grab a nearby bite at Midnight. There were only 2 other parties in the house, and we ordered 2 burgers and a plate of fries--and it took 20 minutes to come out.  Seriously? Diner time is like dog years; 20 minutes equals an hour and a half! Especially for a couple of BURGERS. Speaking of which, they were nicely topped (I got the Cali burger with avocado and added a side of jalapenos), but the meat wasn't seasoned and they were a little bland. Not worth missing Das EFX's opening song.

ZshevBDYUo96RZgyEa-ubw.text: Fun place to come to and grab some laughs at all the locals. Staff handles everyone really well while continuing good service.

ypcfugwV0qW8g3eLecWdDA.text: It was 1 in the morning and we waited for about 15 or 20 minutes for a table.  The place was packed.  I enjoyed the fast paces atmosphere and the music made you feel like you were in a hip nightclub.  We ordered Philly Cheesesteaks which were huge and very tasty.  The service was slow for us but that was not the case for the tables around us so I think our server was new or overwhelmed.  Even still this is a great place to eat in Uptown Charlotte.  I would give it more stars but with the service being slow I can't

CGETM2OynyLR9rRluTOhGg.text: We came for breakfast, and it was fantastic!! Worth any wait for sure! Come hungry and you will not be disappointed.  Their pancakes and biscuits are to die for!!  I had their omelette and hash browns and it was great!  We will be coming back for sure!

3raPTdJmC9EUS2x7yTc2nA.text: Great service, food is fresh.  Everybody is super down to earth and friendly.  Busy place, expect a 15+ min.wait, but worth it.  If you want to enjoy a casual dining experience with good food, come here.  We will frequent here. Thank you...

9XlFulqN23HCxgpk7WrDCg.text: Had a great dining experience at Midnight Diner (at 2pm lol) because the cute brunette Jennifer (Jenn on her name tag) provided us with a great experience. She made sure that me and my friends were always full on waters and coffee, and that we had a great dining experience in general. She provided us with great conversation and she never stopped smiling when she was at our table. That's what I like to see in a server: a great attitude. I liked the food too, although the pancakes could be a lot better. :( not affecting my score, though. I got a Philly cheesesteak to go and Jennifer suggested that I separated the bread from the meat to make sure that the bread wouldn't get soggy on the way home or when I put it in the fridge for my boyfriend whom works 3rd shift. What a great waitress and a great ambiance! I felt very welcomed there from the time I walked in. Thanks, MD :)

9oFrZ2O0YVnSNFF7m0O1Ow.text: Pros: Awesome food! A lot better than when they first opened. Can't go wrong with fried chicken or the waffles. I usually come in during breakfast and lunch hours.   Cons: WORSE parking lot in Charlotte. The front parking lot is very limited. The rear parking lot doesn't  give enough room to back up or maneuver anything larger than a Fiat or Mini Cooper.

Asu49-rndXGjc-MWUeutiw.text: Latosha and Leroy were awesome! Great service. Food was hot and great sense of humor.

6G-B2QvTgvtI27H8L2u-gg.text: In Charlotte on vacation and having such horrible experiences at other establishments I am glad to say my experience here was awesome. We were seated immediately and our waitress Jennifer was THE BEST hands down, from recommendations to refills, overall just a lovely person. If you come here PLEASE request her, I promise you won't be disappointed!

Kpxbu-C5V5b2VMhIuxxdxA.text: First, let me say that I DO like this place. It's been said by someone that it's hard to mess up breakfast and, well, Midnight Diner prepares what I would call a decent breakfast. I think Midnight Diner is more about the cool, funky diner atmosphere and at any given hour (open 24 hours a day except for Christmas) contains all walks of life - which I love. We waited for a table for a bit and were seated in a plush red booth. I ordered an omelet and your standard breakfast fare. Again, decent. Nothing to write home about but certainly - good.  That day there were random tables of strangers arguing back and forth about the best NFL teams which was mildly interesting/annoying. Oddly enough, the Panthers were not being discussed. Anyway, I digress...   This place is an interesting and fun choice when you are in the mood to hang out in a lively diner on the fringe of Uptown Charlotte.

vr9Vd0lFSBLwmyp5G3GbEA.text: This place used to be good but it has really gone down a lot even the rating is low it's not worth the money at all

ttTEDddZX0Q7hvAjOEd9ig.text: I give this place 3 stars because it needs a huge makeover. The servers do not make sure to clean the seating area after customers have left before seating someone else. It's trash on the floors and you have to bring it to their attention to sweep it up. The food is very good though!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waffle and French toast

Inzfi4lnrxAS-e-Hz3x5gg.text: This might be my favorite place to eat in Charlotte. It is definitely a come as you are kind of place, I love it for that simple reason. Anything on the menu is pure deliciousness. I usually get the Shrimp and Grits, I must say ....it's better than my mother's. Hopefully she never reads this review. The fried chicken is my second favorite, along with the massive French toast. I always intentionally order more than I know I can eat, simply because I love to be in the presence of such wonderful food. Every time I bring someone here they become a believer, I should receive rewards points. You honestly can't go wrong with anything from here at anytime of day. I went in today with my little brother at 4pm and ordered and entire breakfast. Only because I could. If you have never been, I highly recommend. There is also one server who so passionately describes every dish on the menu, you would think he created and cooks them each personally. I could go on forever. But I will stop here.   Enjoy the edible.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits, French toast, hash browns all the way, bacon, and eggs. Can&#39;t go wrong !!!

7L4MhxkoNjhyIvpWYBzxYw.text: Favorite place love their famous shrimp and grits Nice and creamy with the right amount of spice.  Bang bang shrimp was also good.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

Wu6hrMBzERIyLXeBnmCxrQ.text: I am a "fried chicken connoisseur" and I can tell you that this was one of the best fried chicken I've ever had!  It was crispy, but not greasy, super tender, and had just the right amount of salt.  The price was very decent as well.  I took the food back to the hotel so I don't know what the service or the atmosphere is like, but it seemed like a nice restaurant to me.  I'll definitely be back for the food!

Mo-ihainI9NoI21ZtZtPHA.text: Mediocre food and poor service. Noticeably went downhill over the last 5 years. Ambiance and location are still great. Free parking is limited.

9TBucR5YcaVl5RGr5A9NXA.text: They were packed at night of course! The wait wasn't too bad. Very loud at night because everyone is drunk and hungry. I got the shrimp and grits and it was by far the best I've had. Service was great even tho they were busy. I would go again. Even if I wasn't in the area and I wanted some shrimp and grits. I'd drive there just for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yesssss

9x09I3U9XcVttODc8dhQdQ.text: This diner is fantastic. From the food, to the staff, to the energy it is awesome. You normally walk into a diner expecting, a diner, this is far more than that. It'll be on our regular Charlotte rotation.

F0dzKWjhFfDQicxZklSWUQ.text: We went on New Year's Day for breakfast at 7:30 and at that hour there were already so many people. I had the waffle and it was good but I wish they would warm up the syrup since that makes such a  difference. The service was very good and they were all so friendly and lots of people working there on New Year's Day.

TZLtXfHABbheym7Z_Evqaw.text: Delicious chicken and waffles.  Well worth the wait for the food!

rOtG6kT-BcnDLCUhs-rsrA.text: Went at around 4 today and it wasn't packed like it would've been in the evening (which is a good thing)! Food came out super quick and tastes fresh. Our server, Tiffany, was very sweet and attentive too. Will be coming back again, probably for some late night munchies.. Heh.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Provolone Grilled Cheese w/ onion rings and mashed potatoes.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Philly cheesesteak
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Big Fish Sandwich

pU-lAjUxCgdBgQlPzzeRyg.text: Honestly, I have only been once but do not think this place is worth the hype. Even after a few adult beverages, the food wasn't very good and not as cheap as I expected diner food to be. Everything just tasted like salt. Their only saving grace is that they are open 24 hours. Plan to wait if you go anytime between breakfast and 3am though.

J1zTOjkTcpCeGbvqSmYXmw.text: I went to the Midnight Diner with my boyfriend this morning for breakfast. We've past it a million times, but have never been before. We were seated immediately and had a friendly and attentive waitress.  We both had chocolate milk (yummy and cold!), I had corn beef hash, scrambled eggs, and a biscuit (all delicious, especially the biscuit), my bf created his own omelette and he really enjoyed that.  The food was good, the menu is huge, the prices are extremely reasonable, and the service was great. I'm happy we finally tried Midnight Diner and I will definitely be back. Next time maybe I'll try the chicken and waffles :)

vxI71pQj6JS3FHmmsNUqvQ.text: I'm not sure what the expectations are of the other reviewers, but it's a diner, for goodness sake! It's open 24/7 and it serves up some of the best breakfast I've ever had. I selected the breakfast that comes with two eggs any style, choice of meat (I had bacon), creamy grits, and two pancakes, except I opted to switch out the pancakes for a biscuit, and added on sausage gravy. Wow. When the menu says creamy grits, it's True! They are rich and creamy, perfect for a Southern gal like me! The sausage gravy was some of the best I've ever had. The service was just right, not too much, not too little. I would definitely return. On a side note, I saw a guy there eating breakfast.  He had scrambled eggs covered in ketchup (LOL) and was drinking a Sam Adams! That's the beauty of a diner: you can have whatever you want, whenever you want (as long as local law allows)!

kwu0FUoesrgbKsEPkrY5Lw.text: Best grits ever! And Mona Lisa is the vibrant singing waitress with a sense of humor sure make you laugh!

pFl-owL2pEqaTaPfYXFpsg.text: Carolina Classic Burger, oh so good after a late night of partying! Go during the week, late at night b/c it packs out really quick on the weekends after the clubs close. The food is great, menu is like upscale waffle house with a 1950's diner theme. Very clean restaurant, the clientele is varied, and the waitstaff are very good. Prices are great too!

QCRHb05OslVQXezWBPxStg.text: One of the few places in the world that I would stand in line for over 1hr.   FOOD WAS GREAT @ 2 AM. I got the Midnight Special with chicken wings.. the French Toast was great..and the grits...oh my..If someone wants to buy me a Christmas present get me a bowl of grits from Midnight Diner. No lie.. I ate the best grits in the universe.  Best part was the waitress Angela yelling.."If you have been here over 2hrs and your ticket is on the table..you ain't gotta go home but you got to get the hell out of here!"

yVVe3IH3NO9_2AfaaVvpGQ.text: Yet another great visit to the diner. Went last night around 4 am- place was packed.   My server didn't greet me for a few minutes, another staff member had to notify her, but upon looking around, I saw why- she was taking care of 3 full tables way at the other end of the restaurant.   Let's take a brief moment to discuss a couple of food service basics. I notice these automatically because I work in food service, but others may not. It is the management's job to ensure that each server has the correct number of tables to handle at a time, and that those tables are spaced out a reasonable distance. In my opinion, having a server wait 3 loaded tables at one end of the restaurant plus stools in the bar at the other end is a bad management decision. So when I say that my server couldn't get to me, I say this knowing that it was not her fault. The manager should have taken notice of this and reassigned her section.  Just a habit to get into when you visit a restaurant- any restaurant-  when you first sit down, take note of how many other tables your server visits, where those tables are located in relation to yours, and how those tables are spaced out. (i.e., did you all get your entrees at the same time? Then you probably all ordered them at the same time, and the kitchen had to cook them all at the same time.) Then, judge the service accordingly once you have those answers. To whoever commented that they thought they had bad service because their server was triple sat- get a job waiting tables, become triple sat, and then complain. And please, speak to a manager if you have a problem, don't just automatically deduct it from your server's tip. Sure, if you see them standing in a corner doing nothing and you need a drink refill, there might be a problem, but more than likely it's because of something I mentioned above.   Ok, end soapbox.   I got the Midnight Burger, which is a hell of a deal. Their online menu is a little outdated, it seems, but a plain burger, served with fries, is $5.75. A Midnight burger, which comes with lettuce, tomato, onions, pickles, and served with fries, is also $5.75. What is your problem if you did not order this burger? I want another one right now. I didn't get it with cheese and I should have, but it was perfect the way it was. The fries were good too, and there were so many I couldn't finish them.   So, bottom line is guys, it's a diner. This is exactly what I was expecting it to be, and it's exactly what I got. If you're expecting to be blown out of your chair with 5-star quality, go find somewhere else to eat at 4 in the morning.

HSoUdiOFA5h8Bh5GWL8cvg.text: I absolutely loved it!!!! The food is great and the waitresses are so happy and friendly, they messed up my sons order and fixed it quickly and gave us free cake!! Will surely go Again!!!

IjbHM2mthiKMi-M0fXZf8A.text: This place has got the best fried chicken but food alone don't make a great dining experience this place is so loud until you have to yell to speak to the person next to you on top of having the jukebox turn up to the max. We order the family size chicken dinner which was enough for 4 people it came with 8 piece of the chicken 4 biscuits but only two individual sides SMH and to substitute the breast and wings for dark meat is an additional $5 call me crazy but breast cost more my service was awesome my food was fresh in hot and I will go back maybe doing today when it's not a club and a restaurant at the same time

7_P8qqqpgYH4NXEbSvhLZg.text: The Midnight Diner is a decent place to go for traditional diner food.  I ordered the eggwhite veggie omelette.  While they gave me cheddar cheese instead of the Swiss that I asked for, I still ate it up.  Hashbrowns a bit on the soggy side, and toast is toast.  My companions each enjoyed fresh fried chicken with macaroni and cheese.  They raved about this, and took their leftover mac to-go.  I did not leave disappointed or hungry, but not sure that I'd return unless it were in fact, midnight (or later for that matter).

_0_xsR3SbZFhRiVujTo8tg.text: I was really hung over when I stumbled in here at 8am on a Thursday, I could have been a teensy bit inebriated still. I needed breakfast food and I needed it quickly. That is exactly what I got. I am not sure if they wanted us out of there b/c my friend was putting pancakes on his face or they are really just that fast. They also serve beer and alcohol!? I didn't need any, but it was nice to know it was there. For those days when you need a Bud and biscuits and gravy or a gin and tonic with your waffles. Either way, delicious and necessary. Can't wait to go back and really look over the menu with a clear head.

BqBI_8c4BT4SpW5eNj2T4A.text: Charles H. is a liar. There is no way his review is genuine. We had lunch there today and our experience was not even close to Charles' fantasy. However, I am not here to review Charles.   Diner itself is cool. No police cars there today. Diner's are, as one reviewer put it, supposed to be places serving fast,greasy,cheap food in large quantities. Showmar's has larger quantities and the food is probably at least as good.     The service was fine. I had the Philly Cheeseteak but didn't order the a la carte fries. The sandwich was cooked well and tasty but I could have eaten three of them. My companion ordered the fried chicken sandwich and it looked small and he said it was only OK. He did order the a la carte fries though and they were very mediocre, at best.   I asked the server if I could order breakfast at lunch and she said no sir but they are thinking about changing that. Also said the a la carte sides are something management is looking at as well.   This place could be very cool but right now it has the feel of a corporate chain "diner". Diner's, Drive In's and Dives will not be stopping here anytime soon.

egVUpOpEBug9DeYlI-4Wuw.text: The french toast is excellent, real thick cut bacon, and its 24 hours! I'm a native Charlottean back in town from Atlanta. I hoped something better than Landmark would one day be added to all the new nightlife. This is that hope. I didn't find the food compromised by the diner vibe at all. The challah was authentic & real maple syrup aren't exactly low brow. My suggestion: they have fried chicken AND waffles on the menu...but not together. What's that oversight about?

tfrF0lhbTSn8wjlVBg-z-A.text: When restaurants and stores put out banners that say "Best (fill in the blank) I am usually disappointed when I try it. Well, let me tell you I was not disappointed at this place who boasts the best chicken and waffles--I haven't had chicken and waffles (together) anywhere else in Charlotte but I have had chicken and I have had waffles in Charlotte and let me tell you I haven't found any that are better than Midnight Diner. Maybe it's the combination but its freakin' delicious. One of my friends got the same and a side of mac and cheese (gooey cheesiness, could use a little more flavor though) and she loved hers too! We were in C&W heaven. Our waitress was supernice, checked on us regularly and told us the truth when we asked questions about the menu (i.e. are the shrimp big or little in the shrimp and grits...LOL).  As I looked around the diner, everyone else seemed to be enjoying their meals too. While I can't visit toooo often I know that when I do I will be in for a treat. For some reason, I don't think they have anything bad on their menu. I hope they don't prove me wrong.   Oh and how great is it that they are open 24 hours--a definite need in Uptown. Yum-O.

G82bKQ_XtcHEZCcJNogHmA.text: Been here two times today first and my last food is good but the new waitress with a attitude throwing food at u don't sit well with me.

6rqxfd-pn9uSzLQViN-hiA.text: I seem to be odd man out here. I've been here several times and never had any real delay getting sitted or attended to by a waitress. Admittedly, I tend to focus on sandwiches and burgers. My wife and I have enjoyed every visit and are a quickly becoming regulars. Service is always friendly without being pushy or constantly. The manager has checked on us every visit so far as well.  Personally, I would happily recommend it for some one looking for a good, reasonably priced meal.  The music and memorablia on the are nice touches as well.  You also must try the hand-mixed shakes, as they are excellent and remind me of what you get at the little mom & pop restaurants.

0KIrMHyAO2-KAJwG45EgUw.text: We were there for breakfast. I had the waffles nothing to write home about. I make better waffles at home with Aunt Jemima mix.  Husband order pancakes eggs sausages well over 9 dollars for that. He did  not even finish his pancakes and thats normally his favorite.    Enjoyed the interior.. but the food lack in taste and overprice.  Took forever to get the food too.  Perhaps since they are still new.  Management will work out the problems.  Overprice foods. Would not being going there again.

ZNuguRLCx83ANdjcXpZF8w.text: Walked down to the Midnight Diner on a frigid night in Charlotte... was warmly greeted and seated instantly... service was friendly. Food was good diner fare and the milkshake was above average!  Highly recommended for 24x7 food, and its only just outside the main downtown area!

73l8um_Fhjr6KBBJZc9HSA.text: I live just a few blocks away from Midnight Diner, so despite the reviews I read, I still had to check it out for myself. I don't know if the service and food have just really improved in the past two week, but my experience was pretty much the exact opposite of most of the reviews that I read.  We were seated immediately, even though the place was busy at 8:00 p.m. The wait staff were nice, and got us a soft drink in lightening speed while we perused the menu.  I ordered the country fried steak with mashed potatoes and green beans for sides. The country fried steak was awesome - exactly what I was hoping for. It was hand-breaded with a nice cream gravy. You could tell the mashed potatoes were handmade, and the green beans were just seasoned amazingly (I probably could have just had a giant bowl fo the green beans and been happy). My fiance got hand-breaded chicken tenders with mac and cheese, and had no complaints either.   The food came out within 10 minutes of ordering - and exactly like we ordered it. I couldn't have expected any quicker, especially since the place was pretty busy.  I really have no complaints about this place, and will be back regularly. The people that I've talked to about this place also love it - one guy I know has been there 12 times already. The only negativity that I've seen/heard has been online, and not just on this website either. But I had to give my two cents after an experience that I couldn't expect to have been any better. Quick service, good homemade food, friendly staff, and good prices - that pretty much sums it up for me.

OKLiIbTRpsM0Eo3fpUJLHQ.text: I've eaten here a few times now and I think it's fair to say that the diner is consistently yummy.  Each time the service has been good and the food has been exactly as a bright silver diner's food should. It's the perfect place for a nightcap, a "morning after" breakfast or even a quick lunch. A word of advice, try the mac-n-cheese. I'm confident the recipe was borrowed from someone's grandmother.

IbYEriKOD69ipwuVwFSSqA.text: Fabulous diner that doesn't disappoint.  My brother enjoyed his midnight special dinner and a strawberry milkshake.  My GF really liked her slider which was the perfect size for her appetite.  My country fried steak was OK, but actually it was no where near as good as I had expected and hoped for, especially for the price ($9.99).  The beef was a bit tough and the breading wasn't crispy.  The gravy was ok, but usually is really salty and has a bit of kick to it as a result.  Despite my let down, everyone else's food was great and our server was really nice and attentive.  They also serve alcohol and was a steal at $2/beer or $1.50 for Sam Adams.  We didn't imbibe any, but it was nice to know the bargain was there.  This is a great place to hit up after going out in uptown.  The last time we went to a dump formally known as Waffle House on N. Tryon St. so this was a great experience.

kcqXEubGoGxptQI3n-1XFA.text: Jessica and Alisa are best servers in Charlotte! Great eats, homemade and reasonably priced. Relatively clean and you can be in and out in 30 minutes if you are on a time crunch.   I tip 20/30% here and will keep coming back for the superb service and food.

mc1pXo-K2326DZOuaYPlzg.text: Wow, Midnight Diner totally rocks. I wish they would open a location in Orlando!  II was here for business, so my co-workers and I got huge, delicious plates of food--along with the best bloody marys I've ever tasted--and loved every bite and sip.  The staff was so over-the-top friendly, super "southern hospitality" and just made it a fantastic experience. Great service, food, and a knockout bloody mary!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

dbQNGL0KZT6pWz8k9WAoog.text: I stopped by at 3:57am earlier today for breakfast.  I knew something was up when I arrived and there were multiple police there one with emergency lights on and everything.  I went to the door and they have a line of people going out the door with police crime tape up and handwritten signs saying to stay out until they call you.  Once you get "called in" you have to do limbo under the police tape.  They sat me down towards the end of the diner.  I don't mind the music selection but they had it blasting to the point of distortion.  I sat there waiting for anyone to come and take a drink order or food order for 12 minutes.  I ended up turning on one of my TV shows on my phone and watched for a while until Anesha came to take my order.  She had herself and another person saying she was in training.  I placed my order for The Bubba and she told me it would be out in a few minutes.   My food came about 14 minutes later and I still had not received my drink nor any silverware.  The person who brought my food asked what my drink was and went and got that for me.  The food quality was pretty good minus a weird taste in the hashbrowns.  I finished my food and a little while later Anesha brought my check and told me there was no rush.  I went to pay and was told I had to wait for my waitress and then she came over.  I attempted to pay like I have here before with Samsung Pay and was told that I couldn't do that.   The manager the older white lady copped an instant attitude and told me that I was a liar and that I hadn't paid with my phone.  I have proof on my phone and statement that I have in fact used it here.  They then decided to bring the Charlotte Mecklenburg Police in to talk with me about it.  I greeted them and told them the situation and they didn't have much to say.  The only thing that he had to say was that "they have rules" I told him I understood that but there were no rules up at all talking about tap and pay or paying with my phone was not allowed.  The manager then smacks her lips and says that oh well I guess he's getting a free meal tonight.  The police then told me to "have a good night"  In fact, I would have never stepped foot into Midnight Diner had I known this new fact.  I choose not to do business with establishments who are unable or unwilling to accept payment.  The thing about Samsung Pay is it acts just like a regular card swipe but the sad fact is Midnight Diners POS is enabled for mobile payments they just choose not to accept them and now I know this but there was no excuse for the management treating me like trash and calling me a liar.  They are the liars because I can show evidence that they accepted my phone as well as witnesses who were there.  The biggest problem here is the slow service and treatment of guests.  I can say with certainty that I will never return to this location.

xEgvi_ejEKRCCq-Fvu1HPA.text: Was told this was the best fried chicken in Charlotte. Went and immediately loved the atmosphere, exactly the type of oldschool diner that one would expect. It was pretty crowded but service was on point and the wait staff is well run. The portions are huge and prices reasonable. Oh, and the fried chicken, pretty damn good.

NkHJYsIkBMFBmOAVHExamg.text: Omg the BEST  shrimp and grits I ever ate...yes there was a line buy with food that good there should be a line

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits....in the background is his wings and onion rings w/Mac and cheese all of which were amazing.And that Biscuit omgggggg

fzRRHghWzX5iRBt_q0ykeQ.text: I've been here probably a dozen times since my last review, so I figured an update was in order. Midnight Diner provides tasty diner food at fair prices, but unfortunately the iffy and slow service really overshadows that.  FOOD/PRICES I'll start with the best part of Midnight Diner: the food. I have tried a fair share of the menu, and everything tastes great. The fried chicken is crisp and well-seasoned, the burgers are juicy and topped with fresh toppings, the sides are prepared well, etc. The prices are also fair for the most part, which is great. Dessert is a bit on the expensive side, though. There really is not much more to say here: excellent diner food at fair prices.  SERVICE The service at Midnight Diner is incredibly slow. It's not the kitchen, as plates frequently pile up in the window, and it is not a result of the place being understaffed. Whenever I bring a friend to Midnight Diner who has never been, he/she always remarks how many staff the place has. I think it's just poor training and bad management. I had the unfortunate experience of eating during a shift change once, and it was a disaster. No one knew who the host/hostess was, no one knew which tables they had, no one knew who was supposed to be cleaning, etc. Ordering dessert, getting a refill, or trying to pay is always a nightmare because of how slow and absent the servers are.  Overall, I really like Midnight Diner's food, but the incredibly slow service prevents me from going often.

ZYrz2Bj214xnfoAbKipqww.text: I finally got a chance to stop by Midnight Diner and I must say I was impressed! The food was great and the service was excellent! Tammie\Tammy was an amazing server!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

xZoOTAxmeBnAcNks7brm6A.text: I was highly disappointed with this establishment. I was so excited to try the food here. That atmosphere was pretty cool walking in as well. But things turned around very quickly. First our waitress took our order and it took an HOUR for the food to come out. I ordered steak and eggs. All of my food was lukewarm....barely. Right after we received our food, the waitress decided to come right back over to ask about the check (we literally just started eating). Then she comes over after a couple of minutes again and asks to take my friend's empty plate if he was finished....but it still had food on it. So he scraped the food onto another plate to get her out of our face. When we paid for the food, we have her exact change and she asked if we wanted change back Lol. I can't make this up. I'm sure they over charged us as well. My friend got the chicken and waffles with an extra side of 2 eggs. We were billed $6.98 for a two egg breakfast. Needless to say, I will not be revisiting this location.

MR2INIbetNsryBXPeshqyA.text: Any chance we can stop here we do.  Love the shrimp and grits!!   Breakfast is always good.  Love the Greek omelet.    It can be very busy on Sundays but the wait is worth it.  Classic dinner food with good service

JF6LFxOUSjY1j9MJsrC7hg.text: Nom.com Charlotte staple and the latest bite in town. Being in the south can suck after midnight but midnight diner feels the void on quality food, quick service and late night hours. Whether your a banker grabbing take out in your way home or you've been drinking the night away at a near by bar. Skip the chicken and waffles and get the shrimp and grits. You won't regret it.

cxRc0po79IlvkyyyF4G-lQ.text: Our food was amazing. Shrimp and Grits & The Bubba. Our server was awesome! Love, Love, Love Latosha

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

QuEhnxys4lFwDjj-HQEszg.text: In Charlotte for my fraternity's convention and tried this place. Had the Carolina Burger. Very tasty with the cole slaw, chili, and cheese. Not a combo I would have thought would be as good add it was. Fries came out cold but our waitress Corie replaced them right away. Cori was really helpful and made good recommendations on the menu items. She was on point with the service too.  Bruhs had the chicken and waffles and they looked really good. They cleaned the plate so I would say they enjoyed it. Would deff recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina burger. Really tasty!!!

KvDX7gl19GMhhCVhspUNog.text: Great food with quick service even during the morning rush. Menu has that great diner variety! A must top in Queen City!!

l_33x-eyvXydZO7qrWNULQ.text: Traditional diner with quick, hot and delicious food.  Biscuits were delicious.  Fried chicken was some of the best I've eaten.

mapmmQO31yQbVoXjTnqsMw.text: Really good breakfast food. The grits are some of the best I've had, and the chicken and waffles are delicious as well. May want to go earlier in the evening however because the line is "out the door" anytime after ten.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken was seasoned and cooked perfectly and the waffle was fluffy.

yPdZzBWEvhbzu9IlMoXCcA.text: This place is amazing! It is so worth the wait! Try the salads - they are surprisingly huge and delicious! Yes girls, there is a way to eat semi-healthy even at a diner! Make you and your man happy, amen!

YDKAes30pE6AzQKPxmhKSw.text: Good food and nice staff very down to earth. The customers are from all walks of life and you do not feel like you are out of place. I got the burger and fries with waffles on the side..lol. The burger and fries where fresh. Fries home cut delicious. The ranch dressing is then best you can drink it. My daughter got the shrimp and grits, they where creamy and had a little kick to them. My younger children opted for the breakfast pancake eggs and sausage and they ate them all up. My party and I really enjoyed our food we will return.

-2BWQxa1wK3pxh30DfdC_g.text: Great place to come and take a load off! It is a bit crowded but it is worth it. Great food well worth the price! They have fresh-cut fries that are really good. There's not a bad seat in the house and you should definitely try it.
