-nJYn0pM-DZH6VSODgVbSA.text: Whenever I start to crave NJ diner food I find myself at the closet thing here in Charlotte,  Midnight Diner!   The chicken and waffles are my go to meal. The loaded fries are awesome after a night of drinking and the shrimp and grits are delicious. Honestly it's just good diner food!   Outside of the food the staff is friendly and makes you feel at home offering their recommendations of food and good ole southern hospitality.   If you ever find yourself hungry at an ungodly hour skip the fast food and head over to Midnight Diner.

3K8qCgSvGzOKMYnhGEiJfg.text: There for Sunday brunch this past weekend. Knew I was at the right place when we drove up! Parking lot and outside was packed . But the wait was less than the 15 mins quoted for a party of four! Ordered the "Bubba" the Hashbrowns w and the sausage gravy were perfect. No seasoning necessary!  PS: Forgot to mention the size of the platter!

pPte8lYlOqf2y1cKa-7-uQ.text: Went to the Midnight Diner after a football game to grab something to eat. We expected there to be a line, which there was, and was told wait would be 35/40 minutes, but then was seated within 10 minutes. The menu had so many things to choose from!! I got the thumbs up French toast, and this was honestly the BEST French toast I've ever eaten EVER!!! The music was awesome and made you feel like dancing in your seat. I will go back for sure, and want to drive to Charlotte (2hrs) just to go here!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

7R6Rez4SSuMUvRTo6dH0Zw.text: Talk about character.  Hungover? Go and get the corned beef hash slam. 10/10 Brunch? They've got chicken and waffles. Drunchies and munchies? The Bubba is for you. Just got out of the club? They're open 24-7. Wanna dance with a stranger to some upbeat music at 3:00 in the morning? I've seen it happen.  This is one of the most entertaining, and consistently delicious diners that I have ever had the pleasure of visiting. Worth the line if there is one, and when there is a long line, the wait is still pretty short.  Just go.

u17s3TMxm9N9P6r0KSYWFA.text: Went to the midnight diner after a late night! Our server was Aneasha (sorry if I messed up the spelling!) but she was awesome and made sure we stayed hydrated. The food was okay, we all order breakfast and made the best of it. I would also say a little overpriced also for the juices and a waffle.

Ne2CDwswn9bX_ZKhUuOoXA.text: Wish I could give more than 5 stars. Ate here with my family. Place is cool! Great vibe! If you can look past Security at the door. You won't be disappointed about the food. Ordered Chef Lees famous Fried Chicken. It came with 2 sides. Best Chicken I have ever had! Crispy, moist, fresh and not greasy. Sides are great too! Mash taters and gravy, Mac and Cheese and a Buttermilk Bisquit. Yummy Yummy! Staff friendly and good. Parking alittle hard. Next time I am going to try and get there earlier. Deserts are Fabulous! Strawberry Shortcake Cheesecake Awesome! Pecan Pie Perfect! Coconut Cake Huge and Deliciuos! Craving that chicken right Now!

tOZCCVfASh1QdM0sLzy7Rg.text: I heard a lot about this spot and decided to try it. Parking is a bit of a challenge as the restaurant is downtown and space is limited. The interior of the restaurant is great. There are gold albums on the wall and nostalgic pictures of old movies that give it a nice look. We were seated within twenty minutes, which was great for the breakfast rush, but it took ten minutes before our server came to our table. We ordered our beverages before our meal, but the server forgot to bring us our drinks before our food arrived. I ordered the chicken and French toast. The chicken needed some seasoning, it tasted like it went from the package and into the fryer. The French toast was tasty and the bread was big, but the sides of the bread was hard and seemed stale.  Read other reviews before you try it, my experience may have been an isolated case and I will give them another try.

wNVWOzRyrody29K6m0pToA.text: We always pass by when we went to uptown, but never had a chance to try it. So glad we did...they have the best fried chicken ever!!!!! So very crispy outside, and super juicy inside. Definitely need to try it if you come here. Hubby order the burger, it was good but nothing spactacular. Very busy on the weekend so come early for dinner.   Parking is a pain though. Tiny little parking space hard to park a truck...this is why the 1 star was taken off.

4rddkjUayjWjQLzAjCP96g.text: From all those Shrimp & Grits pictures I saw , this place was on my list and I had to go here for those . We were here on an early Sunday Morning and were seated immediately . Our waitress was a Superstar . She was a ball of energy . We got the Omelette ,Pancakes and Grits . Boy o Boy were those grits Creamy ! They were so creamy that I never go to chew on them except for the shrimp. Gulp Gulp Gulp. I would have loved if the dish had more spice but I am not complaining . Omelette was great too . My only gripe was about the pancakes , they were flat ,rubbery and chewy . Not a Fan . Nonetheless I enjoyed my meal and service thoroughly and would go back .

34uNSrcY7c8OX4cYY1QMqQ.text: Solid. Packed. Reliable. This place was crazy busy, with good reason. You want a filling no frills but tasty meal then this is your place to go. I came on a Saturday morning and thankfully didn't have to wait as I wanted to sit at the bar. It didn't look like the wait was crazy though as food came out pretty quickly for all. I feel like this would be the perfect stop on the way home after a night of drinking. Service was ok (nothing special, but not bad). I just wish the place was a tad cleaner, but as far as diners go... it was still pretty clean. Will definitely return.

prSLuuedHqNqUaYrF7S93g.text: Wow!! I am in love with my husband's eagle eye (and much else) and thank him for spotting this incredible spot on our way to elsewhere for lunch. Midnight Diner is amaaaazing. Shrimp and grits superb. Huge burgers! And Nikki's service exceptional! We'll be back.....  Just returned for second time -- and the grits are even more amazing than I had recalled. Angel's service also rocks!! Grazie mille.

xme41Z7BgjY8SzixJwpPkA.text: Food is excellent. I recommend the chicken and French toast. Grits are the best I've ever tasted. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in Charlotte.

9ZkTPgy7FL8hbAOSg7pxSA.text: I arrived in Charlotte around 9:30pm on a Wednesday night. I was starving and looking for a place open late around South End, which seemed deserted. I checked Yelp and found that most places were going to close in 30 minutes. I definitely wasn't in "Kansas" (read: Los Angeles) anymore.  The only place open this late on a weekday was Midnight Diner. And it was good.   When I came in I had a feeling I was going to get a great meal. The place was loud, bright and packed with a lot of diners. They were playing music from the 50's in the background. The ambiance was great.  I got the Shrimp and Grits which came out to only $11.90 (tax included). This was served piping hot and fresh. The grits were beautifully creamy and smothered in a creamy Cajun sauce that was savory and spicy. The shrimp were also cooked perfectly.   I LOVED the biscuit. It was brushed with melted butter so it had a beautiful glaze on it already. The biscuit itself was heavenly and flaky - it tasted like they just took it out of the oven and put it on the plate.  A perfect first meal for introducing me to Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits - $11.90 including tax!

ICGHDsquBYPAKi6FPBxJaA.text: Great service, friendly wait staff , great ambiance   and plenty of good food at this diner. We tried some specialties such as the fried chicken and home made french fries. We also ordered a fish taco, kids  mac and cheese, giant salad  with chicken tenders and sides of coleslaw , biscuits and onion rings. All nicely plated,  and good portions. Everything was tasty.  Fried chicken real good but white white a bit on the dry side, nice breading. Fish taco was great with good flavor. French fries tasty but not crunchy, onion rings ok, biscuits soft and tender, tasty coleslaw, creamy mac and cheese. The salad with chicken tenders also good and basic served with a honey mustard dressing. Chicken tenders nicely breaded and tender. Our waiter very attentive and aimed to please We will return and try breakfast here! Great menu choices  , reasonable  prices and home style food

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Family fried chicken

Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Giant biscuits

myDcn5QyHdbszEX4CvNWEQ.text: The hostess rolled her smug eyes at me because I did not want to sit at a backless bar stool.  I'm about to work on my feet for 8 hours so forgive me if I prefer a back on my chair.  So she sat me in the very back next to the hostess stand. Although the waitress was nice I had to sit and wait for her personal conversation at the table beside to be over before I could get a cup of coffee.  While ordering,  I asked to purchase a 2oz ramekin of gravy. (I'm allergic to wheat but cheat once and while) I was told NO. The only way I was getting gravy was to buy a whole of it.  So after ordering a breakfast including extra crispy hash browns I waited what seemed to be about 3 minutes. Presto my food was there.  Sausage cold and hard, hashbrowns petrified,  not crispy and cold stale burnt toast. I wait for about 8 minutes to be checked on.  I asked for fresh food not the cold nonsense that I was served.  With in 3 minutes came out my "fresh" food.  It was even worse. Burned, cold, dry sausages and cold slimy hashbrowns in a pool of slimy grease.  I sent it all back. The manager acted annoyed that breakfast standard was above the Midnight diners standard. I was still charged $5 and still tipped $5.  Ridiculous.   So now I'm hungry at work out of my $10.  My advice. Stick w waffle house. At least they take pride in cooking you breakfast, way cheaper and more delicious.  Good bye Midnight Diner.  Maybe you are only good for soaking up alcohol at 2am when people dont give a shit what crap they are eating.

zmFlg4wl7GYsJx5VKMnmEw.text: I miss Charlotte, especially the cheap and delicious bloody marys at midnight dinner! My boyfriend was there working nights so he and his coworkers had been frequenting it so much that by the time I arrived, the servers knew them by name. I wish I could recall the best ones name, however never did we have bad service so I suppose it does not much matter. I can't wait to visit this spot again. The food was greasy diner food, but well prepared and served hot... with cocktails. Works for me!

1zNlrEzvYrrDKaGPEXpyEQ.text: Grits were great!  The rest of the meal, just below average! 2 eggs, turkey bacon and grits! 2nd order of grits. Doesn't come close to Waffle House who the absolute perfect eggs!

sN73AcVCk0TpFSjvFVxZBw.text: Don't sleep on the diner!  I wasn't feeling that great but still wanted a traditional meal, so I ended up here on Thanksgiving day.  I guess everyone had the same idea or just wanted breakfast before their evening meal?! I don't know but the line was out the door and on the sidewalk.  I just wanted takeout and ordered the Thanksgiving special, turkey, stuffing, greens, mac n cheese.  It took just as long for takeout as it did to dine in, but other than that the food was really good, just what I wanted despite the long wait.  Although it was crazy busy, the staff handled it like champs with a smile and great attitudes.

3jsBaeuamuUfhWXG4uBMjg.text: Ok where to I begin.. If you want good down home Diner food, this is the place to be! Girls late morning breakfast/lunch and no one was disappointed! I had the fried chicken platter with onion rings and broccoli (had to laugh myself @ broccoli), but everything was great. The breakfast options looked amazing.  The server was prompt and not pushy, the music was on point and atmosphere friendly! I will def return to try breakfast.

uL-nGrgjC9I20yKCn_46rg.text: We dined here for a girls gathering. It was around lunch so we ordered brunch from the menu. Im from farina and oatmeal so grits have to be perfect for me to eat them. The creamy grits here were so good I wanted to lick the bowl, literally. It was hard to remember what else I ordered because they outshined my other food. The French toast was good too. The honey butter is so good. Our waitress seemed untrained and kept telling us take our time, even though we were ready to order. When I tried to pay she made a scene, saying my card's chip was defective. I gave her another card and she asked me to come to the register and put in my pin number. She said it must be because my card was attached to a bank from out of town. I was a bit frustrated at that point and refused to enter my pin. My sister put the meal on her card. Right after my sister offered to pay, another waitress told the manager that the register wasn't reading customer cards. They took her card to another register where the rung up my meal. I think customer service and training needs to be ongoing for wait staff.

Z2XByfBhRUoOtSYutcYcNw.text: I came out with 4 other people on New Years Eve around 12:30 am and we're seated fairly quick even though there was a line! Our server Dylan was nice and our food came out quickly!

ntssnXdsC8tBSaAAMSCsNA.text: Midnight Diner continues to score #1 in my gotta-go-to diners in Charlotte.  I get it's not everyone's cup; however, I love the food, the spirit of the staff, the great sounds from the juke, and the overall vibe of a place hitting on all cylinders.   I typically hang at the counter just to absorb the action.  Contagious.  Thanks CC for attending to me today.  Way up on my "Give 'em a whirl!" meter.

vIQQziK702PmX6SPInSInA.text: Great idea, horrible execution.... I'd give this zero stars if possible.  Came here late Saturday night/Sunday morning and nothing went right.  The wait was long, the waitress was terrible and forgetful, the refills never came, and the food was bland.  Great opportunity to put some grease on your stomach after a night of partying, but you're probably better off going home and grading a bowl of Frosted Flakes.  I'll never understand why this place is so popular....

Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

VQt9dw0cUSTe7TgYKnyeig.text: Desperation = Going to Midnight Diner when sober  Ever noticed a mile long line extending from a chrome covered building with neon lights, at 2AM? That's Midnight Diner. It's a combination of drunken millennials pouring out from Southend for a final meal before stumbling home and people leaving the always lovely Uptown Cabaret, looking to make a second poor decision. I've had my fair share of late nights here, which I'm not too proud of, so this is coming from direct experience.  It's all of the typical diner fare you would expect to see, only none of it is done very well. My drunken 2AM alter ego, that would normally demolish an unholy combo from Taco Bell, has been able to see right through the facade that is Midnight Diner. Laughable fried chicken that's either been over or under cooked, over cooked hash browns, those lovely neon yellow hotel continental breakfast-style eggs, and dry waffles. A burger is probably your best bet here.  On top of all that, you will normally have to wait a good bit to get in the door and trust me when I say, it's not worth it. One thing that has always been consistent is the service. They are trying to get you in and out as quickly as possible, which I can appreciate. You're better off heading South about a mile to Skyland Family Restaurant, where you can at least take advantage of the people watching and finally getting that unforgettable Snapchat story.  Prime location with an always boisterous crowd, long wait, and half-assed food...2/5.

h0EhKk_GNnzJ-71hA_CKXw.text: You know when you are having a crummy day, the weather is nasty and you just want a greasy spoon? This is the place. Pure "diner menu". I was able to get a greasy, delicious burger with an egg and bacon ("brunch burger") AND my fav, livermush (don't judge) on the side WITH fries. Service is with a smile and great conversation but it ain't the quickest place. So many choices here. Perfect for "those" days.

6S_zGBjkDhE4MkcP65EEOw.text: Service was excellent. Very reasonable prices where you basically pay for what you get. Satisfactory food but nothing special to make a point to go eat at.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Philly cheesesteak with fries
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Egg and sausage on a buttermilk biscuit with hash browns

FBIRSpRdoHr25UeW_2Ez1w.text: Five Stars all the way. All five of the stars are for our waitress. Peta was very attentive and gave us great recommendations since it was our first time. We had the Quarter Chicken White with Mac and Cheese and Mashed Potatoes and Gravy as well as the Hamburger Steak with Onion Rings and Collars Greens. All of the food was well prepared and seemed to be fresh.   If you have the opportunity to stop in and are so fortunate to get Peta as your waitress you will not be disappointed. I love her swag! :-).

YyaZ9RThvi-cwZNUmsFI8g.text: I just got done with a long day of travel and needed something close and quick. I came to the Midnight Diner and was so happy with the experience, the food, the service, everything!   I got the 1/4 white chicken, mashed potatoes, and collard greens. The chicken was cooked perfectly and so juicy. The potatoes weren't spectacular, but were pretty good. But the collard greens... oh my goodness were they delicious!! I finished it off with a root beer float... yum!   The service was great. David was helpful, kind, and attentive. This place was wonderful and will probably be a place I frequent while I'm here!

_eH43ASdw3scvmxuyR0kOg.text: Our food was very slow coming out of the kitchen my fish sandwich that I ordered was cooked outside to perfection but inside it was very cold so I did not enjoy the fish sandwich I took it home to heat it up. The  onion rings were great. The waiter iwas great he was actually amazing since we had such a long delay to get our food he did try his best to please us

pcoenOGHYzFdGj2YHRMX2w.text: If Southerners know one thing, it's breakfast.  In particular, you'd be hard pressed to find better biscuits anywhere besides the Deep South.    Midnight Diner looks like a diner you'd find somewhere along a highway in the northeast, but it's in basically downtown Charlotte.  I met some friends here for breakfast and loved my breakfast of a biscuit with two perfectly fried chicken tenders and a slice of cheddar cheese as well as the hash browns.  The hash browns were ideal in their simplicity of shredded potatoes.    And like many of my other Charlotte dining experiences, the service and value for the money couldn't be beat.    One of the best 24 hour dining options out there!

clzQHjWq7r4RlBo1-ZJyRg.text: Came in after a long drive on 7/6/19 at 10:00PM. We were sat immediately, and watched as waitresses and waiters walked passed helping everyone but us. For a Saturday they had ample wait staff but no one willing to actually wait on customers. We handed our menus to the hostess and told her we hadn't been waited on since we got there and left at 10:20.

Prk_PRgN1MFrxzcRiB2zTA.text: This is a great place to grab a late night meal after a evening of grown up beverages. Food is good and what you expect from a diner. Definitely give this place a shot, it gets busy so be prepared to wait a lit bit. Especially late night.

cDbTD_wnu9CqnISk2mF0Kw.text: Omg I have been here many times but this time I  tried the SHRIMP AND GRITS.  They should win an award for these.  I had to eat them slowly to savor the taste.  In addition we had an awesome waitress.  She was from Pittsburg  and was fabulous.

HLTq4u26ekLskrWiQxkCFw.text: Today was my first time at the classic Midnight Diner in uptown. We chose to eat here during the daytime/lunch hours due to easy parking, but unfortunately there were no spots. And the lot there charges $7 for 12 hours. Why not have an hourly system for when all the spots are taken?? Fortunately we parked and had waited around long enough that spots opened up in the "free" parking and then finally headed inside.   The Midnight Diner really has that old school Diner feel that I love. Their menu followed the same theme with a large breakfast offering and sandwiches and entrees as well. I ordered the chicken tenders and fries. The fries were really good and seasoned well, but the chicken tenders were not crispy at all and in fact we're kind of limp. I had to use a fork to dip them in the sauce because they kept falling apart.   For the price and atmosphere, I would definitely still come back, just probably would pick a different meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders and fries

CIanupqJzXsOXxWc9JEZVw.text: Midnight diner and go!!!!  Seating was great got there and was seated immediately. Staff was attentive (Shout out to Whitney)   It was like 0900 hours, I order the half fried chicken cause I'm an adult and that's what I wanted. Whitney told me it would be 25 minutes, it did t take that long  4 piece fried chicken canine with 2 sides (had a side salad and fries)   The chicken (Merts please pay attention) it was seasoned and fresh out the grease and on top of that Whitney had a side of some magnificent seasoning in a thimble on my plate just in case I needed more.  The old black lady was in the back doing work!!! The biscuit was soft and delicious and the fries were fresh. The only issue I had was the salad. Who ever is cutting up the lettuce needs to understand the core of the lettuce is TRASH. Apparently they didn't cause I had a bowl full of it. Nevertheless the chicken made up for the fail in this area.  I would go back definitely. Good spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. See that thimble full of greatness MERTS!!!

uCteNBPGbICpdpAENcHXQw.text: One meal- Shrimp and Grits! I've never had this combination before and I've always heard great reviews so I had to try it out and I'm a pretty picky eater! The reviews were right on point as ice ordered this 4 times so far and havent been let down yet! The service is always above average and unless you go during the weekday am hours you're going to have a little wait but it's never more than 15 minutes. The prices are outstanding and it's always more than enough food! I would recommend this for families or just when you're hungry at ANY time of the day one thing is for sure - the shrimp and grits will ALWAYS hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

bhyo8daei7g2keXCiwIUgA.text: This place is always packed and there is good reason why. The food is delicious. The shrimp and grits are my favorite. Those grits are amazing, if I don't order the shrimp grits, I get the chicken and waffles and order a side of grits. I don't leave out of here without getting some grits! LOL You will regret it if you do. Anyway, the menu can be overwhelming but they literally have everything you can think of to eat. Plus a small bar. Diner food and alcohol. WHY NOT?

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. chicken and French toast
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

_OqiIvBurKhA94HfvSyAkQ.text: Chicken and waffles, shrimp and grits -- both good and filling. Service is great, staff is super friendly. The only drawback is the wait. Skip coming after the club let's out and Saturday or Sunday morning unless you enjoy people-watching from the line.

b6wZRarc8P_CndvwDKc6cA.text: Flight was delayed and we were looking for a spot to eat. Everything from the atmosphere to the service felt very authentic. The bubba is solid. The midnight dinner special was good, if I had to give it another go I'd probably go with the waffle over the French toast but all of it was great. Never had grots before so to me they were great. Clarisa was nice as could be and was extremely knowledgeable. 9.5/10 only because it was raining and there isn't much cover when there is a line.

8B3qzjYD5csijJVLICDaCQ.text: Open 24 hours and still almost always busy! Love this spot for an alternative to Waffle House. Food is good. They serve breakfast all day as well as burgers and shakes - typical diner food! Service isn't always the best but that's okay.  If you're trying to go Sunday for brunch.. good luck haha

z3NrkPtAA2llk2hq4VVveQ.text: One of the few places open late night in Charlotte to dine in besides a pizza joint. I found this place on Yelp and people raved about the shrimp and grits so I wanted to find out what is all about. I must say it really lives up to the hype. It's made to order served in a large soup bowl and a biscuit to sop up the rest of your sauce. Grits were creamy and savory delicious. The shrimp was cooked perfectly. When I was done I wanted to lick the bowl so I didn't waste any of it. But I didn't because I'm in a public establishment.  The place looks like a classic diner, long a and narrow but plenty of seating. Even after midnight the place was pretty busy. The servers were very nice and attentive. I will definitely be coming back here the next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The front sign at midnight.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Close up of shrimp and grits
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The infamous shrimp and grits. It lives up to the hype. Get it. Delicious.

sROey7FIujn6fZR6TZvY7w.text: Back for a second time in two days. First day had the chicken and waffles. The chicken was piping hot and good. The waffle was a bit bland for my taste. I thought it was odd that the "buttery spread" (I learned was not real butter later) would not melt. My boyfriend had the pancakes, which I also thought were bland and also had the spread that just sat there. I guess I'm funny about real butter and expected more real, homey ingredients to go along with the nostalgic vibe. I'm also funny about being cold. It was freezing in the diner, which also likely contributed to the unmelted spread.   I would come back given the proximity to my place. The best item I've tried this far is the chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half chicken with two sides. Coleslaw was good. Macaroni was just ok.
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken wings, substituted the waffle for the French Toast (which was much better than the waffle).

LbM8yLX1tZlO7c8dQ5Zkyw.text: This place definately has the diner vibe but it does not have great breakfast. It can get very busy and servers may be delayed in taking your drink orders. Tight space but fairly cool diner set-up. Had the basics for breakfast and it was not good.

ugSRDKAwrDh_M13nJ3yKBw.text: Dinner or after Midnight eats... I have eaten here on many occasions and the food has never disappointed. Chicken and waffles and most of all the French Toast are good. The atmosphere is a little cluby after 12 and a lively diner before. Wouldn't go with more than 4 friends though and if you go after midnight be prepared to wait in line in and/or outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

rePtoIkY5Lo9cst5splz9A.text: The Shrimp and grits was some of the best I have ever had. The sauce is just the right mix of creamy and spicy. Exceptional.

tuYK84KlBd4GfX3KdB_FmA.text: Legendary, 24/7 Good Time Restaurant in uptown Charlotte. Even though Price's Chicken Coop is my favorite Fried Chicken, my wife prefers Fried Chicken here, at Midnight Diner.

GpSYwCn2Gy-Cp3rN7clTJA.text: Awesome driving to uptown Charlotte just to have breakfast at 6am before volunteering at Habitat for Humanity and finding a sign saying "Sorry we are Closed"

gbFMcyOPARrm8ieH9_JrnA.text: Back again for some optic Midnite Diner specialty in my opinion which is shrimp and grits comparing them against those I've had in the Low Country around Charleston simply superb. The group so smooth and creamy shrimp is flavorful and plentiful. That's not to say that they don't make them in fried chicken and other Southern Comfort foods that I do enjoy also. The service is down home friendly, quick, and efficient. Its hard not to find something not to like and please your palate with the Midnight Diner and they always open and ready for you.

3X3OB4TxzqZiL-6MioSKDQ.text: What can I say about the Midnight Diner???  Let's see....when you go here you should definitely expect an "experience". Whether it's the waiters and waitresses singing and dancing or the unique dining crowd which really just can't be explained...This place almost always makes one of those nights you and your friends will never forget.  But this review isn't based on any of that...these four stars are solely based on one dish...the shrimp and grits.   My goodness.   One bite of these grits will have you asking yourself: "Where in the hell did that come from??" These grits are creamy, dreamy and steamy (if I could think of another rhyming word I would use it) Top that awesomeness with shrimp and I just really don't know what else to say. Geesh...I loved them!   Seriously, if you can manage to find a parking spot and actually get a booth this place is totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Waffles...always add grits!!!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits

FkyqRr-oZQwHW_F6kNxNgA.text: In town for the weekend, a charlotte resident recommended this place and im glad we did! Best grits i ever had! The fried chicken was excellent, perfectly done....juicy and crispy! Based on reviews i swapped the waffle for french toast which not surprising was delicious!  The waitress was a sweetheart. We definitely plan on going nack tomorrow to try out more....the menu had so much to choose from everything sounded so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and french toastl!!! And the midnight special with side of bacon....all done perfectly! OMG those grits!

0mSCVATGlggZJCeVBK5thw.text: Got into Charlotte on a late flight and needed something to eat...with limited options at 12:30am gave it a shot. Ordered a Bubba special...wow that's a lot of food!!... Sausage gravy was amazing...Biscuits great and eggs done just right...sausage was the only let down...dry and no flavor but we'll definitely be back to try other options!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

GkS38VzzyjEWUqojZb36-A.text: This place is always over crowded it seems like and the food that I had I wasn't pleased with and it's always something happening here as far as crime. This place is always on the news it seems like and it's never for the food I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody I have people that swear by it and I have some people that feels the same way I do... I say try at your own risk rather it be the food or your life lol

uXQzlZYIxFFq_exKN2vRjQ.text: We walked in for lunch expecting to wait for a table today.  We was seated right away.  Service was extremely fast.  For was very good for a diner.  Staff was very friendly. I ordered  Shrimp and Grits. It was very tasty and just enough kick to it.  My friend order wings and French Toast.  Wasn't enough for him to eat.  Only 2 pieces of French Toast and two little wings.  Wish there was more so I could have tasted the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. French Toast and Wings
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits

uIhrSmjBY5_Ia9T5ymGvww.text: Very interesting diner, really does seem like nothing has changed since these types of diners were THE thing. The place is crowded and parking is pretty rough. The overall cleanliness is pretty poor but not horrible.   Service was pretty slow but nothing absurd.   Food was very good for diner food, however I'll say it's usually expected to be over fed at a diner...  This is not the case here. Serving sizes are pretty small.

7Aoh6kK54waGLyD15vnT8g.text: My favorite restaurant in Charlotte. The service could be better, but the food is so good it doesn't matter.

Vze4P1nuzQ4PuBwXurHQ4Q.text: "Carolina" Burger?  Well, sort of.  A real Carolina style burger or dog has plain old yellow mustard on it, guys.  And the chili, slaw and onions need to be on the same side of the meat pattie so the flavors of those condiments can meld together.   These two adjustments will significantly improve your "Carolina" burger!     Having said that, this is a good spot for a quick lunch, so it gets 4 stars overall.  It is clean and friendly with a varied menu.

tTxDid0yBg56MltU9R57Zw.text: I had a great experience and delightful tasting food today. The service was awesome (shout out to my waitress Ericka Harrison) as I was constantly checked on and my food came out shortly after coming off the burners. If you're in the neighborhood then stop by and check out this place. You won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Fish Dinner! Awesome :-)
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best view in the place
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is one of my favorite spots to eat..when the service is fair, but the food here is always good!!!

jChVvEqhP4LtbSYtH_QH8g.text: Best southern meal during my three days in Charlotte.  The waitress was a sweetheart and helped me order something I'll never forget!  Livermush, two eggs over easy, a biscuit and grits.  I like liver, so the taste was up my alley. It's really the texture that surprised me; a super crispy crunchy outside with a pate like texture inside. The biscuit was fluffy and not greasy. The eggs were perfectly runny. But honestly, the grits style the show for me.  I had been haggling my friend to get me some outstanding grits, and by bringing me here; he did. Super creamy and thick with the right amount of salt.   I cleaned my plate better than the guys at my table.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Livermush, grits, two eggs over easy and a biscuit.

ZMqcVmo-xexTmZdJEZXVCw.text: I eat here every time I'm in Charlotte. It's a 24 hour spot that has some of the best pancakes i've tasted. The shrimp and grits are also delicious! Be prepared for a wait, it's a popular spot in town. The staff is always friendly and they move the crowd quickly. The prices are great and the food never disappoints.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits.

qgm39ORRClWnVEwAs6NT0w.text: Went here at the end of a "late night adventure" and this is one of the best places to go to for that. We were there close to midnight. Even though we had to wait, we didn't have to wait too long. Once seated, a server was there immediately to get drink orders started. Food order went in and it wasn't but a few minutes before we were served. I wouldn't say the food was out of this world, but it was exactly what we were looking for. It hit the spot.

TYnXq3OqjN3gt6HDnNIHkg.text: Above-par for diner food. I'd skip the grilled cheese but the chicken soup is great.  This place never disappoints for late-late-night dining, people watching and tunes.

rahWUs2lFAT7ZScGwS_23w.text: Now this is my kind of a place! Well worth the 3 block walk from the conference center to a 24/7 diner with the best grits I have ever had in my life. Stopped in for jambalaya for lunch and went back the next morning for a 5:30 breakfast called "The Bubba" - wow - large biscuit smothered with cheddar scrambled eggs then smothered with sausage gravy, three links and grits.

OZcyTAO6X0xd1x72n50tNA.text: Great place!  Food was good, bit of a wait for a table but that just tells you how good it is!  Once my cholesterol goes back down, I'll be back for the big breakfast again!!!

h3TUOU35rIgoxcaFtvrcMg.text: OMG! You must try the shrimp and grits. I crave them all time. Mmmmmm.  Cute diner, service was kind and nice

DuUBgvBum09UZlcsMn8jPw.text: To start off, I absolutely love this place. I live in downtown so this is such a convenient place to grab food after working late. It's exceptional diner food! I'm wary about ordering veggie burgers, but it's actually pretty good. But what keeps me coming back are the scattered hasbrowns! With a side of toast and scrambled eggs of course, and its under $4! My only qualm is if you're getting food to go, check it first, sometimes the guys in the back don't pay as much attention to the order. If you're headed there past 11pm definitely say whats up to Maria, you can't miss her!

FtyLo9nmbZTHNijukuXjjA.text: Save your money, buying food here is like throwing it in the trash.  Went in to pick up some takeout, all the waitresses were arguing with each other for ten minutes before they asked me if I needed help, mind you I was standing at the front door. When they look at my order they tell me they're out of everything  pretty much, no chocolate shakes, so I got a rotten milk vanilla one,  no Mac n cheese, so I got these disgusting blob they called mashed potatoes.  The grilled cheese sandwich had cardboard for bread and the cheese was cold. The. The BLT was just as disgusting. They lost my business for sure, oh yeah, and make sure you take plenty of change for the 5-10 homeless people hanging out in the parking lot

6jlGE0FBbDiJDuYHWHnGCw.text: I just ate at this place last Saturday while looking for a good brunch spot.  The options were many and everyone in my group chose the chicken and waffles.  They were very good, especially for the price.  Not as good as Roscoe's or Gladys Knight's, but a good backup in the Charlotte area.  Will definitely come back and am really excited about the late night hours.  This will be a new spot after the club!

8YfzYVFaguNsA83fdzJFtQ.text: I have to say, I don't understand these negative reviews at all! I had lunch there yesterday about 1pm with a group of four people and we had excellent food and service. Four out of the five of us ordered burgers and they were delicious _ really flavorful and moist. Perfectly cooked. Onion rings were lightly battered and tasty, too. One of our group ordered the fried chicken and he said it was amazing; great biscuit and mac and cheese, too. Our waitress couldn't have been more helpful and service was extremely prompt. I like the diner-deco decor very much and it's a lot more spacious then you think it would be from the outside. We work across the street and are planning on becoming regulars here!

1zs1tYnqnhQFm3NC0LC9kg.text: Where else can you get a shot of Jack Daniels with your breakfast?  A truly 1 of a kind atmosphere.  Why settle for IHOP when you can come here?

sK9-wAOoWO9q-RkmO-52lw.text: good food, good service, classic diner with a counter.

vIvzpdN9jPOzo3_1s51TIA.text: Fish San was really good. Mac n cheese just like moms.

JNTwBBEEwQ3ibqOVPwWiyA.text: Food is great. Service is terrible. Got kicked out for wanting to place a to go order. About 2 am on 5/14/15 there was a line waiting to to sit, like usual. So I walked past the line to the inside and to the register, as i usuallly do, to place a to go order. I have "skipped" the line several times before to place a to go order bc there is no need to to wait in line if ur not waiting to be seated. All the while i had called ahead to place my to go order  and was placed on hold. I was still waiting on Hold on the phone as I approached the register to place my to go order. I was approached by 3 officers and was told to leave the facility and that I needed to wait at the end of the long line  to place a to go order. I was extremely upset but I went to the end of the line anyway and called back about 39 times. After the 40th time I called someone finally picked up and I asked for a supervisor or  corporate number. I was told there was no corporate number and then i was hung up on. Terrible service wouldn't recommend going here unless you were desperate for food.

fBEk5IMtd_2zz7R7PAD7vg.text: Finally uptown has a late night spot to eat! I've been to the diner several times and the food and service is always good. Love the grits and and the open-face sausage, egg and cheese biscuit! I like that I can take my family there during the day and the girls and I late night!

_kDa7EkM621fsazncEmB-Q.text: Would only go here late at night if nothing else was open.  Nothing stands out.  Service is competent  most times, not great.  Bottom line if you have eaten at the Skyland Restaurant then you know what to expect from this place.

VAzIjdyNpbaT1TGxqEyaCw.text: I went to the Midnight Dinner one night after Yoga.  I probably should have gone before.  I enjoyed the fried chicken.  I did not like the mashed potatoes or the vegetable.  They could have provided as other post mentions some lemon pepper seasoning, garlic or something to give the vegetables a nice touch.  I willl probably go again just for the chicken.

HzbSr5iacSZvhsYmPq4uRg.text: Something about this place that just kind of sneaks up on you unexpectedly when you first come upon it. I've always been sort of a night owl roaming around Uptown in search of social events to keep myself entertained and I spot this retro looking dinner that apparently is 24/7 which is terrific because I can't think of a better area in town that could benefit from a restaurant like that (There was an older one back in the day near the CPCC central campus but it had to close due to that school's vast expansion) The appeal of the place was too enticing and I was due for a meal anyhow so I popped in to give them a try. It's not a huge place but sizeable enough to handle the type of steady traffic they would generate. The nostalgic feel is replicated on the inside as good as it's exterior. The menu offers a nice variety of what you what expect from an all hours place with enough breakfast & dinner choices to suit all tastes. They on the menu some different shakes & deserts that looking promising although I haven't gotten around to trying them yet. They also have some beer\wine choices and they are willing to make you a mixed drink but they don't really advertise any particular kinds so it could be sort of hit or miss depending on what they have on hand. The food quality in very solid, won't blow you away but never anything that would keep you from coming back for more.  All in all, a nice diversion from the chain restaurants in the world  that is well worth a visit if you need a good meal in the uptown\south end area!

70hs5MTt8ODq9aAEByXlMw.text: great kind service and atmosphere. awesome chicken sliders and an even better strawberry milkshake. yummy meal for only $7-$8. i'm so glad its so close!

UTl0VLHSomkHVodWwsoSKA.text: Tried Midnight diner tonight for the first time. Meh describes it perfectly. Had Gails famous chicken salad sandwich hubby had club sand. both bland had to keep adding pepper to the chicken salad to get some kind of taste. Saturday night at 7:00 and they were out of banana pudding? Who does that? This was supposed to be one of their famous desserts! Don't you think if you saw you were running low Saturday morning you could whip some up since it is supposed to be made "in house"? We have tried Madies and like it better it also got a better write up in the paper from food critic, it is just a little hard to find but food was better and better value for the money. Will not go back.

heRdojaWFuQjpwt2qCOrig.text: Stop by after a Christmas party on a Saturday night; the place was jamming!  As most places like this on a Saturday late night it was packed.  Every seat cushion filled and the jukebox blaring some "ol' skool" seventies soul!  People who come here looking for a Maitre d'Hotel, check that at the door.  Here your going to get a wait staff who dance, call you sweetheart and try to keep up with the huge influx of late orders.  What do you think you going to get from a late night diner.  I can tell you what you should get at a late night diner.  From this one get the French toast!  It is unbelievable!  Made from fresh challah bread it's soft and gooey like hot caramel!  Did I mention it was large?  Oh my, you know it's homemade from the size of the slices!  I ate mine without syrup, because it was so good I simply forgot about it!  Going back tonight to get the shrimp and grits!  See ya there at Midnight or later!

UiEWxZzbK0Z4phGI7yKzng.text: First time here while visiting Charlotte. Nice environment. Food was delicious will definitely visit again when I'm in Charlotte.  My boys loved there food.

wmOInn7DaEAwSc1YR82uuw.text: Good place to dine in with friends its good here you have to wait its popular dinner its loud as well

mJl6hPyj8xzkT15Gc5GinQ.text: I generally love diner food, but it's not here. I visit this location at least 4 times a year hoping it would change -- each visit lowers the expectations a little more. I ordered a simple 2 eggs, sausage and rye toast and it took in excess of 25 minutes. Why?  The eggs were wrong, then the toast, and finally it was cold. The wait staff remains disorganised. The service window is too small. The place could use a makeover  to decrease staff congestion.  I will try again in the new year.

mOhEGV-MtC0hVPkaZhtH1A.text: One of the worst diners in charlotte. Always crowded, loud and dirty. Everytime we go we get horrible service and nasty cold food. Will never go again. Tried giving it a second chance but it was an over failed attempt. If you want to be around rude, loud, obnoxious drunk people by all means go and try to make a good time out of it. But I do not reccomend it at all.

9xCOZ0UXmWtfW75mXW_x7A.text: Great Diner Food...24/7.....Slack Service!  Been going here for a few years now.  Up until this  year... I would have given it 5 stars.  I love the food but have to say that they really need to tighten up the slack in the service.  They used to have a solid wait staff that had great energy and worked really well together.   They were entertaining and on the ball!   Now it seems like they have twice as many employees and the service is much less efficient.  Everyone moves at a glacial pace.  When you pull in, you can almost count on the majority of the wait staff being in the back parking lot on smoke break.    The visit before last, we got there at shift change.  NEVER GO AT SHIFT CHANGE!!!!  They happened to get slammed and everyone got confused and in the weeds.  After 15 minutes, I had to flag someone down just to see if we were going to have a server.   After our order was put in and the food was delivered.... Our server never came back to fill a drink....and we had to flag her down to pay the tab.    I've watched food being auctioned off to the wrong tables, drinks spilled, dinner plates dropped etc.  It gets quite comical actually. No one seems to know what's going on there anymore.  This past visit, there was a table that sat right beside us and it took 10 minutes for them to even be acknowledged.  One waitress asked the other waitress "Do you want them?" (Right in front of the customer)... They both rolled their eyes and walked off.  Eventually another server stopped to help them.    I think management needs to take a serious look at how things are being run and even possibly reclaim some of qualities that their former wait staff used to have.  All in all, I'll keep going because I like the food.... But I may really have to think hard about going because of what I know is in store for the service.   Perhaps they should can the smoke breaks.

p20kNwf1d_cMKdpC3fi75w.text: i had been hearing about this place for a long time and finally decided to go. what a mistake! rude staff, my order was wrong and it was more of a problem to correct it. i will never, patronize this business again a waste of $45!

GWF7vP-s4MiXP1z8wOM3RA.text: The shrimp and grits was amazing! The Grits was nice and creamy. The shrimp was cooked just right with sauteed vegetables! Served with a light fluffy biscuit! It was absolutely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Creamy grits &amp; shrimp cooked just right with sauteed vegetables! Served with a light fluffy biscuit! It was absolutely delicious!

iKoAI5OaghamIW_a2LlG7Q.text: I wouldn't want to work here as there is a high level of drunks at certain times but the food is pretty decent for a diner.    The crowd is bizarre because it can be completely empty or it can be a 45 minute wait at random times.  I order a couple things regularly...  chicken and waffles, grilled cheese, or just a regular omelet.  Everything is pretty decent and the menu is huge.  Much better than going to waffle house.

OhGiBuEXXaaGCj04a2J0UQ.text: I walked in. It took 30 seconds before someone came and sat me at a booth. Then waited over 7 minutes before I got up and walked out. There were over 5 servers just talking to each other or using their cell phone on the floor. Service was void. Can't say anything about the food. I did notice that plates being picked up had lots of food on them. Not sure if people who eat here don't like leftovers or just didn't enjoy the food the 1st time around. I probably saved $15.00 not staying.

N5-M4RNi29aDshci-2_yVw.text: So the shrimp and grits were great. Will definitely get these again. The pecan and regular waffles were great and slightly sweetened as my son and I do not eat maple syrup. They were light and fluffy and tasted great with nothing on them. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the mac and cheese. Although homemade and cheesy it had no flavor/ seasoning.  But it's nice the food came out fairly quickly, hot, and correct.  The servers all seem to have great attitudes.

Dluo1k1eb00ocGM4MRWbCA.text: I only get the french toast and wings. The French toast is phenomenal. They use challah bread which is perfect. The wings are just okay.

P3cWA1zNAccqzIM3RObrKA.text: Best grits ever, since New Orleans. French toast was OK. Mine's better. Very small, but surprisingly, they were able to cram a bunch in. In from out of town, so we stopped for breakfast before checking out the grace covenant church.

AgfzhpXB0TriV7hPgPu0Tg.text: This is my second time at Midnight Diner! I first went in July 2016! I heard it was diner food so, I wasn't expecting too much. And I think that's what makes it great, you get more than you bargain for! First let me say 'Order the grits' always! They have flavor and are so creamy. The first time I got the waffle it was good, but, tonight I got the French toast and it was great! the food is amazing! The atmosphere is regular diner atmosphere. So it's fast pace. Great for early mornings or late nights!

gckwlkHJSJHPoNvRAqNcig.text: The freaking sweet tea is freaking awesome and the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich...well, you'd have to be an ass to mess that up. Now the service: the service is subpar. I have been at least 7 times and half of those times have been orders called in for pickup. The women on the phone are usually pretty rude and rush you off but I guess that is because they are also running around to tables, either way, each customer should get the time they need if they are ordering, paying for their food AND have the opportunity to tip you. When you go in for pickup, you typically have to wrestle an elephant and do a handstand to get anyone to pay attention to you so that you may pay for your food which is sitting RIGHT behind the counter waiting to be paid for and eaten.  Great place to go for the quality of food and is open 24 hours. Will return here so long as I worked 5 minutes from this place.

ysrrSRSJ4xHvOgWSLBgkYw.text: You come in and they have like 4 documents with rules posted on them and "crime stoppers" tape up in the entry to keep you in place. The "hostess" put up the hostess booth up against the doors to keep us from entering and treated us like we were criminals for trying to enter the diner. No matter what the food tastes like it was not worth dealing with the way we were treated by the hostess

OelWiIV3F13ecHXjfSazJg.text: The fried chicken was very good, better than any other sould food place in the area.  The place was a little dirtier than it was a few years ago.  Sanitation grade is a borderline 90.  Floors were very dirty although it had not rained.

B_fFqvP7T0xF2mOecewCxQ.text: Where do I start?  First off we waited an hour for a table not because it was that busy but because a family member of someone who works for the restaurant came and got seated before us.  I understand the game of the "hook up" but when we have 4 kids and a big party and the restaurant only accommodates 2 big parties... moving forward we sit to our table and it's cold as Christmas in NYC at this table.  To change things around Our waitress Tammy was the bomb!  She made our experience awesome!  She got the the AC turned down and just loved her job.  Some folks hate waiting tables, but she loves her job and her customers!  After being with her I felt it was a reason we had to wait.  The food was good too.  I had shrimp and grits and a side of country ham.  We had a party of 7, and our bill was $80... how nice.  Those hot biscuits was so good... we tipped her well because she changed our heart on this place especially visiting from out of town.

kOtMXazvXyOGbwlpvPpf-w.text: This is my first day in NC and I'm hooked already!! Very reasonable prices, quick and friendly service, and AMAZING food!!!!!!. A friend recommended this to me when I asked where the nearest Waffle House was. She swore I wouldn't be disappointed, and boy was she right! I had the shrimp and grits which were far better than I could've imagined!! I've had shrimp and grits before but nothing like this. My son had the most tender chicken strips I've ever tasted, and everything was hot and fresh as well. Not a big fan of the macaroni but I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The most tender and juicy chicken strips I&#39;ve ever had!!!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. FABULOUS!!!!!!!
Photo of Midnight Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. The sweet tea is exceptional!!!

GerYPfXPvUhTrYkgXsRkJg.text: This will probably be our next go to diner. We just moved to the Charlotte area and are huge diner people. Prices were very reasonable and our food was great. My husband ordered the corn beef slam and I ordered the firecracker shrimp salad. I wasn't a huge fan of the creamy Parmesan dressing but if you like Caesar dressing then this is the dressing for you. We went in at 2:30pm on a Wednesday and were seated right away. Also, it's open 24hrs!

YCpVM-snXlfAnrb3Xla5DQ.text: Got the bleu buffalo chicken sandwich and it tastes like soap or the bleu cheese was fresher than fresh. Got fries that were frozen and gross. First time trying this place in a drunken crave but would never return. Most likely the worst items I have ever had after 10pm.  15 bucks down the drain.

802exFix7tWyhwbo0xueeg.text: Decent food but nothing special, decent prices.  Good place to eat late at night when youre drunk

PSCuQ9Qd0VRy3djFy7XSjw.text: I had the chicken and waffles and they are amazing!! There was a little wait.  The service was excellent.

eI3w7TRY4iw9_8szi7A5Ag.text: I absolutely hate waiting in lines for a seat at a restaurant but I'm glad my partner made me do it. Great food friendly staff really a fun experience.

aMQIh3KNuQl3xZZLU-CvjA.text: Midnight Diner was highly recommended by several of my friends from Charlotte, so I was fairly excited when my parents decided to go to a diner Halloween night. From the exterior, it definitely gives you the look and feel of a classic diner. Wide open windows with the hustle and bustle of many people coming in during the late night. Parking is located directly to the right of the building if you facing the diner. We were seated fairly quickly on a Saturday night with no problems. The staff was very friendly, welcoming, and attentive. We were seated directly next to the juke box which customers can pick songs of their choice and shake a tail feather if they'd like. Although, I'm sure that would be quality entertainment if a customer started dancing in the middle of a diner. Well, as far as the food, they offer a wide variety of choices from coconut french toast, to chicken and waffles, to desserts. I opted for the chicken and waffles which was I was very pleased. The chicken was crisp, juicy, and flavorful. You should definitely check this place out if you're in the mood for a classic diner. The leather seats, juke box, and fast paced service definitely helped. Can wait to go back and try the grits that everyone is raving about. Overall, good find in Downtown Charlotte that open 24 hours a day.

qsdx8-qib7zX5DB7FZXfwQ.text: IT DOESNT GET ANY BETTER WHEN IT COMES OT LATE NIGHT DINING!!  You MUST request Doug or Maria as your waiter THEY ARE AMAZING!!  You will get the best service from them.  The food what cna I say..  It the BEST!!    I personally order the Quarter Dark chicken with Mac and Cheese, with Green beans and A Waffle.  They are famous for there fried chicken here.  There burgers are great, The chili cheese fries are to die for here.  Healthy portions and you defitnely get your moneys worth here.    The is a great place ot sober up have a fun meal with your late night friends and people watch!!  You will see people walk thru that door of ALL SHAPES AND SIZE!!  :)

7Y07vte0ow-vFAYbHuOuRQ.text: Went to the Diner yesterday for the first time. I have no complaints about the food. The grits are creamy, some of the best I've had. Everyone at the table enjoyed their food. What I don't get is their fanatical insistence on "No Substitutions". To be fair, though, it may have been our server, who was not very pleasant even when he introduced himself. He was clearly irritated when 2 of our party asked for simple substitutions.   If my breakfast comes with either bacon or turkey bacon, what's the big deal if you get a Club sandwich and request turkey bacon and ask them to leave off the ham? The server rolled his eyes, and said he thought that might be OK. When the food came  out, though, none of the substitutions were honored. I think that's ridiculous. I know substitutions may slow up the kitchen, but come on...  The food was good enough, though, that we will be back. We will just know to order dishes that require NO SUBSTITUTIONS.

LPHK0mevFRM06i-1KLVrgA.text: Loved the nostalgic feel. Breakfast was delicious. Belgium waffle was perfectly browned and shaped, so were the pancakes, and French toast. It was a very busy place, yet we were still sat and served very quickly.

25osEH9D5q35WLFJMP-WAQ.text: A busy, popular diner. There's a bit of a wait if you go on the weekends but if you get there early enough it's not too bad. The food was good. I had the pancakes and they were melt in your mouth fluffy. Good food and friendly service. Like someone else stated, the parking is bad but that's my only con.

5xshpQ_xbBYzoY0N6myCQQ.text: Holy French Toast Batman. I took a friend here Saturday for breakfast as he had never been. Silly boy didn't realize what he had been missing out on. Though the line was out both doors we were still seated within about 10 mins. I like that. Our server, like always, was great with a good personality. I ordered the French Toast and it was thick with lots of flavor. The bacon was also think and not too crispy, but just perfect. The boy got biscuit and gravy which were to die for. The biscuit was super fluffy and delish! I keep telling myself I am going to try the chicken and waffles....perhaps next time!

eDnQY0VPfrPKzhQxu9esvg.text: I have mixed feelings about this place, but I continue to eat here often due to its proximity to my house (right across the street). There are certain things that they do very well, Chicken and Waffles, Shrimp and Grits, and breakfast. These are the only things that I have had here and they have all been exceptional (expect one time, see below)  You know whats coming now. Sometimes the service is spotty. Everyone is always very nice, but they seem weeded all the time! I once was sitting at the bar and stared at my food in the window for like 10 mins. When I eventually asked the manager to pass it over, it was mostly cold.   That aside, I think that the Diner filled a much needed void in downtown Charlotte and I will continue to be a cautious customer.

CsNBu6KDP0lARYhuxrKSKQ.text: Came for breakfast today , I had the midnight breakfast platter . Had a mimosa , it wasn't all that great but then again this is a diner . My meal was decent and my server was friendly .

sXJpmfuxJcnOD16tJJVg8g.text: I loved the food.  They have the best French toast ever! The Turkey bacon and eggs were also good. If you can sit outside, that is best.  If not, know that t is really noisy inside.

WsPT3uQIgPKCfiiuGTVJfw.text: The Midnight Diner is a great choice for inexpensive comfort food and breakfast anytime. The fried chicken is especially good and I love the shrimp & grits. No wine though - only beer & liquor - kinda weird!

_4l-JPxTSNYOB_855_Pq2w.text: Generally, since we only had dessert, I wouldn't review Midnight Diner until I went back for a full meal. The thing is I don't see that happening.  While the decor is completely charming (a clean, bright rendition of the classic diner vibe), the hours are where it's at (all of them), and the cake that I tasted (a bite of chocolate and many bites of carrot) was rich and delicious the overall experience was soured by the service.  Our waiter hovered over our booth (his only table at the post-midnight time) and kept asking if we were ready to order even though he was literally watching us still discuss what to split. Only once we decided on the brownie sundae, which he had suggested, did he tell us they were out of some of the ingredients. Maybe it's because I really hate feeling rushed or doing things twice, but by the time I ate fraction of my huge piece of cake I really had no desire to return. The food may be good, but there are other places to get good diner food in the wee hours in CLT.

_wetgD8w5nl960G3lpxi5w.text: As a self proclaimed Charlotte foodie I had to try out the midnight diner. Our server was awesome. My only concern for this restaurant is that it could be a little cleaner. One of my pet peeves when I go out to eat is when there is food all over the seat when I go to sit down. The seat was sticky with syrup and crumbs. I ordered the chicken and waffles and it was delicious. I would definitely go back just for that!

lfKCwa0bhfjv-dJzu-jZyg.text: Late night food, amazing service and adult beverages too!  Outstanding experience!  Must try!

izbgx1DSop7eHYVBDokvhg.text: The place is honestly okay when you can get some service. They have a crew of half wit waitresses that I heard arguing on who was suppose to do their job and then decided to not do it all! My husband and I stood there 10 minutes being completely ignored. I very rarely get a night out anymore, so I turned around and left and took my business to Amelie's. At least there I'll get service and not a rude waitress that won't do their job and would rather gossip!

HSXVEB5QCzmBnMFMmi-M8w.text: Horrible!  Don't waste your time or your money on this awful place.  Terrible service, dirty surfaces, food is one step above a frozen dinner...  just terrible.  We ordered what we thought would be the easist menu items, burgers & fries and breakfast = both choices were yucky.  We've been twice, thinking that we should give it a fair shake, but were highly disappointed on both occasions by the dingy, forgetful wait staff and the food that left A LOT to be desired.   We eat out every meal, every day but we will not be back to the Midnight Diner.

eaYuynGgEZRfu1JUBhVVJw.text: Okay so maybe I did dance with one of the waitresses next to the jukebox. Don't judge me! Heh, the staff is friendly and the jukebox jams will cheer up any unhappy camper. I applaud them for that and keeping their cool when dealing with these obnoxious, immature ruffians at all waking hours from all corners and crevices in which they crawled from (I plead the fifth!).  Nothing glamorous, just your average diner with average food. But, with it being one of the few spots in the QC open 24 hours, how can you go wrong? Automatic bonus points for that and more bonus points for them serving fried chicken and mac 'n cheese alllllll damn day! Can I get an Amen?!

z5F3oVlRrToYnZe0eRB6Fg.text: This place is awesome. They're open late, the service is good, the food is incredible, they have it all. I had the quarter fried chicken (white) and it was great. It doesn't look like a place that would have good fried chicken, but looks are definitely deceiving sometimes. This was easily some of the best fried chicken I've had in this city. 4-Cheese Macaroni, tasty green beans, and even the french fries are good. Parking is a bit of a hassle but other than that you can't beat this joint.
